Summary Heading: Really nice, just go out for breakfast.
Summary: Very nice room, very clean. Nice comfortable beds. Parking was maybe a little tight but ok. Good location. Really the only thing that could be improved on is the complementary breakfast they have. It's like they came up with idea that morning.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your review! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. We're glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay! Our breakfast is a little limited at the time as we are renovating our breakfast room, we are sorry for the inconvenience. Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary: We booked this property again after having stayed there earlier in the year. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast is good and rooms were clean. I’ve never had any issues with noise either. Great location to Disneyland. Will stay there again!
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your review! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. We're glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us! Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary Heading: During the remodel, breakfast offerings are limited
Summary: During the remodel, breakfast offerings are limited but staff is nice. Also, there is now a charge for parking so that took away from the value. Beds also were not ad cozy as last year, hopefully they will be replaced in the remodel.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your review! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. We're sorry to hear that your stay wasn't up to our usual standards. We are currently replacing the mattresses. Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary: I usually stay here when traveling with my grandson's, as they suites are great.  This time I was on a solo trip, so I stayed here for two reasons, the cost of room and I felt safe coming and going from this hotel.  Only negatives I have are breakfast was being held in a different room, due to updating the normal breakfast room, and was not up to their normal standards and the swimming pool was down for refurbishment.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your review! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. We're glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us! We are sorry for the inconvenience with the refurbishments, we are trying to make the hotel better for all of our guests. Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary: This hotel was very nice to stay in, the staff were nice and it is close to Anaheim attractions. The hotel offers breakfast which was better then the previous hotels i had stayed in in LA. They are also very good about looking after bags before check in and after check out.

Summary Heading: BEST HOTEL NEAR DISNEYLAND!! OUR 5TH TIME HERE!
Summary: I can’t believe this is our 5th time staying at this hotel! We love it this much. I’m sorry I have not reviewed our great experiences before. We’ve stayed in their character themed suites are regular king size rooms, they’ve all been great. Breakfast is delicious and it comes in handy when you’re in a rush to leave to Disneyland in the morning. Not to mention the money that we’ saving on complimentary breakfast, it’s worth it. I’m extremely picky and have high standards when it comes to the cleanliness of hotels. I have no complaints for this hotel, it exceeds my expectations.   One last thing that’s extremely important, the beds are sooooooo comfortable. I have back problems and wake up with no back ache here. I wish I would take this bed home with me.   Highly recommend this

Summary: We had a great experience. We were traveling for a trip to Disneyland and California Adventures. The room was a great value compared to other Disney hotels. Staff was incredibly friendly and the room was clean. Our children really enjoyed having their own private room and bunk beds in the family suite we stayed in. There are lots of shops and places to eat all within walking distance which was great. Our only “complaint “ would be the air conditioning. I believe it may have been more of a cooler type set up so the room had a bit of a damp/humid feel. However even with that said we would stay again.

Summary: This was a nice enough motel, maybe not quite as nice as the photos on their website make it look.  But we enjoyed our stay.  Check in was fine, friendly and efficient clerks at the desk.  The room was clean, and the daily maid service kept it that way.  Convenient to Disneyland, by bus that stops in front of the motel. The breakfast was nothing to write home about, merely adequate.  But the motel was fine and I would probably stay there again, if I should ever venture another Disneyland trip.

Summary Heading: Great for the price in Disneyland area
Summary: The room was great for where it is. It is hard to find lower priced and nice hotels in the Disneyland area and this one is great. The only thing is the upstairs people would stomp around really hard most nights so it made it hard to fall asleep. Also the ART bus was not consitant in it's time but that is not the hotel's fault. The perk about that ART pass is it stops right by the hotel. Great breakfast and really awesome staff. We will stay here again when we go to Disney.

Summary: We always stay at  the "Stanford" if we holiday in the US.  We have always found the staff friendly and very helpful and although the  rooms may be getting alittle "dated" they are always very clean. Easy walk to Disneyland and there are several restaurants also nearby. I'd highly recommend this motel....it's a great place to stay.

Summary: I’ve stayed at the Stanford many times in the past and always enjoyed it for value, cleanliness and friendliness. This time I found the front staff not friendly or helpful. Our room hadn’t finished being cleaned when we checked in at midnight. We found a cleaning rag on our bathroom vanity and no soaps etc. The room was dated, and smelled musty. The breakfast staff are still great, friendly and helpful but the food itself has definitely gone down hill. I’m not sure I will be staying here anymore. The shuttle stop right out front for Disney is very convenient though.

Summary: Our first family trip to Disneyland.  We considered staying on the Disney property, but decided to spend our money at the park rather than in a hotel room.  Stanford was a perfect fit for us.  Pretty close to the park, but far enough away that the room rates were reasonable.  Let me set your expectations.  The place is a bit old and you can tell.  The finishes are dated and you can tell the rooms have been in service for many years.  That being said, things are well maintained.  We stayed in the suite with bunk beds in a separate room with a second bathroom.  Kids loved it!  The breakfast (included) was pretty good with enough options to make everyone happy and the staff was really nice.  We didn't ask for much, but when we did the staff was on top of the request. We were able to get our tickets for Disney with out the hassle to make a line overall we had a fantastic experience with stanford inn definitely for the price and service I will recommend to my friends and I will stay there in our next vacation.

Summary: The only hotel I found with family rooms. Two queen beds in one room and twin bunk beds in the other room. Two bathrooms with sink and mirror outside which was so nice to get ready while someone else showered. The staff was great! Everything we needed was taken care off quickly. Breaksfast was great. They had scrambled eggs, sausage, and potatoes, additional to the usual continental breakfast. We had new towels and a clean room everyday. The beds were comfortable. Fridge and mircrowave included in room. The only issue was the carpet. Walking barefoot turned my feet black super quick. I know some rooms have hardwood floors but they were all booked when we arrived. Overall a pleasant stay for the price

Save your wallet and stay here, I promise you and the kids will Love it as much as we do

Summary Heading: Best stay for our big family & money!
Summary: We booked the Family Suite with 2 Bathrooms for our family of 6. We stayed 5 nights and the staff took into consideration that we were staying a while so they put us in the quieter area of the hotel. We’ve stayed in brand name chain hotels and let me tell you... the customer service we received during our entire stay is incomparable to most places we’ve stayed. Everyone is so friendly, helpful & nice! The only complaint we had was finding black gnats in our room. It seemed like the would sneak in our room every time we opened the door at night. If they could come up with a bug zapper or something to not attract bugs... that would be awesome! We will definitely be returning for future Anaheim visits. Thank you Standford Staff for your welcoming hospitality :)

Summary Heading: Equal pros and cons for a decent motel
Summary: We stayed at the Stanford Inn for a trip to The Disneyland Resort in June 2019. Traveling with a family of 5 can be challenging when searching for accommodating rooms. We settled on the Stanford Inn because of the availability of a suite with two bathrooms, free breakfast, and free (or so we thought) parking.  We’ve made dozens of trips to DLR over the years, and have come to prefer parking at the park as opposed to staying within walking distance. We’ve found security at the resort to be shorter (and cooler) when parking at the Mickey & Friends structure, rather than going through the long, hot lines on the Harbor side. For this reason, we look for hotels with free parking to help offset the $25 daily fee to park at Disney. Most of the aggregator websites list this hotel as

The sinks backed up a little bit, but maintenance was very helpful and responsive when contacted.  Having two bathrooms with 6 people was a BLESSING.  EXTRAS: The pool area is very relaxing, and having it open until 11:00 was nice on the nights that Disneyland closed earlier - we still had hot tub time!   Breakfast was great, with many

Summary: Stayed here for the third time, very satisfied. The staff from the manager down to the housekeepers care about your comfort. It is always clean, comfortable and quiet.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel that needs training on Service Animals!
Summary: Lovely hotel. Beautifully decorated Disney themed room. The beds were very comfortable. The heated pool and jacuzzi were wonderful, especially at the end of a fun filled family day. Thank God there was a trash can close to our room, but I paid to NOT have to deal with that during our family mini vacation!!

Summary: This appears to be a older motel with remodeled rooms.  They split a room between in two to make small bedrooms for the children.  The room was remodeled sensibly, but with some lower price furnishings and doors that are starting to show wear because they may not have been created for commercial use.  The room was very clean and decorated in a Disney theme that the children enjoyed.  There is a little table and bunk beds in the kids room.  It was very fun for them!  The ART bus stop is right in front of the hotel.  You may wait 20 - 30 minutes for the bus to come.  Even at peak times leaving Disneyland.  The city should stack buses around closing time.  You are not close enough to Disneyland to just walk if the bus is taking forever to arrive.  Breakfast was good with lots of

Close enough to walk to Disneyland (about 1 mile and a quarter).  At night after a full day of walking it did seem tiring for some in our family.  The breakfast was hearty and really good.  Eggs, sausage, potatoes, waffles, yogurt, pastries, cereal, milk and juice.  Once again the staff made it all the better.  The parking is free.  I will definitely recommend this to friends and family.

It was disgusting. try walking on the carpet and let me know if ur feet turns black. Or use one of ur white towel and gently just wipe the carpet. I said gently. UGH....BLACK!!!  Needed a small screwdriver and front desk didn’t have one we could borrow.  :(  So disappointed of the room. It was so disgusting. I don’t know how this place got great reviews.

So i unload my 2 toddlers and luggage and head to room on the second floor to find it was not the room type i booked so i haul the kids back down to office they moved us rooms ok fine we settle for night! Next night i come back from all day in disneyland with my kids to find we are locked out of our room! So i haul cranky toddlers down stairs again to office they say i deactivated the key card by putting it next to my phone BS whatever so we haul everything back up

There are a handful of restaurants in walking distance and lots of fast food places . There is a large Target store within walking distance which is handy for snacks ect . Summary Heading: Great place to stay to save some money
Summary: This motel was good for the price that we paid. The pluses are: Free internet and free parking, my kids love the heated pool, the continental breakfast was good but it is the same food everyday, the staff was very friendly, the beds in the rooms are very comfortable, the maid service is excellent, the fridge and microwave was very helpful. The minuses are: wasn't a fan of the laminate flooring in the room, I would prefer carpet, There was very low water pressure for the shower, the hair dryer didn't work very good, wish they had a shuttle service to Disneyland, we used the ART but it was not very reliable and took a really long time to get to the park. Overall, for a 3 star hotel I thought that it was a great place to stay. I would stay there again.

Summary: Even though you are not walking distance to the Disney Parks the shuttle is a nice alternative. Location is good for access to shopping and restaurants. Breakfast was about average but convenient. The employees were very nice and accommodating..
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your review! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary: We booked a 2-bedroom, 2-bath suite for 5 adults and 2 kids. The bunk beds were a huge hit with the kids! The ART bus that goes to Disneyland stops in front of the hotel every 20 minutes. This will save you paying for parking at the park and tickets are available at the front desk. The free, hot breakfast was better than most as well.Clean room and great staff.

Summary: The curb appeal of this hotel is very good.  It is about a 20 minute walk to Disneyland so we decided to take Lyft to and from the park for about $6 per trip.  The room was awesome and it was a quiet place to stay while we were there.  The breakfast was a good start to the day.  If you forgot anything, there is a Target just up the street on Harbor.  I would stay there again.  In fact, my brother is staying there in March.

Summary Heading: Good Breakfast and Good Value for the Price
Summary: Good breakfast.  Helpful staff.  Too far for walking back from Disneyland at midnight.  No shuttle, but bus $3 a day. Clean, but not fancy.  Comfortable beds.  Light shines through curtain crevices.  Good value for the price, I think.

Summary Heading: Best deal for a large family
Summary: Want a nice spacious room for a trip to Disneyland with a large family? Look no further than here! Additionally the free breakfast was great with many hot and cold options. Within walking distance to many restaurants along with the shuttle to Disneyland this hotel is a great option for families on a budget.

Summary: Stay was good except we never received maid service and we were there three days. Not sure why but did make a complaint at front desk. Other than that everything else was good. Free parking and breakfast plus fridge and microwave in room. Plus a safe however ours was not working.

Summary Heading: Art picks up right in front
Summary: My experience, the room, and the food were all okay. Nothing wowed me, but definitely decent for the price. If you are staying at Disney all day and just looking for a place to sleep at night, than this would be a good place for you to stay. I thought the bed was hard but other than that the room was fine. I wasn’t crazy with how the breakfast was set up. It’s small, not very many options, and you have to wait for someone to serve you eggs, sausage, or potatoes (not buffet style). Staff were very friendly. A big plus is that the ART bus stops right in front of the hotel and comes often. It was easy getting to and from Disneyland with kids.

Summary: Great place, I liked that there were 2 rooms connecting for the kids. The rooms had something for everyone, my son 15, my daughter 9 and my 3 year old were all content. Not to mention we had two bathrooms👍

Summary: Great value and location. We are already coming back for business in January and have booked our room. The breakfast is also pretty good. They also sell Disneyland tickets. To have makde this a perfect trip would have been complimentary shuttle to the convention center; but the walk is also enjoyable.

Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary Heading: Good value for the money; filthy carpets, though.
Summary: Our family stayed at the Stanford Inn & Suites for 7 nights in December. We got a great deal on the family suite, which included two rooms, two Queen beds, bunk beds for the kids, and two bathrooms.  The Beds: This room has two Queen beds, though we noted that they seemed a bit smaller than true Queen mattresses usually are. Still, they were comfortable, and my kids reported that the bunk beds were very comfortable.  The room overall: The room was spacious enough, and having two bathrooms was very convenient. It was nice to be able to have two people showering at once so that we could take less time getting ready for Disney in the mornings. There is a mini fridge and microwave in the room as well, which we used to store and re-heat leftovers we brought home from restaurants.

Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary: The rooms were absolutely magnificently decorated and the kids loved the bunk room.  The staff was friendly and very helpful.  I would recommend this place to friends and relatives.  I definitely will be staying here again in the future.

Summary: We stayed at Stanford Inn during a family trip to Disneyland. the hotel is older but maintained. the breakfast is good though not great. good place for families to stay. we did not use the pool but it looked clean. we requested a quiet room and got one on the back side of the hotel. it was VERY quiet and pleasant since it backed on a residential street

Summary: I'll get my beef out of the way first. I had emailed the hotel three times before we got there asking a simple question and didn't receive a reply to any of them. Surely someone could have spent a minute to reply. That being said it did not influence my attitude once we were there. I think this place is really good value with free parking, free breakfast and other amenities including fridge, microwave and coffee maker as well as laundry room pool and exercise facilities. Only a mile from Disney and the ART bus stops right outside the door. The breakfast was adequate and staff were pretty good.  All in all we had a pretty good stay and would recommend to others.

Summary: We stayed 5 nights, and loved the 2 bedroom/bathroom. Loved having 2 bedrooms and TVs to spread out a little. Breakfast was good, my kids liked it. We walked one day it wasn’t too bad on the way but the walk back that night was long. I have kids ranging 15-5. It’s nothing fancy, older but the price was awesome and we would stay here again.

My family had an amazing time for the 4 days we were there. If you are wondering about places to eat around Disneyland there are TONS. However for some reason we could not get Googlemaps or Apple maps to locate anything around us even if they were across the street, like Subway. Its like your in a food Bermuda triangle and nothing shows. However there are lots of options.

It is walking distance to Disneyland, however they have a shuttle that takes you to and from the park.  We paid $14.00 a person for 3 day pass.  Beats $25.00 a day parking at Disneyland.  My family will use this hotel next year because of the staff, location and cleanliness!!

Summary: We stayed here for 9 nights in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom room. The room was clean and quiet and a bonus was the free breakfast each day. We also got a late checkout on our last day. The hotel was certainly within walking distance (around 25 minutes) to Disneyland, however, for a family with younger children an Uber might be the best option. Very few amenities available at the hotel so if you are looking to spend time sitting around a pool drinking cocktails, this isn't the place for you! The negatives were that our room was very dark so better lighting would improve this. Also, one of the air-cons was broken in the 2nd bedroom. Luckily it wasn't hot enough weather to need it, though. Overall, absolutely fine for a family who just wants a place to crash at night after big days out.

Summary Heading: love it so close to Disney

Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your review! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. We're glad to hear that you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast. Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary: The location is nearby to Anaheim Convention Centre, easy access to the services, friendly staff. What could be improved is the variety of the breakfast menu and there could be a less smell in the room

Summary: We enjoyed our stay. The staff was kind and very helpful. The shuttle stopped right in front of our hotel so it was easy to get to Disneyland. Breaksfast had a good variety to it. Not just cereal or waffles. Warm items and yogur.

Summary Heading: Okay if everywhere else is booked
Summary: This place was okay, but every day of my stay we had issues with the towels. They were worn out (literally had holes in them), looked like they had not been washed, and I found hair in them when I unfolded a few of them.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your review! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. Summary Heading: Great stay for a great price!
Summary: Was in town for BlizzCon and managed to snag a room here at a very reasonable rate. Staff was courteous and helpful. Checking in and out was a breeze, and the room was very comfortable. My biggest nitpick would be that I couldn't find any hot breakfast options in the morning, so all I had was some buttered toast and apple juice. Enough to get me going though! I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your review! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. We're glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We're sorry to hear that you weren't able to enjoy our hot breakfast, it's typically best to get to our breakfast early to avoid the lines for our eggs,sausage and waffles. Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary: I enjoyed my stay! The staff was nice, I got a great welcome and the staff in the kitchen was very nice too. The room smelled good, it was well located and I felt safe. There was a bit of glitter in the room but I figured they couldn't manage to clean it completely. The bathroom was clean and ventilated. The walls were not sound proof, so be careful, there could be children at 7 am waking you up signing happy birthday and one of them could go cry in front of your room waking you up, but I think I was just unlucky.  The fitness room needs more ventilation for people to use it. It smelled really bad. The matress was not really comfortable, but it was decent sized and the sheets were clean. There was enough pillows and enough towels. We always got new ones. The hairdryer was
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your review! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. Good wifi, free parking for hotel guests, good breakfast, sells Disney tickets and bus rides (the bus stops just in the entrance). It is at walking distance to Disney and Anaheim Convention Center.

The WiFi was a bit spotty at times and the breakfast is decent, not decadent.  However, the ART bus stop right outside the motel can’t be beat!

Summary Heading: My son and I in Disneyland
Summary: Not luxury just a very nice hotel. Close to Disneyland. The shuttle picks you up. I didn’t like the breakfast but that is just me. They have bagels and make your own waffles. Also eggs and sausages. Everyone else was happy. Just a solidHotel to crash after a tiring day
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. Thank you for the kind words and have a wonderful day!

Summary: This hotel was absolutely perfect!!! The staff is super friendly and very accommodating. The rooms are spacious, clean and quiet with some Disney decoration that put my family in the mood. The beds are incredible, it was like sleeping on a cloud. The kids had their own room with a bunkbed, a/c and TV. FREE hot and cold breakfast is a big plus. FREE Wifi and FREE parking. Pleasant clean pool and heated spa with towels provided. We were parked right outside our room and there was never any issue of too little parking. We lucked out with the price we found for this nice hotel. I really have nothing but great things to say about our stay here. We will definitely come back again.  Would recommend to anyone!!   Mahalo Stanford Staff!!

Summary: I love staying here.  I have stayed at many places around the area and the Stanford is a good nice place to stay.  The rooms are neat, the have minie refrigerators. They also provide complementary breakfast to its guest. If your going to Disneyland you can but tickets for the art bus that picks up in front of the hotel & drops off right at Disneyland entrance.

Summary: This was our second trip to Disneyland in a months time.  Our first trip was to celebrate my birthday and our anniversary and we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel.There is no better customer service than Disney and the grounds and pools area are awesome. That being said, the room was a bargain at only $370 a night and it was my hope to spend time less time at the parks and a little more time enjoying the hotel's amenities.  It didn't happen.  The point being, if the focus of your trip is spending time at the parks and you are constantly on the go, staying at an expensive hotel is a total waste of money.  The Stanford Inn is clean and comfortable, and the staff is very friendly . There is an ART bus stop right in front of the hotel which making getting to and from the park very
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. Thank you again and have a wonderful day!

Summary: The price was good, the rooms were decent (family of 5), the beds weren’t the most comfortable but it didn’t bother my kids. Location close to Disneyland and parking. Breakfast was good with a few different options. Our room was right by the busy road so there was a lot of traffic noise so we could have done without that but overall it was a decent place.

Summary Heading: The chirping of a cricket is fine unless it’s in your room.
Summary: We co-habitated with a cricket for 3 nights that started chirping soon after the lights went out. We told the staff, but I guess they couldn’t find it.  The bathroom  was small and the fan was very loud.  We enjoyed the WiFi and the ART bus stop in front of the hotel was very convenient. There were many places to eat within a few blocks with a broad range of prices. We were able to purchase our Disney tickets and ART bus tickets in the lobby.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. Summary: We stayed for 1 night after a nearby event.  This hotel was much better than expected.  Rooms were clean and very roomy.  Shower had decent water pressure. No odors in the room.  A/C worked well. Check-in was quick.  I felt safe walking in the area near the hotel.  Breakfast was good.  Bagels, waffles, eggs, sausage, cereal, pastries, etc... Lots of families due to close proximity to Disneyland.  I got a great price considering the location and weekend rates.   Very Happy customer.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. We're overjoyed to hear that we exceeded your expectations! Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary: We had a great experience at this hotel! This is our third time staying here, and we love the free parking, the wonderful breakfast and the themed rooms! The front office was extremely helpful and actually helped us upgrade to a bigger room for an affordable price. My kids loved having their own room with bunk beds and were impressed with the Mickey and friends decals on the walls. Next time we hope to get a Star Wars or Avengers room! We actually walked to the parks a few times. It is a hike, but is doable. There is an ART bus stop very close to the hotel if you wish to take a bus. Tip: ask to not be in a room by the street. It can be very loud and you can smell cigarette smoke from the street.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. Summary: My son and I were on vacation and I wouldn't stay anywhere else but here. Free parking, free breakfast. No other property around Disneyland can offer anything this good and have such pleasant employees. Very clean property.

Summary: For the sheer fact I am not ok with crickets crawling on the bed I am sleeping on AT ANY TIME, let alone when I am in it.  I would not choose to stay at this hotel again.  Housekeeping did a good job but the crickets were to hard to overlook.  Continental breakfast left a bit to be desired.

Summary Heading: Good hotel in a nice area
Summary: The friendly staff welcome and checked my son and i in promptly The only problems we encountered were no elevator only stairs, the pool and spa needed cleaning, and the room next door had small children screaming and making noise well up past midnight which was annoying.  .
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. I am sorry that you did not have the best experience possible but our front desk is open 24 hours a day so if anything like this happens again please contact them and we can speak to the other guests. Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary: My favorite part about this place was the layout of the room.  We are a family of five.  We had the two queen beds which worked great for my husband and I, and our oldest.  The youngest two slept in the room with the bunkbeds.  This worked perfectly for us.  The younger two were so excited about sleeping in the bunk beds and having a space of their own.  We were so excited to be able to shut the door so we could have some quiet and to be able to put them down earlier at night and stay up a bit later doing our own thing.  The bunks each had their own reading light which was super cute and handy.  I also loved that the rooms are Disney themed.  It just helps add to the experience for the kids.  The rooms could use some upgrading and the beds weren't the most comfortable, but for
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. We are glad that you are were able to enjoy the room and it worked well for your family. I am sorry that you got the impression that we offered a free shuttle, we are a stop for the Anaheim Resort Transportation and sell tickets for it at the front desk. We will try and advertise that more clearly in our profile. Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary: Loved this place. We come to Disney a lot and have stayed at multiple properties this one by far was our favorite due to cleanliness, mini fridge and microwave for small items and snacks.  As well as my favorite part the themed rooms we had Mickey with some red walls.  They stated they also have, Star Wars, Frozen, Princess and are working on adding more I think they may have said Cars or Toy Story but I do not recall.Besides the room being great we LOVED the cheap fee for the the shuttle that took us straight to Disneyland dropping us off at security check.  Once the park closed we hoped back on it and were back at our hotel in far less time then waiting for the trams then going through the parking lot battle traffic.  Shuttle service for myself and my husband was $11 so $5.50
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. Summary: Loved the ease of being able to book online, no hassles and problem free process. Loved the freindly atmosphere of the lobby and helpfulness of all the staff at the motel. Lobby was still open after my family returned from disneyland so that was very helpful because i had to go in to get something late and the staff was really at ease and helpful with my needs.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. We're overjoyed to hear you loved your stay here and that our staff was able to make you stay easier. We hope to see you back again soon. Thank you again and have a wonderful day!

Summary: My wife and I usually spend the night before we go to Disneyland, and this time was no exception. We usually stay somewhere else, but I decided to look for another option. The Stanford Inn & Suites was not only affordable, but clean and close to Disneyland. We decided to take advantage of the breakfast which was included and bot was that a great idea. They not only had cereal and bagels like the other hotels but also had scrambled eggs, sausage, potatoes, and you could make your own waffles. We enjoyed the stay so much, it will be our go to place when going to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. We're glad you were able to enjoy our complimentary breakfast and hope to see you again soon! Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary: Clean bathroom, clean room, good breakfast. Wish it had more room for a small family it's great but for 6 adults it's. Not roomy enough. Overall it's what we needed for 1 night stay. Will stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your review. We're glad you enjoyed your stay and we hope to see you again soon. Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary: I have been searching for a place to stay while we visited Disneyland.The pictures looked ok, and we were gonna check out early on a 1 night stay.The front staff are super nice! They are the faces representing the hotel and they do a great job!Hotel was a but older but the value is great. Beds were super comfy.Check out was a breeze. I would have been happy to stay longer!
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure all of our guest enjoy the best experience possible and we appreciate the review. We're glad to hear that our staff was accommodating and inviting during your stay! Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful week!

Summary: Great place to stay, hot breakfast was good.  Rooms clean, easy parking, staff very nice and helpful, close to Disneyland, shuttle available for a few, but we’ll worth the small cost!  Kids really enjoyed the outdoor pool.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Summary: If staying at this Inn because of the price it's not completely worth your price, reasons they over charge your card so be aware to check the next day.  Also their rooms smell really gross, the detergent they use if any leaves this odor on everything they wash, towels, bedding sheets, and even the pillow cases I had to buy my own Febreeze and spray this in my room daily in order to eliminate that musty smell.  My family joined me that same day I arrived and they also complained about the smell.  I was hoping they wouldn't notice because I didn't want them to be discomfort seeing it was a business trip for me.  And their was this Hispanic lady serving the eggs and sausage in the morning and she was not the friendliest the whole time she looked like she wasn't happy to be there vs
Manager Response: none

Summary: Do NOT stay here! While this was the cheapest "suite" option in the area, it is not the best and I definitely didn't get what I paid for. I had a 4 day, 3 night stay here and wish I didn't have to stay as long as I did. Upon check-in, the 2 ladies that helped my friend and I get settled into separate rooms seemed to have some confusion with the printer or with the card reader because rather than helping us out individually, they were whispering amongst each other until they finally turned back to us to sign and hand us our room keys. I mention all of this in detail to warn you... Pay attention to what they're doing because I was charged 4 times and my friend 3. We didn't realize until we tried to make a purchase at a restaurant nearby and our cards were declined a day later, on
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel has started Cutting too many corners. No tea or hot water or coffee in the lobby anymore. The Yogurt went from yoplait to a nasty yogurt machine. Quality of the breakfast has definitely gone down. Some of the rooms have been upgraded and that is nice, especially the flooring
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure our guests have the best stay possible. We are sorry to hear that your experience wasn't up to par but we do offer hot tea and coffee for breakfast until 9:30 a.m. daily. If there was any issues with the drink dispenser we will surely fix it. Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day!

Summary: This hotel is absolutely the best place you can stay for your money's worth near Disneyland! Very affordable prices without sacrificing for quality whatsoever. Check in was very smooth and front desk ladies super nice and helpful. They have a delicious breakfast buffet AND free parking! Room was very spacious and comfortable. Had a chance to meet the General Manager during our stay and he made sure we had everything we needed and were enjoying our time there. If you need a hotel where you can rely on affordable price, customer service and an enjoyable stay, this is your place!
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure all of our guests have the best experience possible! We're glad you hear that our staff was able to give you a great experience and the room fit all your needs. Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful week!

Summary: I love this hotel! It’s my favorite in Anaheim. There’s no resort fee and they don’t charge for parking. I got a standard double bed room which was perfect. The Disney decals gave it that special touch. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. I asked for a 1st level room since I am afraid of an earthquake hitting any minute and they were very accommodating. They only had a room next to the street which the girl at the reception warned me of the noise, but I had no problems at all when it came to that. The benefits to staying in that room is that I was so close to the free breakfast and I was facing a closed down restaurant, so there was plenty of parking. The customer service is exceptional. I needed towels and toilet paper and I just called the front desk and they quickly
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure all of our guests have the best stay possible! We're glad that our staff was able to accommodate your needs and quickly at that! Thank you again for your time and we hope to see you back again soon. Have a wonderful week!

Summary Heading: Great price for the best reviews in Anaheim (Disneyland) area
Summary: Booked a single night on a Sunday. Plenty of rooms, and was really affordable. I already knew from Tripadvisor they have fantastic reviews. Front desk staff was super friendly and even let me know my room was ready a little early at 2pm. Asked for 2nd floor for a more quiet room. Room was great, everything working. A safe for valuables you leave in the room. A fridge you can turn off if not using (always a plus). Location was perfect. I wasn't going to walk to the park, and used ART 1 / 2 (stop bench right in front). Best $5.50 daily pass to save older legs :) Drops you off right at Disneyland bag check. I had to leave before 6:30am, so didn't get to check breakfast. WiFi password was given, but didn't need it. There are some little things I really like. The Mickey wall decal.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your insightful review. We are overjoyed that we were able to offer a great stay. Thank you again and we can not wait to see you again!

Summary: A clean and quite place near in Disneyland. Big bedroom and area and also parking. There is a buffet breakfast.i loved their coffee.it is a walking distance in Disneyland around 20mins from motel.but if you plan to go in L.A downtown it is far and traffic.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant stay and we appreciate your gracious review. Summary: Great staff. After my daughter & friends drove 7 hours they went in the pool. When they were closing up a nice gentleman brought out dry towels for them. Room was very clean & comfortable bed. Will stay here again!

Summary: I love this hotel.  It is located right down the street from Disneyland.  The staff is friendly, there is free breakfast and wifi, and the rooms are super clean.  I've gone twice and already have my 3rd trip booked!

Summary: The hotel was satisfactory to the amount I paid. The continental breakfast was alright. Although it says breakfast ends at 9:30, they tend to close early than the ending period. which i find very unfair. Because they start cleaning and kicking people off the breakfast lounge.  The housekeeping is a very unsatisfactory because they take a long time to clean the room. one of the perks of this hotel is that you buy a pass for the bus and it literally drops you off in fornt of the hotel

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here. We were within walking distance of Disneyland and countless restaurants. My kids enjoyed swimming in their pool and walking to a restaurant at night was so convenient and a lot of fun.

Summary: Love the room suite and how friendly the staff were. Mostly definitely going to book again. And the fact that there was a bus stop that pick us up and drop us off at the entrance. Save money on parking and the hassle of waiting for the tram.

Summary: Pros: We had 3 adults, 2 teenagers and the 2-bedroom, 2-bath room was the perfect size for our family.  Comfortable beds. Free parking.  Hot breakfast was surprisingly good. Eggs, bacon, sausage patty, waffles, cereal, coffee, juice, bagels, oatmeal.  Long lines for breakfast.  Most people brought their breakfast back to their own rooms since there wasn't a lot of tables in the breakfast room.  ART shuttle bus stops in front of the hotel.  You can purchase the ART shuttle passes and Disneyland tickets at the front desk.  Free wifi.  Cons: Housekeeping took away all our towels and didn't replace them two days in a row.  We had to go to the front desk to pick up our own towels.  Housekeeping also didn't replenish the paper coffee cups that we used.  Used tissue found in the

Summary: This was my first time to a California besides training at NTC when I was active duty. Aneheim, CA is a very nice location and the atmosphere was great. Nice little spots to eat thru out the area. 🇺🇸🤘🏻

Summary: The room was great. Very spacious for a family of 6.The kids loved having their own room with bunk beds, a tv and a table. Pool was great. Internet access could have been better. They offer a free hot breakwas which is a plus for a family of 6.

Summary Heading: STANFORD INN & SUITES at Anaheim California........The most dirt, bad smelling hotel I used in my life
Summary: Opening room door,  smells  very bad—pee—- I ask for cleaning out the room with lady at front desk and their solution was that somebody bring me a bottle of spray!!!!! ????? What????? Kids take out shoes inside and in no more than 5 minutes later I saw their socks.... totally black of dirt ... I was with lady again in front desk and her answer was the usual in these cases..... “I apologize”?????. But nothing more... I ask for cleaning up my room and she offers me another room , I take a look to the other room and was almost the same bad things... floor sooo dirt, but not bad odor.. This is a really bad hotel for the price $1,200 for 4 nights.... Hotel. Com ,founds for me this hotel and some others two more in days before.... the others 2 was ok , clean , good service ,

Summary Heading: It's a Hotel with a Bed & Breakfast
Summary: We don't live too far from Anaheim but needed a quick family retreat to relax and rejuvenate. I feel lucky to have found this spot at an affordable cost compared to properties in the same area. It is about a 3-mile walk to the Disneyland area and along the way there are many restaurants and convenience stores.  The pool is moderately sized with a jacuzzi.  They close it at 11pm, so we had the option to use the facilities later in the evening when the crowds are less.  They offer a free breakfast--but it's a full one...not just toast & energy bars (as I've previously experienced with other hotels).  The breakfast serves make-your-own waffles, sausages, eggs, potatoes, several types of cereals, yogurt, bagels and toast.  It is a buffet.  There are staff making sure the food is

Summary Heading: No Response from Management on Issue
Summary: My niece found this hotel back in October and we booked two rooms for a couple of nights.  We really liked it, so I booked two rooms again for 4th of July week.  We had an issue mid week and I reported it to the front desk as well as filled out in detail a lengthy response on the feedback form in the room.  I turned the feedback form in to the front desk and asked a couple days later if the manager read it.  I also described our issue again.  I was told the manager was on vacation and would see it the next week.  I didn't even sign the checkout form.  I didn't expect much, but I did at least expect an acknowledgement (phone call, email) that the manager saw the feedback form.  Here it is July 27th and still nothing.  We are season pass holders and really disappointed.  We will

Summary Heading: We always stay at Stanford Inn & Suites
Summary: Love this place.  Very convenient to Disneyland, Target, multiple restaurants.   Staff is really friendly and go the extra mile. The beds are comfy and the air conditioning is fabulous.  There is a pool and we plan to use it each time we stay but we are always too busy.

Summary: Hotel has that old stinky hotel smell, and that’s never pleasant. Everything was pretty basic. Nothing really stood out to me. Considering I still had to drive to the park and pay parking anyway.  I did like the fact that they have second bedroom options with bunk beds, for the kids.  Although it was nice to get a free hot breakfast every morning, a variety would have been nice. You eventually get tired of eating the same thing every single day. Also, the lady serving the egg, potatoes and sausage seemed bothered if I got 3 sausages (one for me and one for my kids).  I also didn’t like

Summary: Booked this room for short Disneyland get away.  Room was nice for price paid had frig and microwave.  Breakfast and pool ok.  We were able to walk to Disneyland  but it is far enough away to consider driving next time.  Best thing comfortable beds and less traffic than nearer Disneyland.

We asked for super hero room was told we would need to wait until we arrived asked for Star Wars theme was told is was also first come first serve and that there was an up charge 20 a night (why show a theme when booking if it’s not what you are getting) paid upcharge got Star Wars room the shower had no liner so bathroom began to stink , a/c in bunk theme room (20 extra) broken when ran it was loud.

We checked in July 1st no issues went swimming later that evening. The next morning we left for a water park we put the do not disturb sign on our door because of our autistic daughter she doesn’t like the maids moving her things. We return to the hotel around 12:30 because my daughter wasn’t feeling well, we tried to get into the room but couldn’t so my husband went down to see why, the General manager Ray Reyes told him we were locked out due to us breaking the safe he walked us into the room and the safe was literally ripped out of the wall, we explained that when we left this morning the safe was perfect on the wall, he said we had to

Summary: Our 3 day stay turned into 5 when hurricanes cut our cruise short.  Stanford was able to add 2 extra days at an EXCELLENT rate for it being the prime season.  I was impressed with the updated, clean rooms with Queen Beds - Not full beds.  I slept like a dream.  We took advantage of the heated pool and spa, purchased discount tickets from the front desk, and enjoyed the bountiful, free breakfast before hopping the shuttle right out front to Disney.  I would highly recommend this place.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and for your gracious review. Our team is always working hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant experience. Summary: Overall, I had a very pleasant experience with this inn. The people at the front desk were nice and accommodating, and the room looked exactly as it had in the pictures. The room was definitely worth the cost, with similar ones in the area being twice the price. Palm trees surround the building. It's fairly close to Disneyland, and a walk away from many stores and restaurants. One small concern I had is that there aren't enough outlets, only 4 available ones in my room that slept 4! I would recommend stopping at Walmart for a power strip, I got one for $2. It would also be nice if there were a separate area to dress and more lighting in the room, however these are all tiny details that don't change my initial experience at the Stanford Inn.

Summary Heading: Just right for your Disney trip
Summary: My family and I enjoyed this location. The front desk, the staff, the morning breakfast crew, everyone was fabulous! We appreciated the nice, clean room. The morning breakfast is very tasty! You are close enough to Disneyland and the location is truly convenient. Thank you for a wonderful stay!
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a wonderful time during their stay and are happy to know you did. Thank you again for your time; we look forward to your future visits in hopes of giving you an even better experience. Have a wonderful week!

Summary: Spent two nights here with 6 people.  Service was excellent.  Access to Disneyland/California  Adventures was great. You can buy your passes to the park at the front desk as well as ART passes for the shuttle to the parks.  Rooms were Disney themed which was not a desire for us (all adults) but it was fun none the less.  Two queen beds and two twin beds (bunk bed) which worked for our group.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a wonderful time during their stay. Have a wonderful week!

Summary: Overall enjoyed our stay here.  We had plenty of room with the 1 bath suite.   The room was clean and the breakfast was pretty good each morning.   Only issue we had was we kept getting 3 wash clothes even though we had 5 people in the room.  And the wifi wouldn’t reach our room.  Overall nice place for the price.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a pleasant t experience. I will address this with our team to see how we can better accomodate our guests.  Thank you again for your review and we hope to have you back in the near future. Have a wonderful week! :)

Summary: This is an affordable clean and comfortable place to stay after a day in the park. The staff is always friendly and helpful. And the convenience of being able to buy your Disneyland ticket at the front desk is a plus. I have stayed here before and I’ll be back again.

Summary Heading: OK for the price, good location
Summary: room smelled stale, and was very humid even with AC running full on . Good location and easy parking, but the layout of the rooms vs. entry points was odd--required a long walk every day to get to the room. Wi-fi was sketchy, making business use almost impossible.

Summary Heading: Great value for groups and families. Clean and courteous.
Summary: Clean and a good value. Loved how many it accommodated. It was nice to have two rooms and two TV’s. The pool was a good mid day break for the kids before returning to Disneyland.  Friendly staff. Shuttle stops by, but note it is not free.

Summary: It was easy to get from the hotel to Disneyland there is a shuttle service that will pick you up and drop you off for a minimal fee. Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything was perfect! Great hotel! Friendly and helpful staff. Room was  comfy spacious and clean. Breakfast was very tasty every morning lots to choose from, but menu options never changed much. Pool and spa amazing! Close to everything you need! Lots within walking distance. Kids didn’t want to leave! Had such an amazing time at the hotel, and Disneyland both parks also very close by. Can’t wait to go back! Weather was fantastic too! Loved it!!!

Summary: This place is perfect for families with young kids. It's close to Disneyland, has clean rooms and a very good breakfast. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room with the two queen beds and separate room with bunk beds was perfect for the five of us.

Summary Heading: Will recommend to family and friends!
Summary: The room was nice, clean, and spacious. It had everything we needed: microwave, mini fridge, iron, coffee maker. The parking and WiFi are free, and well as the breakfast they prepared every morning. Parking was never an issue; they even had extra parking at the rear of the hotel. There was a good variety of breakfast offerings, hot and cold, as well as juice, tea, and coffee. The Stanford is just down the street from Disneyland and DCA, though you could take the shuttle (for a small fee) if you want to avoid the hassle and cost of parking. I will definitely be recommending the Stanford to family and friends. Thank you, Stanford staff for making our stay a little home away from home!

Summary: I am giving this a terrible review only because of the night the power was out! We came back from Disneyland at 10:30pm to find the front doors closed and locked and our hotel room open! Without power none of the doors lock! Now the power outage was not the hotels fault but they should of had a backup generator or at least security or staff members at every entrance and staircase asking for peoples room keys. I felt very unsafe. No was around at all. I'm happy to say none of our stuff was stolen but the whole situation was not ok, the next morning I received not even an apology. I will never stay there again.
Manager Response: Hello, Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I must address that despite the city's power outage, the door locks of our hotel rooms run on individual batteries and cannot be affected by it. Some things are out of our control and we do apologize the experience you had with us. Thank you again for your time and we wish you a wonderful week.

Another good comment about the Standford Inn, is the royal breakfast served by the staff. The food is fresh and hot. The breakfast has many hot and cold breakfast to choose from.

Summary Heading: Trip to Disneyland for Memorial Weekend
Summary: This place has themed suites which is great for families with kids, or families planning a trip to Disneyland. I stayed with my family in a Mickey Mouse themed suite. The kids room is separate with a bunk bed, their own tv, desk, chairs and full bathroom. The rooms are separated by a door for privacy. Give them a call for those suite rates and availability before booking your room online. I believe you can upgrade for a minimal fee.   Staff was nice and the 24-hr front desk personnel were helpful. The complimentary breakfast and free parking were what attracted me to book with this place, not  to mention Disneyland is only a few blocks away. The place is clean and the beds are very comfy. I would stay here again.

The kids loved the fact that the rooms were decorated, as we saw the preview of the other rooms the kids were picking their future rooms.

The eggs were hard and cold. The potatoes were cold as well. We only ate the breakfast for 2 days of our 5 day stay. I’d stay here again. I’d just be more prepared to eat elsewhere for breakfast next time.

Summary: We stayed here to go to Disneyland, got my tickets through AAA Any way this place feels completely safe, clean and serves a very decent breakfast. We just took the car. $20. for parking. One more thing we rented a electric scooter for $25 a day and it was outside Disney, they delivered, but we have to wait for it to be picked up. Next time I am going to rent the scooter inside from Disney, they will store it overnight and charge it. someone told me that Disney is real reasonable with prices on scooters, better to check with them.

Summary: This place works well for a large family. We took a room with the extra bunks. Breakfast is ok, if you have a bigger appetite you may want to eat elsewhere. In fridge room is helpful for packing snacks. Target is a couple blocks walk away and there are numerous restaurants in the area. Pool area clean. Best feature is the ART stop, literally right in front of the hotel and its about a 10 minute ride depending on how many people get on... which can be ALOT. It's about a miles walk to the park which is long with small kids, so the bus is an inexpensive option and tickets can be bought right at the hotel. Was a good place to launch from when spending most of the time at the parks.

Book this hotel already!

Not sure about the pool, probably would not use but I didn't check it out.

Breakfast was good, but we ate the same thing for our 4 day stay. It would be nice to change out at least the sausage to bacon every other day, but love that the ART Bus comes every 20 mins or so directly in front of the hotel straight to Disneyland and back. Last bus back to the hotel at 12:30 am. No parking fees at the park when you do it this way. $5.50 for 24 hrs, or online. Felt safe and conveniently located near several fast food, ice cream, and restaurants nearby. Will definitely continue to stay here every time we go to Disneyland.

Loved the location, the bus stop directly out the front to Disneyland was perfect! Great place if you’re looking for somewhere clean and close to the action on a budget!

Most of the times before that, it was Mickey and friends theme. The breakfast has plenty to choose from: scrambled eggs, sausage, potatoes, toast, bagels, pastries, make your own waffles, yogurt, cold cereal, and oatmeal. Very comfortable environment

Not great for business travelers needing internet access.  Attended conference at convention center very convenient to walk back & forth.  Breakfast was nice and easy for a whole family.  Parking very convenient too at no extra cost.  Felt safe for a woman traveling alone.   Bedding and towels extremely clean and comfortable.  Slept good.  GREAT Mexican restaurant Mi Casa on Orangewood just down the street.  Excellent Sangria..... Ate there twice in two days.  Hotel is a bit dated but for the price it is a good value.

The room was priced really well and was close to Disneyland and parking. I appreciated that they didn't have additional parking fees. They provided a nice, hot  breakfast that helped us start our days well. Iwould definitely stay here again.

Summary: This was our 4th visit to the Stanford Inn and Suites.  Every trip I try to find a better deal and I haven't been able to. The staff is always very friendly and prompt to respond to any issues you have.  The ART shuttle stops right in front of the hotel so getting to the parks is super easy.  The breakfast is always plentiful and the ladies that staff the breakfast room are cheerful and helpful and do a very good job of keeping the room clean and stocked even with the hordes of small children coming through.  I know that the several times my kids spilled drinks, the hostesses were there wiping it up and mopping before
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. As a team we value your review for it is essential to our success as a hotelier. She let us leave our baggage though which was quite helpful  Anyway it was not an ideal start but it got better from there. Not walking distance from disney but the ART stops right in front of the hotel. Walking distance to target which was pretty great for a family of five with a tight budget. In addition to cereal and breads, they offered some eggs, sausage, potatoes, and waffles. It was very easy to use the bus system. We bought our passes right at the desk and the bus stop was right in front of the facility which was awesome. The breakfast in the morning is ok,the hot part could be better but other than that it was good.

Summary: We stayed here for our recent trip to Disneyland for 4 nights. My husband and son got  severely bit up, when we notified the hotel manager all he could say was that he would comp us a free nights stay! Umm no thank you why would we ever want t come back to your hotel. Not very happy with our stay couldn’t even enjoy Disneyland because my son was in so much pain from scratching his skin raw because of the bites. Breakfast was horrible the eggs were  spongy as if they use powder eggs. They advertise Disneyland discount tickets and when we purchased they were full price! They also advertise free shuttle, NOPE had to pay for pretty much a bus trip! Pool was very dirty. Save your time and money and don’t stay here!
Manager Response: Dear Paula,  Thank you for sharing your review with us. We are truly sorry to hear you encountered some issues in our rooms as it is our top priority to ensure each guest has a perfect and comfortable experience while staying with us. Please rest assured our team is professionally trained by a pest control company to be able to identify any signs of bed bugs. We did not encounter any sign of bed bugs in your particular room and if we do see any sign of pests we immediately place the room out of order for multiple weeks while it is treated and cleared of any pests, we take pest issues extremely seriously. In regards to the shuttle service, we do not promote a free shuttle service anywhere on our property or our website, I do apologize for any miscommunication there may have been. We will address your issues with the proper department manager to ensure our quality of breakfast and pool is up to par, as we have high expectations for ourselves. Thank you again for your review, we hope you can reconsider staying with us in the future as I can personally assure you a more than perfect stay!  Best regards,

Summary Heading: Best place to stay for a trip to Disneyland
Summary: Awesome place to stay.  Great staff, great rates, great rooms, great breakfast.  Easy to get to Disneyland.  I will always be staying here.  I haven't used the pool yet, but it is pretty.  The complimentary breakfast is the best of any hotel I have stayed in, it is not just prepackaged breakfast rolls and coffee - it is a full breakfast with many choices.

Summary Heading: Worth more than what we paid!
Summary: We stayed in Stanford Inn & Suites (in March 2018) for a couple of nights after having done substantial research. In hindsight, we feel we made a very good decision! The room was nice and spacious, the staff as friendly as it can get. The Disneyland Park is not very close-by, but one can easily take the shuttle right outside the hotel. There are decent number of restaurants nearby, but then after having spent the whole day at the Disneyland, we ended up eating there itself and hit the bed immediately after reaching the hotel. One of the best aspects was the breakfast. The spread is more than adequate, the food is fresh and the staff is friendly. Would definitely stay again if we happen to be back in Anaheim!

They even give their patrons the ability to charge their phones, as long as you stop charging the microwave and refrigerator, how awesome! Good luck.

Would stay here again!

Summary: Rooms have had the carpet replaced by vinyl faux wood floor which was comfortable. Hae usual "plastic" waffles, well done eggs and bacon/sausage.  Breakfast staff was very helpful.  Rooms have been updated but the layout remains standard.  They have changed their WI-FI to keep the neighbors from stealing accescs.  Well no one can get in.  Take about 2 minutes (wall clock time) to get to the secondary login at which point the network is reported up on the laptop, tablet, IPOD Touch and Cell phone.  None of them could then get out of the local network.  Even tried direct IP address and still no connection.  If you are filling to use your phone's data plan. Reported this every day of the three day stay w/o resolution.

Summary: We loved staying here we have stayed twice and plan to stay here every time we come to Disneyland. Spacious room and friendly staff and great breakfast. Rooms are clean and beds are comfy! We enjoyed the hot breakfast as well.
