Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thanks so much for leaving a review on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your room as well as having the ART bus stop so close. The ART is such a great option for our Disney guests to get around. We do apologize for the noise issues you had - we will definitely take your suggestion into consideration about the quiet signs. Thank you again for leaving a review and we can't wait to see you on your next trip. Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: Our family of 4, two kids 5&7 recently stayed with the Stanford for 5 days for our first time. We stayed in the kids 1 bath with kid bunk room, this room is highly recommended if you have kids they loved having there very own room with a TV and gave us the parents some time to ourselves as well. This property is very well maintained 2 level motel style. The rooms and bathrooms were spotless and the beds were very comfortable and we slept great. Rooms were quite for the most part except a couple of nights of teenagers next to us who thought running up and down the hallways slamming there room door everytime at midnight was unacceptable but this again is not the hotels fault. The pool and hot tub were very nice, we would come back to take a break during the day and let the kids
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thanks for your review on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so glad you enjoyed your room as well as our amenities. We couldn't agree with you  more about your note on being respectful of all guests and our front desk does try to remind people of this, however, it's really hard for kids not to be excited to go to Disneyland. As far as your comment about the breakfast we are always trying new things to see what our guest's like so hopefully on your next visit we will be able to change it up to everyone's liking. Thank you again for leaving a review and we can't wait to see you next time. Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: our family loved our stay at the Stanford Inn,  we hot the family suite with kids room and one bathroom.  Our room was huge with two queen sized beds olus my kids had their own room with a bunk bed.  The beddings on their beds were Mickey Mouse themed which helped their excitement over their visit to Disneyland.  They had their own table, lamp and cable TV so it was as if they were in their own tiny world.  I loved our soft beds and the nice bathroom.   The ART shuttle stops right in fromt of the hotel so going to the Disney parks were a cinch.  Buying cheaper tickets are also available at the front desk plus the shuttle card as well.  Best part, parking at the hotel is free unlike at the other hotels where you's have to pay a fee even as guests.   The only thing they need to
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you so much for reviewing your recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your room, the ART shuttle, and our awesome front desk staff. We are always looking to make improvements for our guest's and I will be sure to pass on your comment about the breakfast to management. Thank you again and we hope to see you soon.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: We stayed last June and I truly enjoyed my stay.  The room was perfect with the children i have.  My 15 year old got her own bed while my 11 and 7 yr Olds used the bunks beds.  Two bathrooms was a luxury we don't even have at home.  And the price per night was the best.  Better than most places that would give you two double beds and we had two queens!!!!  While in walking distance, we paid the price for that after a long day at the park I recommend either getting the bus pass which was a great deal (we rode it all the way to Knottsberry farm!) Or pay the price to park and ride a tram.  If we get to go again anytime soon I would definitely stay here again!!!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for leaving a review on your stay at Stanford Inn & Suites. We are so glad to hear you loved  your room and all our amenities. We have made a lot of changes since then and would love to have you back on your next Disney vacation. Thank you again for your review and your kind comments. Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary Heading: Lived up to its good reputation
Summary: The highlights are that our room was very clean. They made every effort to accommodate our request of being on the 2nd floor. Keurig coffee maker in the room didn't have any stir sticks, sugar etc. but easy to get from breakfast room.  Being the Canadian that I am, I brought my own Tim Hortons K-cups from home, worked great. They offer the Kirkland brand for sale for $1 ea.  Good water pressure. Hot tub and pool area were fine. Appreciated the free parking and wifi. Air conditioner worked well to keep the room cool at night, wasn't loud like some are, sleeping was very comfortable. I would say the only down side, and not any fault of the hotel, is walking around the area has very busy streets. We also appreciated other reviewers that said you could walk to the Toy Story parking
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thanks for leaving a review on  your recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your room and that's awesome you brought your own K-cups! We encourage all our guests to do so (especially if you can't live without your favorite coffee every morning.) We hope to see you again soon. Thank you for all the kind comments.  Sarah

Summary: I'll make this brief and simple.  The hotel/motel was clean, no strange smells.  It is a bit older, but updated and well cared for.  Not far from Disneyland and on the shuttle route.  We had a suite with 2 queen beds and a bunk bed in an adjoining room.  Very comfortable for a family of six.  The shower was great:  instant hot water, great water pressure.  Breakfast wasn't gourmet, but it was good:  all you can eat eggs, sausage, waffles, pancakes, yogurt, fruit, cereal, milk, and juices.  easy access and plenty of free parking.  I would definitely stay at this property again.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your review on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your room as well as our amenities. We strive to provide the best accommodations for all our guests on every stay on every visit. We hope to see you again soon. Thanks again. Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: We had a group of 12 family members who stayed in 2 of the family rooms with  2 queen beds and bunk beds. The rooms were big and clean. The two bathrooms in each room were a big help with 6 people trying to get ready in the morning. The beds were comfortable. The staff was friendly. The breakfast was good and better than most continental breakfasts, it included sausage and eggs. The shuttle to Disneyland wasn't free but with 3 vehicles was definitely cheaper and more convenient than parking at Disney and we were dropped off at the front gate. The hotel is 1.5 miles from Disneyland which is not within walking distance with toddlers especially after walking around the park all day. We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for leaving a review on your recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so happy to hear you loved the family suites - the extra space does make all the difference (especially for big families all getting ready for Disney.) We strive to provide the best accommodations for every guest on every visit. We can't wait to see you and your family again on your next trip and thank you again.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: Wow Stayed 3 nights in April 2015 and I have to say it was a great place to stay everything we wanted. Great size room decent bathroom. Not far from the adventure parks.  And cheap. Out of all the places we stayed while in the USA it was the best one, that's the Hilton and Caesars palace  included.  Any one thinking of staying there do so.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your comments on your most recent stay at  Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your room and our location. We are honored our hotel was favorite US hotel you stayed in and sincerely hope to see you back soon. Thank you again.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary Heading: Great location and easy access with free parking.
Summary: Comfortable rooms and beds with breakfast provided. Use of ART to get to and from the park for the four of us was less expensive than Disneyland parking and less walking and trying to cram into the Trams to the Disney parking structure.  Sometimes, even when you did park in the structure, you still had to walk a long distance from the tram to reach your car.  And then the traffic trying to get out of the parking garage is terrible. This we encountered the day we arrived, as we got to the park before our check in time.  Will definitely consider this hotel next time in Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your review on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your room as well as our complimentary breakfast. The ART bus is such a great option for our guests (especially since it stops right out front of our hotel.) I agree with you that this is so much less of a hassle then parking. We do hope to see you again soon on your next Disney trip and thank you again for your review. Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: i have been staying at this hotel since I was 12. My family always opts for this hotel because of family suites and the great environment. We stayed here on our honeymoon trip and I'm rather disappointed. The hotel switched general managers and the new GM changed the breakfast. I think that might be my breaking point. The previous breakfast was freshly made waffles, sausage, eggs, cereals, doughnuts, yogurt and toast. Now it's cereal, cold pancakes and some nasty and awful looking eggs and sausage that you can't even get to. You have to wait for someone to be in the room and serve it to you. Not the kind of breakfast you want before a morning at Disney. Very disappointed.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your review on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so sorry to hear you didn't enjoy our new breakfast. We strive to make all our guest's happy especially our frequent visitors. We are always making changes around here and I will be sure to pass on your comments to management to make room for improvements. Your opinion is most certainly valued. We hope to see you again soon. Thank you again.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: I need to take this time to give the Stanford Inn & Suites a full 10 out of 10 on Customer Service.  Not only did the staff print off maps, give us tips for Disney and travel they also went above and beyond to help our family when crisis hit and we left important documents behind.  Our hands were tied 9 hours away, and the staff went the extra mile to deliver our documents to FedEx and ensure we had all the info we needed to believe that we indeed would eventually be able to leave the country. The beds were comfortable, the breakfast was good, the hot tub was warm and the Inn was clean and up to date.   We will be telling all our friends and family about the great time and the amazing customer service! Thank you again from the bottom of our hearts.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your nice comments on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and that  our staff was able to help you out in your crisis. Our front desk really does go above and beyond for all our guests and we are so glad to be recognized for all our hard work. We can't wait to see you again soon thank you again.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: We had an amazing time at this hotel!  Thank you for helping our family have a memorable vacation! The breakfast was pretty good and fulfilling  but the room was very comfortable!  The kids loved the bunk beds and being able to go and enjoy the pool after a fun day at the park! The convenience of the fridge and the microwave was great and the little table and chairs that was in the kids room made lunch time in the room easy as well!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your feedback on your recent visit to Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so happy to hear you loved our amenities, free breakfast, and kids suite. We strive to provide the best accommodations for every guest on every visit, every time. We can't wait to see you again soon. Thank you again,  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary Heading: Excellent room and very well priced!
Summary: We had read a few bad reviews on here but tried this room out anyway. My kids had their own separate room and bathroom with shower and a closing door! There was Buzz and Woody on the walls and the Bunk beds were made up all cute my kids LOVED it! The room was plenty big for the 4 adults in the main room and there was a nice size tv and keurig coffee maker. In the morning they have a very nice little room with a good variety of breakfast food as part of your stay! We would stay at the place again no doubt!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your nice comments. We are so glad you gave us a shot and ended up enjoying your stay. The kids suite is awesome and comfortably fits 6 people which is great for large families. We strive to provide the best accommodations for every guest and we are so glad you had an awesome stay. We can't wait to see you again soon on your next Disney vacation.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: We loved this hotel.  It was our first stay here.  We stayed in a 2 bathroom Kid's Suite.  The second room was a great size.  Plenty of space for all of us.  Super convenient ART location right next to the hotel.  The breakfast was good.  We will definitely stay here again!!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you so much for reviewing your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so happy to hear you loved your stay especially the kids suite (I agree with you the second bathroom is a must!) We can't wait to see you back on your next Disney trip. Thanks again. Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: Room was clean; with a nice breakfast for a family on a watchful budget. Stanford Inn is very close to Disney but not close enough to walk.  I like the staff there - they were very responsive to our requests.  I would definitely go back....when we save  enough money again...definitely a vacation retreat.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your feedback on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so happy to be able to accommodate our guest's that are on a budget especially our Disneyland guests. We strive to provide the best accommodations possible for every guest on every visit, every time. We understand a Disney vacation for an entire family is very expensive but having a stress free stay at a budget friendly hotel with a great staff makes all the difference. We can't wait to see you again on your next trip. Thank you again.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary Heading: Good If You're On A Budget
Summary: We stayed here in April 2015, as part of a road trip to California and Las Vegas. Having stayed in Anaheim before (albeit many years ago), I knew it is a safe area for tourists and that it is handy for Disneyland. With hindsight, this time we should have stayed somewhere nearer to our scheduled places of Hollywood, Beverley Hills and Universal Studios, as it took over an hour to drive to each from the hotel due to LA traffic. Anyway, the hotel is quite basic, but we had a clean, tidy room, with a fridge and microwave. The decor is fairly dated, but okay, and the staff on Reception were really helpful. The breakfast was above average and kept us going until the afternoon. For under £70 for 2 adults inc. all-you-can-eat breakfast and tax, I would definitely stay again if I was
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for reviewing your stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are glad to hear that your room was comfortable and the breakfast was substantial. We strive to provide the best accommodations for all our guest's on every visit. We know we aren't a fancy hotel but we have an awesome housekeeping staff as well as front desk that work hard to make all our guest's happy. We do hope to see you again soon and thank you again for staying with us.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: This isn't a high end hotel, but it met our needs completely.  We were very pleased with the separate bunk room for the kids. It seems like Stanford Inn has been reading these reviews and fixing the reported issues as several complaints I read about in reviews while looking for a hotel had been fixed during our stay. The bunk room had an independent air conditioning unit, and there was a curtain on the glass door.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you so much for your feedback on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your visit. Our team reads these reviews everyday and we are constantly making changes so we can make all our guest's stay a great one. Your positive comments makes all our hard work worth it and we thank you again for staying with us. We will see you soon. Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: Clean and well maintained. Friendly stAff and close to disney, shopping, and restaurants.  Pool was nice, and hot tub was small but good.  The breakfast could be a bit more variety in the hot food department but it was complimentary and did the trick!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you so much for leaving feedback on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so glad you enjoyed our staff as well as our location. We are always trying new things with the breakfast so I'll be sure to pass on your comments to our Management. Thank you again for staying with us and we hope to see you back again soon.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: Friendly staff, further to Disneyland ( 1 mile ) than advertised (2 blocks ) but there is an ART shuttle that comes by about ever 20 minutes right in front of the motel. The room had new carpet but it smelled like it was wet. Had a poor TV but good channels. Good breakfast choices. Stayed on bottom floor you hear up stairs walking around.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you so much for leaving feedback on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We strive to make every guest's stay as comfortable as possible on every visit and we do apologize for your issues with location, the carpet, your door, and the upstairs noise. I will be sure to pass on your review to all our staff members so we can make improvements. We do hope to see you again soon. Thank you again.   Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: The staff was always very courteous, rooms was always cleaned when we got back from the park. Love the to setup, separate room for the kids. No complaints will be staying here again, of they stay with get away today.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you so much for leaving a review on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your visit as well as our awesome kids suites (I totally agree having the extra room makes all the difference.) We can't wait to see you again soon. Thank you again. Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: We've stayed here before and really liked it so decided to come back. The rooms were still very clean and newly updated. They now provide k cup coffee and only give you 2 k cups and cups for your whole stay.  And no creamer, sugar or stir sticksf you want more you have to buy them. They provide coffee in the lobby all day and night but usually I'd like coffee as I'm getting ready. Also, the breakfast had gone downhill. When we stayed last time there was a waffle maker, pastries and donuts and scrambled eggs. They breakfast is still pretty good considering it's free but the things they don't have anymore were my kids and mine favorite.
Manager Response: We've stayed here before and really liked it so decided to come back. The rooms were still very clean and newly updated. They now provide k cup coffee and only give you 2 k cups and cups for your whole stay. And no creamer, sugar or stir sticksf you want more you have to buy them. They provide coffee in the lobby all day and night but usually I'd like coffee as I'm getting ready. Also, the breakfast had gone downhill. When we stayed last time there was a waffle maker, pastries and donuts and scrambled eggs. They breakfast is still pretty good considering it's free but the things they don't have anymore were my kids and mine favorite.  Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for leaving us feedback on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites, Anaheim. We are glad to hear that you liked your room and we do apologize for not providing extra k-cups. The front desk will provide free cups, creamer, and sugars but the K-cups are $1 a piece. We are also sorry you didn't enjoy our new breakfast - we are constantly trying new things to make our guest's stay the best one possible and unfortunately we do fall short sometimes. We still hope to see you again soon. Thank you again for your feedback.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: We loved staying here! The staff was helpful and friendly. Our room was top notch!! The shuttle comes every 20 minutes which makes it nice for Disneyland. The only suggestion I have is, a few more washers and dryers would be great!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your review on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We strive to make our guest's stay a positive one on every visit, every time. We are so glad to hear you loved your room and the ART shuttle (it's so nice that the stop is right in front of our hotel.) We do hope to see you again soon and thanks again for staying with us.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: Wow, we loved our stay at the Stafford Inn. My family and I drove from the Southeast corner of Colorado to Anaheim..we arrived tired and really wanting to relax before our days at Disney started. The staff was able to accommodate us with an early check in. The staff was always really friendly. The hotel room exceeded our expectations. It was plenty of room for my husband and our two children ages 12 and 8. I did want t suite but they were all booked when I booked our trip so I was worried that the regular room wouldn't work for us but booked it anyways..it was plenty of room. The daily breakfast is great too. Who doesn't like a free meal, especially before heading out to a full day at Disney. The pool and hot tub were wonderful to go back to after a full day and night at Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your review on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites – Anaheim. We couldn't have said it better ourselves and we are so happy you loved your room, our amenities, and our staff. We always want to provide the best stay for all our guests and we are really happy you enjoyed yours and had a memorable, relaxing Disney vacation. We will be looking forward to your next stay with us and thank you again. Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for a Disney trip
Summary: Nothing spectacular, but a good place to rest your weary body after a long day at Disney.  Yes, definitely within walking distance to Disney, but the ART is quick & reasonably priced if there are only a couple of you.  Was pleasantly surprised by how close to the park gates it dropped you.  The weather changed on us quite drastically one day, so needed to head back to the hotel to change clothes - SO thankful that we had the ART passes that allowed us a quick turnaround and warmer clothes for the evening. The breakfast is enough to fuel you for the day, but the coffee is terrible!!!  There is coffee and hot water in the foyer during the day, but not once was it hot in the three days I went in for a drink in the evening.  One day, I did comment at the front desk and mentioned
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for reviewing your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so happy to hear that the ART Transit worked out so well for you and we do apologize for the coffee not being to your liking. We actually just changed out our coffee today for a new kind and we are ordering newer and better thermoses to keep our lobby coffee nice and hot. We do hope you come back again soon on your next Disney trip and thank you again for your feedback. Kind Regards,  Sarah

Summary: This was a great place to stay- clean, spacious rooms, free wifi, helpful staff. can't beat the price for the space, location and bunkbed suite option. Basic breakfast and pool but really who goes to Disney for the hotel breakfasts? We have stayed in more expensive suite hotels nearby on past trips and honestly would not spend the cash on those again!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you so much for your review on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We honestly couldn't have said it better ourselves. We are so happy you enjoyed your room, our amenities, and our awesome staff. We hope to see you on your next Disney vacation and thank you again for your kind words.  Sarah

Summary: Our stay was great we've stayed here a few times. You can walk to Disneyland it will take you like 30 min, we take ART it picks you up right in front of the hotel. Only thing I would complain about is the slight humid smell you get when you walk in the hotel.other then that we had a great time.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you so much for your review on your stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so glad to have returning guests especially our Disneyland visitors. We do apologize for the humid smell you mentioned in your post and will be sure to pass your comment on to housekeeping so we can address this issue. We will see you next time and thank you again for staying with us.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary Heading: Great Place To Stay For a Disney Vacation
Summary: From start to finish the hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  The front desk team went out of their way to help us with park tickets, bus tickets, etc.    The room was perfect for a family who plans on spending most all their time at the parks - beds were comfortable, room was very clean (even after walking around in white socks for a while the socks were still white - a rarity in hotel rooms) the fridge and microwave were perfect for leftovers and the TV was huge (although we never turned it on).   The room had a safe but there were no instructions for operating it that we could find.    The pool and exercise room were both clean and functional (although because we spent most of our time at the parks we didn't use either).  Would have liked to have earlier access to the
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your review on your most recent visit to  Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so glad to hear you loved your stay, your room, our great staff, and that your Disney vacation went so well. We strive to provide excellent accommodations for all our guests and it's so glad to hear that our hard work pays off when we read these nice comments. We are always making changes to our hotel to better suit our guests needs and we really do hope to see you again soon on your next trip to Disneyland.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: We stayed April 10th - 12, 2015   Great property near Disney and within walking distance with free parking.  Extra little touches make you feel like you like you are not missing the "Disney" experience.  Our room had a big Mickey Mouse on the wall and our towels and even toilet paper was fanned into a cute shape!  Breakfast is adequate and even a bit more than I expected.  We also had a fridge and microwave which I didn't expect (but was delighted to see) and the love-seat pulled out into a bed as well.  (room 209 i think).  We were happy to save a few dollars by staying at a non-disney hotel and were not disappointed.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your review on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We couldn't have said it better ourselves. Disney go-ers definitely don't need to break the bank to have an awesome Disney vacation and we are so glad this shows through our hotel. It's so nice to hear you enjoyed your room as well as our amenities. We thank you again for staying with us and we hope to see you again on your next visit.   Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: Overall it was a great experience with a lot of friendly staff. Complementary breakfast was pretty good. I would have given a 5, but the power went out and they had no back up option, or emergency safety lights.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you so much for your review on your recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so glad to hear you were pleased with your stay. We strive to provide the best accommodations possible for every guest on every visit. We do apologize for the power going out and are actually installing new emergency lights so if this issue does happen again we are better prepared. We thank you again for staying with us and we do hope to see you again soon.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: We stayed for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The front desk clerks were all courteous and extremely helpful. The room was clean and very comfortable. When back in Anaheim, we would definitely choose to stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you so much for your feedback on your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We strive to make all our guests stay as positive as possible for every visit every time. We will be sure to pass on your kind praises to our front desk staff. Thank you again and we certainly do hope to see you on your next trip.   Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: The hotel was one of the cleanest hotels we've stayed in. The ART stop is right outside the door of the front desk. If you want to drive and park at Disney its less than a 10 minute drive.  The breakfast they offer has a variety of things. We had cheese omelets sausage patties, waffles, cereal oatmeal and several other things including fresh fruit. It was a nice breakfast to fill us up before heading into Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your feedback on your recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We work hard to make every guest's stay as positive as possible and we are so thrilled that your stay was a great one. Thank you again for your comments and we hope to see you again soon. Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: Let me start by saying that this was a last minute stay since I became ill on our adventure to Disneyland.  I was a little bit leery about staying here since I am very particular about where I choose to stay.  I can definitely tell you that my experience was great!! Super clean room and the staff was amazingly friendly and not to mention helpful!  Upon my check-in I told Myra the concierge that I had a terrible migraine and she made sure that we had a room that was furthest from the entrance so that the noise was to a minimum.  She also advised us that there was a complimentary breakfast in the morning in case I felt better and was feeling up a light breakfast.  Nothing fancy but I can say it was better than most hotel continental breakfasts.  Usually I park as close to my room
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, We are so happy to hear that you had such wonderful stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We  couldn't have said it better ourselves. We strive to make every guests stay comfortable as possible for every visit and I agree with you that this really shows through our amazing staff. We thank you for your feedback and we do hope to see you again soon on your next spontaneous Disney visit.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: We stayed in a family suite, and the two bathrooms were perfect for traveling with teens. The bunk beds were very hard, according to my 12 and 18 yo, but would prob be fine for littler kids. The breakfast was basic but fine, and The staff was welcoming and friendly throughout our stay.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you so much for reviewing your most recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your room and our staff. We work hard to make all our guests stay as comfortable as possible on every visit. I will be sure to pass on your comments to management about the bunk beds and our breakfast to make improvements. Thank you again for staying with us and we hope to see you again soon.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: I'm really picky about hotels & I really enjoyed my stay here. I stayed here a few years ago when it was a Comfort Inn & it was very bad. It's like night & day. The hotel was clean, recently remodeled, Keurigs in the room, good breakfast every day with hot items, security guard on duty, the pool & hot tub areas were clean. If I had to point out a negative, it would be that there are no elevators (dragging heavy suitcases up to the 2nd floor was a pain) & housekeeping comes late in the day, so when we'd come back for a swim & rest from Disneyland, our room would still be dirty & by the time we left, it was too late for them to come. Other than that, great hotel, friendly staff, was able to print my boarding passes, store my luggage, rooms were quiet & carpets were NOT dirty. (no
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you so much for your review on your stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We strive to provide accommodations that exceed our guest expectations on every visit, every day for every guest. We have been working really hard to improve our hotel and we are so happy to hear that you enjoyed it this time around. We do apologize for not having an elevator and our housekeeping leaving earlier then you'd hoped. We will be sure to pass on your comments to all our staff. We hope to see you again soon and thank you again for staying with us.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: Easy to find and plenty of parking. Simple check in. Clean and comfortable room.  Basic breakfast included, including cereal, egg and breakfast sausage, waffles. All reasonable quality. Breakfast room was sometimes a little crowded.  Room had microwave, coffeemaker, fridge and safe. Would have been nice to have something better for making tea, but we coped. Free coffee supplies were very limited - more could be purchased from reception.  Disneyland's parking is very nearby. Several restaurants, gas stations and a general store within a short distance.  Wifi was simple to connect, reliable and reasonably fast.  Whilst we were there, we suffered 2 power cuts. Definitely not the hotel's fault and one of them took out Disney's power briefly as well - I don't know how common that is
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, We are so happy to get your feedback on your most recent stay at The Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We strive to provide accommodations that exceed our guest expectations on every visit, every day for every guest. We do apologize for the power outage it took us by surprise as well. We are hoping to make some changes to the hotel like you mentioned in the breakfast room and the coffee machines. I will be sure to pass on your comments to the rest of our staff so we can make these improvements. We do thank you again for staying with us and we hope to see you soon.   Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: We used to stay at one the best westerns in the Anaheim area but found this little gem with free parking and free breakfast where could we go wrong. Awesome place to stay!! Would highly recommend!!!!!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We strive to provide accommodations that exceed our guest expectations on every visit, every day for every guest. We hope to see you again soon. Thanks for your feedback again.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary Heading: I definitely recommend this if you trip to Disney
Summary: Clean, Clean and Clean. Beds, pillow, sheets, bathtub all inside room are absolutely clean and new. My kids also enjoyed bunkbad in kid suite. I picked this hotel after I research review and it really did not disappointed me. I highly recommend this hotel if you plan to visit Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your review on your most recent stay at the Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so happy to hear you had such a pleasant visit. We strive to provide accommodations that exceed our guest expectations on every visit, every day for every guest especially for our Disneyland visitors. I'll be sure to pass your comments along to our staff (especially our awesome housekeepers.) Thank you again and we hope to see you soon.  Kind Regards,  Sarah

Summary: Room was very clean and housekeeping was excellent but room smelt damp even my 4 yr old said room smelled.  First breakfast was decent for continental (waffle maker) but second day they changed it and had frozen, cold, soggy waffles that were premade I didn't eat breakfast again it was awful.  Yogurt was strawberry most places have alternate choice as many are allergic (my daughter ) so breakfast was one reason for staying there and I never ate after first day.  Lastly I had a do not disturb on my check out day (11) They knocked at 8 and 9:30pm.  I had a 10 hour drive and needed to sleep.  It was an ok stay nothing horrible but not good per say. Shuttle service was inexpensive an easy. Close to many things including Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, We’re very sorry to hear that your stay experience was not as positive as you'd hoped. We attempt to exceed every guest expectation on every stay and I am terribly sorry that this did not happen for you. We will inform our staff of the issues you have listed so we can be sure to make improvements. Thank you again for your feedback and we are so sorry for the inconvenience.  Regards, Sarah

Summary: We only stayed one night in the kid suite with two bathrooms but it was wonderful. The room was clean and fresh. The only thing I didn't like was the breakfast. We have stayed here in the past and they had donuts and a waffle maker and fresh fruit but this time the fresh fruit was gone and the donuts were gone. I mean it wasn't bad and they kept it very well stocked and delicious just missing some things. One thing I have to say is the staff is always so nice and helpful! I love this place and will always come back.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your feedback on your most recent stay at the Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We strive to provide accommodations that exceed our guest expectations on every visit, every day for every guest. Our Team members will be delighted to hear you were happy with their service.  We are trying some new changes around here and apologize that you weren't happy with the breakfast. I will be sure to let the upper management know. We hope to see you again soon and thank you for staying at Stanford Inn & Suites.  Regards, Sarah

Summary: Stayed 4 nights with family of 6, 2 adults, 4 kids (13,11,8,6yrs).  This hotel was GREAT!!!  We had family suite, 2 qn beds and set of twin bunk beds and 2 full bathrooms!! The space was awesome.  EVERYONE had a bed to sleep in and not just a pull out sofa.  Room was clean, carpet looked new.  Beds comfortable.  The "kid" area had the bunk beds, TV and little sitting table.  It was PERFECT!. Everyone always says "barely in hotel, don't need the space"  but with family of 6, the space was a necessity after long day at parks and everyone was able to shower quickly with 2 showers.  Hotel about 1 mile from Disney, I think this distance was good because it didn't seem to have loud teens or young adults on spring break, they seemed to be staying at the closer hotels.  Other hotels we
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your review on your most recent stay at the Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim. We are so happy to hear you had such a pleasant visit. We strive to provide accommodations that exceed our guest expectations on every visit, every day for every guest. Especially for our Disneyland visitors. Our Team members will be delighted to see your positive feedback and we do hope to see you soon on your next Disney vacation. Thank you again.  Kind Regards,  Sarah

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights over spring break. It was a great choice as we were traveling with 5 adults and two children. We had a two room, two bath suite and it was extremely spacious. Not once did it feel over crowded or uncomfortable.   The main room has two queen beds, the fridge and microwave and it's own bathroom. There was also a table and chair to serve as a desk. The second bedroom had the two bunkbeds, a small childrens table with stools to sit on and the second bathroom. Both bathrooms had a shower/tub combo - a must with small kids! Also, the vanity area is outside of the shower area offering people a chance to get ready while other were showering. Beds were decent and we all slept good.(Not sure if it was the comfort or the sheer exhaustion of Disneyland!) The only
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you so much for your positive feedback on your recent stay at Stanford Inn & Suites. We are so happy to hear you enjoyed the suite as well as our accommodations. We strive to provide accommodations that exceed our guest’s expectations on every visit, every day for every guest. We will be sure to pass on these comments to the rest of our staff. Thank you again for your review and we will see you again in December.  Kind Regards, Sarah

Summary: Hotel offered free parking, free wifi, free hot breakfast.  Has Keurig coffemakers.  ART has two routes with shuttle stops in front of hotel.  Only negative was how loud other guests were whose children were running past the room to the breakfast area and those who decided to force children up at 7 am that were standing outside the room crying very loudly.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for you so much for your feedback on our hotel. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed some our amenities and do apologize on behalf of our other guests being noisy. I hope you understand some things are out of our hands and we do hope you come to visit again soon.  Thanks Again, Sarah

Summary: I attended Wonder-Con at the Anaheim Convention Center with my 16 year old son. The room was quiet, beds were comfortable, staff was friendly and helpful. Free breakfast was not bad and a great selling point. Great location to Disneyland, Convention Center, and Angel's Stadium.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your positive comments on your most recent stay at the Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim.  We strive to provide accommodations that exceed our guest expectations on every visit, every day for every guest. Especially for our Convention- going visitors. Our Team members will be delighted to see the impressions they gave during your stay.  We hope to see you again soon and thank you for staying at Stanford Inn & Suites.  Regards, Sarah

Summary Heading: Sheets were not washed when we checked in!
Summary: Everything appeared normal when we first arrived.  However, on the very first day of our stay, we opened the cover of the bunked bed and found a bunch of sand on the sheets.  The sheets were not only used but filthy, and the maid apparently just tucked the sheets back in to make it look like sheets were replaced.  We grew suspicious and checked the queen beds, and we found human hair under the cover as well.  We contacted the front desk and a staff came to inspect the beds.  She saw the sheets and apologized, then she switched us to another room, which was not fun to do at 11pm in our PJ's.   If it weren't for the sand, we would not have noticed that the sheets were not replaced.  Getting clean sheets is the most basic demand, and customers really can't do much to protect
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, We’re very sorry to hear that your stay experience was not to your satisfaction. We attempt to exceed every guest expectation on every stay and I am terribly sorry that this did not happen for you.    We have informed housekeeping as well as all our staff of this issue so we can be sure to make improvements.  Thank you again for your feedback and we are so sorry for the inconvenience.  Regards, Sarah

Summary: This hotel is nice and within walking to Disney. Carpet was really sticky in a few places but otherwise we were happy! A variety in breakfast would be nice but otherwise its hot daily! 2 bedroom suite with kids bunkbeds...we would stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your comments on your most recent stay at the Stanford Inn & Suites - Anaheim.  We strive to provide accommodations that exceed our guest expectations on every visit, every day for every guest. Especially for our Disneyland visitors. We will be sure to inform our housekeeping of your issue with the carpet and we very much appreciate the feedback so we can make improvements for our current and future guests.   We hope to see you soon and thank you again.  Regards, Sarah  Regards, Sarah

Summary Heading: Okay amenitys but will they LOCK YOUR DOOR?
Summary: We have stayed at this motel once before and had a really positive experience. When we arrived I could see the improvements to the property that were made in the last year and thought this would be a great trip. They now have the Disney bus stop right in front of the motel (we had to walk a few blocks before) and they expanded the seating for their complementary breakfast. We had a great first night but noticed that the inside bolt lock on the door was not aligned so that you couldn't use it. Before heading out to Disneyland we stopped by and showed the maintenance man who assured us he could fix this before our return.  We came back late (11:30pm) after a look day at the Park to find our Room door OPEN! We altered the front desk and the employee came to the room and we showed
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to parks and beach. Great two room suite at a great price!
Summary: This isn't high end. It is very clean, very nice and upkept well. The staff are friendly and helpful. It is a great price for a two bedroom suite. It has a good outdoor pool and the fitness center was nice to use as well. All around--- I would choose it all over again! Great family place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your positive comments on your most recent stay at the Stanford Inn & Suites in Anaheim.  Our first time guest's frequently find our hotel and instantly get to know our Southern California " vibe" throughout the entire hotel, staff and accommodations. We strive to provide accommodations that exceed our guest expectations on every visit, every day for every guest. Especially through any on-going renovations. Your positive feedback makes it all worth our efforts.  Thank you so much and we hope to see you again soon.  Regards, Sarah

Summary Heading: Good location, but very basic accommodations
Summary: This hotel is in a great location for a short bus ride to Disneyland.  Unfortunately the room was only "adequate."  There was no comfortable chair to sit in and no table where we could relax with a game of cards.  These are standard in most other "budget" hotels.  The tap in the sink was so "gummed up" I had to take it apart and remove the "goop" and put it back together again before we could use it.  The carpet seemed quite dirty as our feet were dirty when entering the shower.  The shower temperature fluctuated all the time.  Some days we could only get cold water and had to leave it for a while.  The first morning we were there, there was banging and sawing going on above us at 8am.  When I mentioned it to the man at the check-in desk, as well as the tap, he didn't seem too
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We’re very sorry to hear that your stay experience was not to your satisfaction. We attempt to exceed every guest's expectation on every stay and I am terribly sorry that this did not happen for you.  We will share your comments and feedback with the entire staff for improvements and we do apologize again.  Regards, Sarah

Summary: The hotel was clean upon initial first impression, however, once we got settled we noticed the carpet was damp and we couldn't understand why. The dampness covered all of the carpet so I had to keep my flip flops on at all times because of what could have been lurking in the carpet. We couldn't get the WiFi to work AT ALL. We tried several times, even asked for help which the front desk was not very helpful with technical support. If you are going for the free breakfast be prepared to stand in line for at least a half hour to make a waffle, The other breakfast food items needed to be replenished on a consistent basis because guests piled stacks of sausage and eggs on there plates not leaving food for the other guest. If you wanted any breakfast food you need to go early and be
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We are so sorry to hear that your stay wasn't as positive as you’d hoped. We truly want all of our guest’s stay to be as comfortable as possible but unfortunately we do fall short at times.   Recently we've been trying to work on shampooing our carpets in a rotation. Unfortunately certain days we are busier then others and it's hard to have our carpets clean and dry before our guest's check in time.   We plan to pass on some of the things you've mentioned to all our staff so we can better accommodate our guests and we thank you for bringing these issues to our attention.   We sincerely apologize again for the inconveniences. Thank you again for your business and we do hope to see you again soon.  Thank You, Management  Stanford Inn & Suites

Summary: Family suite with bunkbeds. Family of 6 plus a toddler. Everyone had a bed. Recommend family suite with 2 restrooms. Spacious, clean, small fridge and microwav. Excellent customer service. Free breakfast that filled us up. ART shuttle picks up right in front of the hotel then drops off at the front of the disneyland entrance. ART shuttle is $12 for unlimited rides for 3 days. price is affordable. Would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect place for a Disney visit.
Summary: We spent most of the time at Disneyland but it was so great having a comfortable bed for everyone to come back to without breaking the bank. It was nice having a free breakfast and the bus so convenient. The pool was great when we needed to cool off and relax. We would definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great time here.  The place was clean and well maintained.  The staff were ALL very friendly and extremely helpful.  The breakfast was good and they never ran out of food.  The pool and patio was clean and never crowded.  They had security at night but it is quite a safe area so I didn't feel like it was really all that necessary.  It was close to Target and other convenience amenities and only a 10-15min walk from Disneyland.  And best of all it was very affordable!  We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Anaheim is sort of a hell-hole in my opinion. Too many people, cops, cars, smog, concrete. A touristy trip to D-land is the only reason to come here.  My husband and I braved through it for one night to visit family & friends, then hurry home to our tranquil oasis. My parameters were, find the cheapest place that didn't have a review that said it was dirty. This place wins! The room was stuffy upon entering, but the a/c cleared that up right away. Room & bath were clean. Every item in the bath, from towels down to the TP were pleated with "fancy folds"! Kinda overkill, but A+ for effort and attention to detail! Not a trace of cigarette smell! Another bonus! I'd stay again if I had to.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was amazing!  So accommodating, and helpful.  They made our trip awesome!! I definitely recommend the shuttle to and from Disneyland.  My kids loved swimming in the pool, we loved the breakfast before heading to the park, and we loved the staff.  Thank you for all your help!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Awesome for first timers in Anahiem
Summary: Awesome  value for money. Breakfast was good with good selection Nice  size room pleasant and Helpful. Close to good restaurants with plenty of choice.  Busstop outside hotel For Disneyland and short walk for other services.Thank you for a pleasant stay.. Recommend highly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family has stayed at this hotel every year for the last 7 years.  They are fantastic, family and pet friendly and very clean.  The breakfast has a really good selection, lots of choices for the whole family. The walk to Disneyland is a little long but they have added the shuttle services within the last few years and made it an affordable add on!
Manager Response: Greetings Marissa, We are so sincerely grateful for your business and are happy to hear you enjoyed our hotel. Just a friendly reminder that we do not allow pets in our hotel. We do hope to see you again though and thanks again for staying and Stanford Inn Anaheim.  Sarah  Guest Relations

Summary: This hotel was pretty average, clean and comfortable. There wasn't much breakfast selection and our room was kind of small. The staff here were very friendly and made us feel right at home. Only a short shuttle ride to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best value if you're going to Disneyland
Summary: I did a LOT of research before selecting this hotel for our family trip to Disneyland. I was very pleased with the hotel overall.   BREAKFAST: The breakfast is great (waffles, toast, sausage, eggs, cereal, oatmeal, etc.) and it certainly saves a lot of money to eat at the hotel before going to Disneyland. There are 3 waffle machines which were very popular, though there was often still a line to use them. There was no variety from day to day in the food options, which was disappointing. The other gripe I had regarding breakfast is that breakfast starts at 7:00 on weekdays. Disneyland opens at 8:00 (or 7:00 if you have a Magic Morning pass). If you have kids, it is very difficult to eat breakfast and catch the ART shuttle in time to make it to Disneyland by 8:00. It would be
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good room for a good price.
Summary: I came to Disneyland for a family vacation. I was very happy with the room and the price. The breakfast was good and the staff was very friendly. I arrived an hour before check in and they happily let me check in early. The room was clean and parking was great. Will definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff at this hotel was friendly & helpful before we left for our trip. Once we arrived they were even more friendly. They gave us directions to places we wanted to visit. The hotel isn't  much on the eyes, but the rooms and staff make up for this. They have a 24 hour guard which made me feel safe. Their breakfast was fabulous. My 2 only complaints are that they didn't have enough outlets for all of us to plug in our phones and other things & they only have an ice machine down stairs. When your tired and sore its a pain to go up & down the stairs. The prices are reasonable. If we were to travel to L.A again I would definitely stay there again. Thank You to the girls there for all your help.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A great room with two queen beds and an adjoining room for the grandkids with bunk beds, their on tv and their own bathroom. We had plenty of room all around. The free breakfast was great so we didn't have to drive around looking for a place to eat. The shuttle service to Disneyland picked up and dropped off right in front of the Inn. Saved us so much aggravation driving to Disneyland and parking.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good value hotel near the Disneyland action
Summary: Great location, just a short ART shuttle ride to Disney (they sell the ART passes in the lobby too). Our room was good sized and very clean. I loved that the shower had great water pressure and the water was super hot! Breakfast was so-so. They had waffle makers but if there was a line, it was a wait. Free parking and wifi make the price even better. Only downside we experienced was with the safe in our room. It malfunctioned and we could not get into with the code we had programed. Housekeeping had to come and mess with it for a few minutes to get it to open. But really that was a minor issue as well. We would stay here again if we didn't want to stay at the Resort.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and had an overall great stay. Room was clean when we checked in, friendly staff, plenty of towels in the room, small fridge and microwave made it convenient, breakfast is available in the early am, it's a basic waffle, eggs, sausage, toast, but for being included in your stay I thought it was pretty good. There is also plenty of restaurants nearby. My family and I were there for a two day trip to Disneyland, I will definitely stay at this place again in the future.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good spot near Disneyland for families
Summary: Nice and clean. A little too loud in spots and not enough towels left for our family each day but otherwise a fabulous room for the price and would recommend this to others for a good, family place near Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Been here for in 2014 for Vidcon. Location was great because i could walk to the convention centre.  Also there is a bus stop nearby to go to Disneyland and tickets for bus and Disneyland sold at the hotel so that was easy too.  Swimming pool is a plus for those hot days you got overthere. Room was oke, big enough for me. And i got a double bed for myself which was a big plus too for me. Only downfall for me was the internet but thats because of the speed and limit for downloading larger files (like YouTube and/or Netflix steaming). This was stated in the hotel rules. The breakfast wasnt like my kind of thing. Everyday the same with no variation at all. If you like waffles you will find yourself in for a treat there. So conclusion is that its a good hotel for the money you have
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location, about 1.5 miles from Disneyland. A short walk away from there or even shorter drive. They sell tickets at a great price for the bus. Conviently located by lots of Restaurants and fast food.  Room was very clean and amenities are abundant.  Microwave, Fridge, Hair dryer, safe and LED TV. Keurig coffee maker in room. But have to buy the pods and cups at the Check in counter. Beds were medium...not too soft/hard. Lots of pillows and towels in the room. Usually have to ask for both at other locations.   The free WiFi and breakfast was nice. The breakfast was not your typical continental breakfast of juice, coffee, toast and muffins. There was also Hot and cold cereals. Make your own Belgium waffles was nice. They had 3 waffle makers, so the wait times were to long.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel for family vacation, not business.
Summary: I  selectedthis hotel due to the limited availability of hotel rooms in the area but my trip purpose was business not family / Disneyland. Maybe it will work better for this kind of family vacation. Big room with 2 bedrooms and 4 beds (one bunkbed) and cartoon characters drawings on the walls.
Manager Response: none

Summary: i booked the Stanford based on TA reviews and am so glad we did.  The 2 room / 2 bath suite was great for our family of 5. My 13 & 17 year old boys slept in the rooms with the bunkbeds.  The beds were long enough for my 6'3" boy. He could stretch out on the bed...his feet touched the end but it was a standard twin size mattress which I was glad to see.  They loved having their own TV and the 2nd bathroom made getting everyone ready to go so much faster and easier.   I loved having the 2nd bathroom!!  My 19 year old daughter, husband and myself slept in the two queen beds of the main room.  Our little fridge was great for drinks and leftovers from dinner the previous night. The little freezer part in the fridge actually worked and froze things..even though there wasn't a separate
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good location to Anaheim convention center and Disney Land. Good breakfast and free hot water and coffee in the front desk. Rooms are out dated but clean. bath towels needs to be changed. Coffee machine does not work. Too less electric outlets in the room.  Staffs are friendly and helpful.  If has a printer in public area will be helpful for business travelers.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I got the Kids suite, loved it. I go through my rooms with a magnified glass, it was perfect!! Loved the staff. Room was clean. Staff was great. My only little comnplaint, I wish they would leave the breakfast open a little later. Staff was great. They have a 24/7 security guard, not that they need it, but she was AMAZING, she was even very friendly.. There is even a little shuttle to go to and from Disneyland... We will definitly stay there again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel room was fine.  The bathroom was nice, but the rest of the room was in need of updating, which isn't really a big deal.  More annoying were the overly thin walls where I could hear everything said in the rooms next door and the fact that the maid just waltzed through the door even though we had the do not disturb sign up...which is ridiculous.  It wasn't even the check out time yet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Staff was very friendly and helpful, quick and easy check-in and check-out. Shuttle stops right outside the lobby. Everything went very smooth. Rented Kids Suite, room was clean and great. Our boy loved the bunk beds and having his own room. Continental Breakfast was tasty, but nothing too fancy. Bathrooms were clean. We didn't use the pool, hot tub, or other facilities, so can't review those. No complaints. Will stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Stanford Inn & Suites is the BEST in Anaheim for style, service, price
Summary: I was surprised and delighted that a hotel that was so reasonably priced would be so clean, good looking and have such amazing customer service. The manager was a prince and the room was really great, with super comfortable king bed and all amenities, including pool, jacuzzi and nice breakfast. The other hotels on the block were double the price. This is definitely THE hotel if you are attending a conference at Anaheim conference center or going to Disney Land, and don't want to spend a fortune. Also, parking was free, when everyone else on the block was charging $40 to park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: No complaints, great value! Staff was super friendly. We had one problem with the chain on 1 of the toilets, it was fixed by the time we got back from Disneyland that night! Breakfast was nice, nothing spectacular but good. Staff brought extra sheets, blankets, & towels whenever we asked. Beds are alittle hard but still tolerable. A bit of a walk, on the way home from Disneyland especially, but not the hotels fault, just an FYI. Would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: really good place to stay for trade shows, or Disney
Summary: The suites are nice and roomy, if you need anything the staff is very solicitous.  The exercise room needs to be bigger, but there is plenty of parking, a  nice pool and the breakfast is very good for a free breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not the best bang for your buck
Summary: Me and two friends stayed at this hotel for two nights. I found two black hairs on the towels, one in each bathroom, room was musty.  We booked two queen beds but when we got to the hotel had to pay for another room because the room we checked into had a second bathroom and two bunk beds as well. Tv didn't work in the main room. Low water pressure in the main shower. I booked on tripadvisor and when I got to the hotel they changed me again on my credit card when I arrived at the hotel. So I was charged twice for the same room. This was straightened out right away but I am still waiting for my refund on my card. Otherwise very close to Disneyland and free parking with a security guard and the hottub was warm.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: 4th stay and we will stay again
Summary: This has become our go to for visiting Disneyland.  (our daughter works there) No complaints. Love the waffles for breakfast.  We had a minor incident outside the door of our room late one night, called the front desk,  and security was there in a minute.  Very friendly staff too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We go to Disneyland every year and have stayed in many different hotels in Amaheim and this is easily our favorite in its class. Our room was remarkably clean. The breakfast and free parking are awesome. The flat screen TV's and bathrooms are great. Most of all, the hotel Staff is delightful. We checked out and wanted to spend our last day at Disney and they still let us stay parked there all day for free. This hotel made our vacation so much better. We will definitely stay again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not as good as I remember, but it's still very nice.
Summary: We took an impromptu trip to Disneyland on March 3-5 2015. We had stayed at this hotel when it was a Comfort Inn and loved it. We haven't found a price we liked on other trips,but this time the price fit right in with our budget. We checked in without problems or surprises, but the room seemed much smaller than we remembered. The micro-fridge did not fit our needs at all. The fridge was badly designed and didn't have a freezer for our ice packs and the microwave wobbled horribly. They also had a recalled coffee maker taking up valuable counter space on the vanity.The beds made up for this, they were really comfy! The shower was nice,good water pressure and even temp throughout The breakfast although good didn't have the variety we remembered, and the eggs were preformed little
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in a standard 2 queen-room last January. It was clean and the beds were comfortable. I'd improve the breakfast as it is short of options. The hot cakes were the best they had, no muffins nor donuts or croissants. We already knew it when we made the reservation because we'd already checked other passengers' reviews but we considered the price and location which is very good. Besides, people at reception desk and staff in general were very helpful. One night we arrived with food to heat in the microwave and it did not work, they immediately replaced it and we were able to have our dinner. They have washing machines, which we used. I'd recommend this hotel for people who don't mind staying in a simple but neat hotel with very easy access to go in and out all the time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We put several months of planning into this trip and made quite a few calls with questions before deciding to stay here. Each time, the staff was friendly, patient, and helpful.  We have a family of five with three girls (9, 8, and 3) and we all loved the  bunk beds! The separate room was really great, especially for a six night stay.  The breakfast was alright, nothing too spectacular.  Overall, we would certainly stay here again. We got the room we booked and had great customer service along the way.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice room for large family at good price. 2 bathrooms   in suite was really helpfull. Kids loved the heated pool even when it was chilly at night. the breakfast needs improvement. Always the same  everyday and not enough variety.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Decent Disneyland area hotel - 3.5 star rating
Summary: I would give this hotel a 3.5 star rating.  It is not very close to Disneyland (I knew this before I booked) and the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) was not always timely so transportation to/from Disneyland could take up to 45 minutes (including time spent waiting for the bus).  We stayed in a standard 2 queen room.  Pros: -Clean & somewhat updated bathroom -Comfortable beds/pillows -In room mini-fridge & microwave -Decent free breakfast (waffle making stations) -Low cost -Free parking -Free (and fast) WiFi -ART pick-up & drop-off was right outside  Cons: -Far from Disneyland -Somewhat noisy if your room is close to Harbor Blvd. -Eggs & sausage at free breakfast were not appetizing (eggs were dry & pancake shaped, and sausage was greasy) -In room coffee maker was not usable (there
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good for the money you spend
Summary: When you pay $70-$80 per night on a hotel room near Disneyland, you don't expect it to be the Waldorf Astoria. The beds were very comfortable, the shower heads were AMAZING, parking and wifi were free, there's a microwave and a fridge in the room, and it was relatively quiet. The TV was crooked on the stand and there was a note on the Keurig machine saying that it has been recalled and instructing us not to use it. We laughed at both of these things because it was just so ridiculous. Why not just take the Keurig machine out of the room?   We were there for two nights and experienced no catastrophes. It's exactly what you want when you're basically using the hotel to sleep and shower.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here Feb. 20 thru the 23rd 0f 2015. We stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom family suite that was great. It was perfect for us as we were traveling with our daughter and our niece. The 2 bathrooms allowed us to all get up and get ready fast and easy without having to wait to use the bathroom. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The two queen beds in the main room were AMAZING so comfortable I could have slept in, it made it hard to want to get out of bed. Most places you stay the bed is just ok but this one had the best bed I have slept in at a hotel in ages and the pillows were just the right amount of soft and firm. Just what I like. The shower was AMAZING as well. The water pressure was great! I loved the shower head they have it was just the right amount
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great service...SO friendly! And it really was an exceptional value for being so close to Disneyland! Free parking, heated pool and spa (unfortunately we didn't get to use it though), and a very well-priced and well-liked kids suite with bunk beds, an adorable mini table &chairs set, and their own tv. Will definitely be using this hotel again in the future.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great value for a family of 6!  Breakfast was decent but the value for the type of room was great!  We paid about $105 per night with a room for 6 and two bathrooms. The Disney characters on the walls made it even more fun for our kids.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We enjoyed staying at Stanford Inn and Suites for 5 nights for our recent Disney trip. The ART stops right in front of the hotel and that made it very convenient to get to the Park. We also walked a couple of mornings and one evening (missed the last shuttle). The ART shuttle is DEFINITELY worth it. The walk is about 20-30 minutes. The kids loved the Mickey sheets and the Mickey stickers on the wall. We loved having them in their own space and TV. It was so wonderful to come home to tidied rooms and made beds. We made sure to get to breakfast on time and never had a problem finding a table for our family of 5. The kids loved the waffles every morning. It was a real money saver for us and everyone had a large breakfast to get ready for a full day at the park. We did hear the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I will never stay anywhere else near Disneyland
Summary: You can probably understand my review just by the title, but this place is great and deserves the praise.  Some background: we (2 adults, 4 kids age 6 and underr) stayed at this hotel for five nights in a two bedroom, two bathroom kids suite. Having four small children, I am mildly terrified of staying in a hotel with them. One room just isn't enough for all of us and two rooms is too expensive. The kids suite solved this problem like no hotel I have ever stayed at. One room with two queen beds, one room with a bunk bed (and space for a crib), and two separate bathrooms. I still cannot believe how comfortably all six of us were at a hotel together.  The rooms and hotel grounds were nice and clean, but not fancy. I would describe the beds as perfectly average, and I mean that in
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked this hotel because I was trying to be more budget conscious for our family trip to Disneyland. It was not worth it for our family. After a long day of traveling, we walked in to our room which smelled of mold / mildew. We were tired, it was a place to sleep, it was fine. Well, not really. The beds were not comfortable, the pillows are small, squares that are stuffed in a standard size pillow case. The room appeared to be clean, aside from the smell, however my toddlers feet were black after walking around barefoot on the carpet. I had to babywipe them several times since she would not keep her socks or shoes on. The water in the shower and from the sinks smelled funny and had an awful taste. This motel would be okay for a night. We ended up checking out early, even
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here at Stanford Inn and Suites for seven days, six nights. First night we stayed,  a suite was not available so we stayed in a King bed room with pull out bed. The bed was comfy and the pull out really fits one person or two small toddlers. Next day we moved to the Kids suite and the whole family loved it. Loved having two bedrooms and two bathrooms. The rooms were clean and very vibrant with color and disney decor.  The beds were super comfy and housekeeping was great. We tried breakfast one day but opted not the rest of the days since we aren't morning people.  Overall it was an outstanding stay and for the price I would def. be staying here again!!! Fyi: I spend hours on trip advisor and Yelp looking into quality and best places to stay. I was a little scared to
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here with our four little ones ages 2, 3, 5 and 6 years old for 5 nights.  We had the two bedroom two bathroom suite.  We have never had as comfortable of a stay as we did this trip.  We were all comfortable and the kids slept great.  My oldest son and husband went to the pool one night and had a blast.  The pool was warm enough to swim in at night in february!  Their bathrooms were recently updated and very clean.  The housekeeping every day did great at tidying up our room and making it a comfortable place for us to come back to after long days at disney.  Their breakfast was good and had a lot of options for everyone in our party.  Both sets of grandparents came and each had their own rooms with the king sized beds and pull out sofas.  Those rooms were great too.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel for families while visiting Disneyland!
Summary: We just got back from a 4-day Disneyland adventure. We stayed at the Stanford Inn & Suites. There were ten of us, which included four children, six and under. The family suite was incredible! It had two bedrooms and two bathrooms. There was plenty of room in the kids room with the bunk beds and space for a crib. They even had their own tv. The hotel isn't new, but it's really clean and the furnishings etc are really nice. It includes a free hot breakfast and WiFi. And the ART shuttle to Disneyland stops right out in front of the hotel. Though, it's only a mile straight down the street so it's easy to walk in 20 minutes, or have someone drop adults, kids, strollers, packed lunches, etc off at Disneyland and then park back at the hotel and take the shuttle to meet up with them.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I loved this hotel! We spent 9 nights in Southern California and were extremely thankful that we chose this hotel for a four night stay! The rooms were extremely spacious and clean. The reception staff were all quite helpful, there was one girl who works there in the evenings, however, that was particularly friendly. The free breakfast exceeded expectations and it's pretty close to Disney too!! Will probably stay again when I return to Anaheim!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for 5 nights. Great hotel close to everything. Rooms spacious and clean, housekeeping good!  A lot of people have complained about the breakfast??? Selection etc??!! It's included, don't complain?!!!
