I skipped the free breakfast as it was mostly family's going to Disneyland. No problem; there's a Denny's a few blocks away.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The prices are excellent for a hotel about 1.5 miles from Disneyland. It has a decent pool, a nice, hot, hot tub and a pretty good breakfast. They serve eggs and sausage, waffles, cereal, donuts and fruit with juice, coffee, milk and yogurt. This hotel has great quality of mattresses. They give a comfortable nights sleep. The shower is good with nice water pressure and hot water. The maid service is excellant-they are very friendly. For the price, it is a good choice for your Disneyland stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I needed a room for 1 night before we checked into our original hotel the following day (big mistake) this hotel was amazing! The service was great, Thursday night for $84?! I took it! The room was clean, fridge and microwave in room. 2 queens very spacious. I will recommend this place and even stay here myself in the future, rather than the hotel I stayed in for 4 nights.    2 thumbs up guys!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Stanford Inn has comfy beds and great prices.
Summary: The prices are excellent for a hotel about 1.5 miles from Disneyland.  It has a decent pool, a nice, hot, hot tub and a pretty good breakfast.  They serve eggs and sausage, waffles, cereal, donuts and fruit with juice, coffee, milk and yogurt.  They only problem is if you come during the last half hour of the breakfast time  you will be lucky to get anything-the donuts are gone, the fruit, eggs and bacon are gone.  The surprising thing about this hotel is the quality of the mattresses.  They give a comfortable nights sleep.  The shower is good with nice water pressure and hot water.  The maid service is good-they are very friendly. For the price, it is a good choice for your Disneyland stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall, I was pleased with my stay.  I picked this hotel because of the positve clean reviews, closeness to DL, Krueger Coffee machine and hot brekfest.  The carpet wasn't dirty and my room was clean,cozy and beds were soft. Loved the Krueger coffee machine! The hotel is 5 min walk to target where you can pick up coffee packs of 3 for $1.50 (front desk charges $1 per pod)   Brekfest, the other reviews were correct, yummy.  The walk to Disneyland was further than I had expected (20 min but felt like 40min) having said that, being 5min to Target, resturants and a great Shoe Warehouse made up for that long distance.   After a long day at both parks we paid $30 to get a cab back to Standford Inn & Suites ASAP. I don't suggest both parks in one day be prepared for long wait lines!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location is good for visiting Disney Land and dining outside. Several restaurants and stores are located near the hotel. Safe to walk around. Breakfast place is too small. I think it is better not include breakfast option with discounting room rate. Staff is friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The 2bd 2bath suite was nice from family of 5 for 2 nights, beds are comfortable, breakfast area gets congested but food was good. (the eggs need help) The shower actually had the best flow of any Anaheim motel we've been to. We usually stay across the Disney entrance and walk but chose here for the two bath, it's a quick drive to Toy Story parking lot.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean, upgraded room with fridge & microwave
Summary: Overall, I was pleased with my stay at Stanford Inn (which, according to a guy at the SuperShuttle, used to be a Holiday Inn?). I was initially disappointed when the shuttle drove into the hotel parking lot. From the outside, the hotel looked very (the most) run-down of all the hotels in the area. I thought it looked more like an Econolodge.... but once I stepped into the room, I was pleasantly surprised. All the electronics looked new; the room felt well-kept and/or recently renovated. Pillows were firm. Double Queen room was spacious, lots of walking area. The front office staff were VERY helpful whenever I had a question about the area and/or the room. I would have given it full points if not for the disappointing breakfast -- please either scale down on the breakfast menu or
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Valentine's Weekend with my mom and daughter
Summary: We stayed Valentine's Friday and Saturday.  I booked Tuesday morning and the only thing available through their website with 2 queens was a handicapped room so I booked it.  Pulling up to the hotel, I underestimated it as it looked like an older motel/hotel with exterior room entrances surrounding a parking lot.  First of all, service was excellent at the front desk and we were given room 139 which way over exceeded our expectations of 2 queens with a fridge and microwave.  We got an extra bonus room with bunk beds, another TV, and full bathroom.  We were even given an extra discount for AAA.  Shortly after check in, the front desk called our room to make sure everything was good.  I will say though that this is an older hotel so the walls are kind of thin including the ceiling.

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights, and were pleasantly surprised at the size of the suite. It was perfect for our family with the two separate rooms & bathrooms.  Parking was a little tight as it seemed to be booked up, but we managed to find a spot every time. Breakfast area would get really busy so we would go first thing to avoid the rush.  Definitely would stay here again. It was a bit far for us to walk to Disney, so we drove & parked there (it normally wouldn't be too long of a walk, however, after full days at the park the whole family didn't quite have the energy)!

Summary: The only issue was that the windows were thin.  My hubby ran out and got ear plugs for us and all was well in the world again...lol.  We will definitely be staying here again!  I have already shared the info with a ton of my friends!
Manager Response: none

Summary: As the manager of a motel myself, I make sure to really check for the cleanliness of any motel that I stay in.  This motel did not disappoint. The room was exceptionally clean and quite large. There was a slight sewer odor initially when turning on the faucet for the sink. But it dissipated fairly quickly.  We were able to catch a shuttle (which was $5.00 for each person, round trip) right next door that took us to and from Disneyland seamlessly. The breakfast was very delicious but I would suggest getting there early as it does get quite busy. If you are a smoker, be prepared for a little jaunt, especially if you are upstairs. They only have one smoking area out in the parking lot next to the pool.  I would definitely stay here again.

Summary: We stayed for 7 nights in the large family suite with bunkbeds and 2 bathrooms.  Our kids LOVED having their own bedroom and we loved that we could close the door between and separate from them after long days vacationing.  Had a Keurig machine in our room.  Target was just a few blocks away for supplies and snacks.  Breakfast was great; waffles, cereals, donuts every morning which saved us a ton of money eating out.  Very clean rooms and bathrooms.  Layout was great.  We were all so sad to leave this one.  Do not hesitate to stay here!!!

Summary: Good price, great location! Room is very clean and decent continental breakfast. The TV picture quality and in-room entertainment are beyond my expectation. Would definitely book again if coming back to the area.

Summary: I booked 8 rooms for my students for a Leadership Conference we attended in the end of January 2014.  The hotel stayed in constant contact with me and made sure everything was available when we arrived at 10:30 pm.  The rooms were clean, parking easy and was a short 20 minute walk to Disneyland.  The free hot breakfast had a variety of foods, waffles, sausage, eggs, donuts, toast, oatmeal, cereal, fruit and yogurt.  Plenty of seating even for my large group of 40.  Loved the setup of the suites with two queen beds and a separate room with bunk beds.

Summary: I book this hotel because of the low price and was very surprised with what I got. It was way above expectations!!   The rooms we're all updated and clean new carpet and furnishings. The only issue I had was that there was not a whole lot of room to sit and eat breakfast.

Summary: I was in town for a 3 day Disneyland trip.  The entire staff, from the front desk to room service, was extremely friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and quiet. It's about a 20 minute walk from the property to the main entrance to the park.  The next time I get to go back to the park, I will try to book this property again.

Summary: Great place, very clean, friendly staff, good free breakfast! Walking distance to the convention center.  In room fridge & microwave. HBO.  My only complaint would be poor lighting for putting on makeup. Would definitely stay here again.

Summary: Very clean rooms,and comfortable, free WiFi, and breakfast was good with lots of selection. Staff helpful and friendly.Very good value for money. Summary: Coming to Disneyland?  This is a great place to stay.  The ownership is clearly doing what they can to make this a comfortable place to stay. Summary: The room was clean, the breakfast was okay, and it was close enough to walk to Disneyland everyday. We got a room with 2 bathrooms, 2 queen beds and bunk beds. it was fine except I killed a cockroach on the last day of our stay.

Summary: My room was clean, service was friendly, and price was right! I appreciate free parking, wifi, and breakfast. Convenient to ART shuttle to get to Disneyland (though you can count on a 30 minute commute). I'd stay again.

Summary: Although this hotel is located near Disneyland, it's too far to walk. ART pick up right outside of the hotel. Summary Heading: Great place to stay for young family

Summary: I was amazed with the size of our room. We had the Jr Suite and it was perfect for six of us. The bathrooms were very clean. Summary: We stayed for 3 nights at the Stanford and were very happy with the room. It was roomy, clean, shower had very good pressure and water got hot very quickly. Summary: Perfect hotel for families.  Friendly staff.  We stayed in a family suite which had two comfortable queen size beds in the main room and a bunkbed in a separate room. Summary: Don't judge a book by its cover. Yes, this is an older motel. The walls are thin (we could hear every jump our precious nephews above us made). Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay. If you are on a budget, it doesn't get any better.

Summary: Upon arrival, I was upgraded to a suite room with two rooms. Our rooms smelled musty and old when we walked in. My 15 month old daughter's feet were black after walking around the room for five minutes.  We didn't spend much time in our rooms, as we spent most of our time at Disney. We enjoyed the beds and breakfast, but the coffee was sad.  The walls were very thin and we could hear the room next door when their small child was running and yelling at midnight.
Manager Response: Dear Sarah S  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  We appreciate your comments and will try to reflect your review on our continuous efforts to improve the property.  All the carpets were changed this year and are professionally deep cleaned on a regular basis.  It is, however, clear that our carpet cleaning problem for the past months has failed to meet our expectations.  We are implementing a new cleaning program and, hopefully, within a few days, we will see a difference.  Please accept our sincere apologies for all the issues you experienced at our hotel.  There are some areas we can't implement changes immediately, but, on the areas we can, the management will make sure they are implemented swiftly.  Thank you for your stay and please accept our sincere apologies.

Summary: The front desk was amazing, not only were they fast getting us in our room they had OUTSTANDING customer service, so friendly and smiles everywhere! The room was a great space, we had a king bed with sofa pull out bed and it was really roomy. The beds were comphy and clean. There were only 2 downside's to our room 1st was we were in room 154 I think and it is on the backside and the locked security screen door slams closed so at 12-3am being startled out of a sleep was a bummer but nothing a room Change wouldn't of fixed ( we would stay again just not 153 lol). The 2nd downfall was the carpet was dirty, I myself don't usually walk barefoot on hotel carpet anyways but this carpet had my feet black from the bathroom to the bed and back. I know a lot of people probably visit DL and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Rooms were cool but breakfast sucked
Summary: The rooms were decent, total in my family was six of us. We stayed in the family suite w a separate room for the kids and had two bathrooms. The two bathrooms is wut drew us to this hotel. Which was awesome for us. But the the breakfast was nothing to talk to mom about when u get home. everything was microwaved, the eggs, sausages and they're wasn't enough to accomdate the whole facility. So if u stay get to breakfast early. The door for breakfast shuts at 9:30am on the dot!! I would stay again bcuz of the two bathrooms which helped to get to disneyland quicker!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wow Great price,comfy beds, and darn good free breakfast!
Summary: So I found this trough hours and days of searching for a place to stay that wasn't over priced, but had comfy beds for my daughter after I knew I'd be spending over 10 hrs on my feet all day. Well I stayed here for 3 days and the other half at another hotel just in case it wasn't to my liking. This exceeded my expectations and I wanted to extend, but already had pre paid for the other place.  We were near the lobby with the food and every morning I was the first one there and made huge plates to take back for us to eat. I loved the sausage, eggs,bananas, waffles and donuts. It was not a huge place, but perfect for breakfast and free.  The beds were comfy and so were the pillows. My daughter loved and the internet worked Perfect for me to finish some school work. In fact I
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was clean, breakfast was free, pool was nice and quiet and the location was close to Disneyland and restaurants. Rooms were clean everyday and they were very accomadating to our needs. It was a great and recommended place to stay especially for the price
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed the middle of October for 2 nights in one of the Family Suites.  My girls loved the bunk beds and having their own TV to watch.  We liked that we could shut the door and stay up later than them/get up earlier in the morning.  The breakfast was ample and a great way to fill up before heading to the park.  I thought I read somewhere that the pool was heated, but it sure was not!!  Parking was free.  This hotel is not a 4 star hotel for sure, but you're not paying several hundred a night either.  If you want a good place to rest, quiet, and clean then this is your place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: As a base to explore Disneyland, this hotel was good value for money. The rooms were clean and had all the amenities. You can catch the ART near the hotel, which is convenient (albeit a bit sporadic in the regularity of its service).   Was extremely disappointed in the breakfast. The dining room was very small for the number of guests using it, the food was hard to reach, the coffee was terrible, and the kids were not enamoured with the food. By the third day we didn't even bother trying the breakfast, and went elsewhere instead.   While the staff on check-in were helpful and friendly, was disappointed with the staff on later days. They weren't particularly knowledgable of local guest services (such as the Disneyland Express bus to LAX) and weren't willing to call to make
Manager Response: none

Summary: It is an older hotel in need of some renos. The toilet kept breaking and we had to keep hooking the chain back on. We asked for a cot but it was so worn out we couldn't use it. Even putting the mattress on the floor was no good. The breakfast was the same every day and would run out if you didn't get there early enough. Not much variety. It was quite dirty. Our socks were black from the carpets.I would definitely pay the extra money to stay within walking distance of the park. Although this hotel is fairly close and the ART is convenient it still wastes a lot of time and the extra money you spend for the transportation could get you a hotel across from the park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed at the Stanford Inn and Suites (formerly the Comfort Inn) while on a trip to Disneyland.  I guess you get what you pay for. We found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful but the property itself was less than pristine. The room felt old and the carpets were gross.  The toilet did not flush properly (the chain in the tank was broken) and at night we had to turn off the water supply to the toilet because it kept running off and on every 10 minutes. The room also had a distinctly stale odor every time we came in.  The beds were fairly comfortable. Breakfast was adequate but not great. I don't like to complain but based on other  reviews I had read I was expecting something a little newer and cleaner.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Don't let the outside fool you!
Summary: Stanford Inn is conveniently located to the Disney Parks, and has a $5 per person shuttle service to the park.  Park tickets are sold onsite, they only had two available so we had to walk next door.  The hotel had a nice breakfast, hot and cold items.  It is a busy place in the morning!  The room was totally remodeled and nice.  Clean, quiet, microwave and small fridge.  There is a great restaurant next door, which was nice due to our late arrival.  I would stay at this hotel again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I travelled Anaheim for Disneyland with my two children. We stayed at Stanford Inn & Suites hotel for 4 nights.   We stayed in Kids suites rooms on the 2nd floor. No luxury, but they had everything we needed, with reasonable price(just room rate and tax only)!  Everything was free(breakfast, WiFi) including long distance calls.    Overall very clean and pleasasnt stay. My two children really loved their kids room.   Everyday, we used ART suttle and its stop was just two door down from the hotel, it was very good option and it just took 5 minutes to Disneyland.   Will definitely come back.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good if your on a budget.
Summary: We stayed here in Sept and early Oct for 7 days. This was the first week of our 17 day vacation. Our first room was a suite which our kids loved. However it was really musty especially in the closet and the carpets were filthy. The noise on the first floor was unbearable at night. Someone changing the garbage's at 3am right outside our door nightly. People above us pacing from 10pm till 1am nightly. The alarm clock in the room above us going off frustrating at 6am after we were putting in 12 hour days. Surrounded by slamming doors, banging on walls, showers etc. Not soundproof at all. Finally my husband had us moved to the upstairs floor at the back of the building at the end of the parking area. Finally some peace, but still filthy carpets yuck, the air conditioning dial didn't
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed with my girlfriend for three nights and it was great. We arrived to clean rooms every day after visiting friends and relatives in the area. Service was top notch as the staff were very friendly with every request we made. Everything in the rooms was well maintained and kept very clean.  Definitely would recommend to anyone looking for a great hotel for a great price.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Came here with my family of four for two nights. We actually had reservations for a later date, but called at the last minute to adjust. They were more than happy to do so. As mentioned the breakfast was better than expected. The amenities in the room were as noted. Wifi connection was easy to set up. The shuttle provided convenient transportation to where we needed to go. We did not have experience with pests as mentioned before. The one con I would point out is that the neighborhood is not exactly posh. However, overall we greatly enjoyed our stay here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here on a business trip to go to the Anaheim Convention Center during the last week of October.  A 5 minute walk to the convention center was very convenient.  Getting around Anaheim, ART shuttle in front of the hotel was also convenient.  3 day pass recommended to get the discount.  A good economy hotel.  Good wifi connection, free parking and free breakfast/coffee were a nice surprise for an economy hotel near the convention center.  Beds were clean and comfortable.  Nothing to dislike. I would highly recommend!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel with my family for 4 nights. My friend had a great time at this hotel during this summer vacation and recommended me as a great family hotel. She is a cool-headed person actually. My two daughters and I really enjoyed breakfast everymorning. Two connecting rooms in 2nd floor was great value for our family. My husband was in bad condition because of  long time driving but he got well after good rest in comfortable room. The bedding was clean and comfortable like home, the carpet was well arranged, in room safe was very useful. The kind staff kept our room clean everyday while we were in Disney and every staff we met always smile to us. Most of all, the price was great for family! Everything was free, breakfast, WiFi, parking. The location was good, just a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: SAVE YOURSELF THE TROUBLE AND STAY ELSEWHERE
Summary: Let me start by stating I only booked this place due to the reviews I found on this website.  Since there are so many good reviews, I chose to ignore the negative ones.  Please take this warning as serious and DO NOT stay at this establishment.  If I had not prepaid for this stay, I would have left after opening the door to the room!!! To keep this short I am going to just outline the pros and cons..  CONS:  Filthy Room Parking is sketchy (I had to park in restaurant parking lot behind hotel) Appliances don’t work (Fridge wasn’t working and after they “fixed” it, everything froze—including our baby’s milk) Black Mold in Bathroom  Writing on Wallpaper (800 number written on wall near phone) Carpets are beyond disgusting (My baby’s feet were black after walking on carpet for less
Manager Response: Dear Becky V,   Please accept our sincere apologies.  We are currently remodeling all of our rooms and we immediately blocked the room for remodeling.  In terms of parking, there should have been plenty of parking spaces within our premise, but, perhaps, our front desk failed to inform you of all available parking space properly.  The stains you indicate, however, are not mold and all of our carpets were replaced five months ago.  In any case, it is clear that we failed to provide a satisfactory stay to you and your family and would like to extend our sincere apologies.

Summary: We were very excited about this hotel.  We got a great price for a kids suite- the room was good sized, the beds very comfortable, and the shower was hot and had great water pressure.  This really isn't a hotel that you can stay in and walk to the park, but the Toy Story Parking Lot is reasonably close, so I would recommend parking there and taking the buses into the park.  Lots of restaurants are nearby and Target is a little over a block away, so you can easily grab snacks and drinks.  The room had a very good sized fridge and a microwave, and the breakfast was great (waffles, cereal, yogurts, juice and fruit).  Bring your own hair dryer, the ones there are old and don't work very well.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had such a great time staying at this hotel. The shower was a little dirty but nothing that was to bad. My kids loved the bunk beds and having their own room. The front desk staff was so nice. We got in late due to traffic and I thought we would have to talk through a window but the staff opened the door for me.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When I first booked the room I asked that we be placed downstairs, if no elevator was provided, I was traveling with my mother and she is not able to climb stairs. While checking in I noticed the room number was on the second floor, when I explained my situation the staff was super nice about changing our rooms. They said it was no problem at all and apologized for the mix up. We were given a handicap room, which was very helpful for my mother. The room was clean, beds were comfortable and linen was soft. I really liked the room, plenty of drawers for all our stuff, towels for all of us, the room also had a fridge and microwave. The only complaint was the shower head seemed to be clogged or the water pressure was not that great because the water seemed to dribble out. We were
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Enjoyable and comfortable stay! Will stay again!!
Summary: We really enjoyed staying at the Stanford Inn and Suites. I would say the only complaint I would have is the screaming kids in the morning. We were on the 2nd floor a little above the breakfast room. We unfortunately were woken up every morning to kids screaming and crying outside. Aside from that I have no complaints about this property. It was reasonably priced and clean. It was within walking distance to many restaurants and shopping. Bed and pillows were very comfortable. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. Other reviews said feet were black from carpet. We did not experience that, carpet was brand new. I say feet were black from walking all day in black-soled flip flops. Now if only Disney was as pleasant and reasonable...
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed this past weekend at the Standford Inn and Suites and had a great time. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly and the room was a good value. My kids loved the bunk beds and I loved the super comfy pillows!  The pool and hot tub were both great too. We had great help from the staff coordinating transportation and late check out. Breakfast was busy but the food was good. The coffee was the only bad thing I had!  Overall I would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for 4 nights on a family vacation to Disneyland.  We had reserved a 2 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms.  The kids loved having a separate room  (2 1/2 and 5) and it made it much easier to get them to bed at night, but still have time for the adults to relax and watch TV.  The breakfast was the same every day, but not bad at all.  They had waffles, cereals, sausage and eggs and fruit.  It was included with the hotel price, and it made morning more affordable.  We would definately stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great stay under previous ownership, have yet to try the new one
Summary: I stayed here back in December when it was the Comfort Inn Maingate. I was actually debating booking this place for $70-$80 p/n or a mystery hotel for $44 p/n on Hotwire. Well, I chose the Hotwire option (as it was a 1 week stay so I could save a couple hundred dollars) and guess where I ended up? Yup, the same hotel and I saved a lot of money by taking that gamble. I was very happy with that turn of events. The motel looks a little questionable but I was very happy once I set foot in the room. There's an outdoor pool and sauna which I utilized one of my nights. It's a trek across the parking lot from the rooms though, so no poolside rooms. There's a wonderful breakfast in the mornings, as I said I paid $44 p/n and I think the breakfast was worth about $10, so if I had a family
Manager Response: Dear Andrew R,  Thank you for your stay and taking the time to share your experience.  The ownership changed in November '12.  So, we are probably under the same ownership from your last stay with us.  We changed the flag from Comfort Inn to Stanford Inn & Suites this year.  We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and would be honored if we could be of service to you and your family on your next trip to Anaheim.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: Pay the money to stay in a nicer hotel
Summary: When my family pulled up to the hotel it was pretty much what I expected (older) When we got into our room it was sooo humid, and combined with the nasty odor it smelled like the room had mold. the room is out dated and could use some tlc. there is only one main light in the room and it makes it look like you are in a dungeon. the linens would have been great if it they didn't have big nasty stains on them. the one thing I did like was the friendly staff in the office. the only I would have liked is if they would have provided a little clearer information about the art shuttle since I had not been on it before. over all I think I will be staying somewhere else from now on.
Manager Response: Dear Chanel D  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  We apologize we failed to meet your expectations.  We are aware of the issues you address and will do our best to expedite the ongoing remodeling process.  Again, thank you for staying with us and please accept our apologies.

Summary: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Stanford Inn and Suites.  The staff bent over backwards to make sure we were comortable. The room was comfortable, clean and quiet.  Being able to eat a good breakfast quickly before heading out to Disneyland was such a bonus, as was being able to catch the shuttle right next door.  I will be staying here again when I visit Anaheim again.
Manager Response: Dear Lynn G,   Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  We are grateful for your business and are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.  It was an honor being of service to you and your family at this time and we look forward to another opportunity to be of service in the near future.

Summary: My friend and I stayed here for 6 nights in mid-September. The hotel was very clean and nice looking. The breakfast nook was roomy, I enjoyed the option of being able to eat outdoors as the weather was beautiful. The breakfast itself was pretty good. Waffles, cereal options, eggs, sausage patties, we never left hungry.   We ended up having a small problem with our room mid-trip and had to move. The staff were very accommodating, making the move as easy as possible. They also checked in on us the next day to make sure we were well taken care of and the switch had been smooth.   The hotel was a little further south of the park then we wanted to walk (especially after a long day of doing nothing but walking), but there was an ART stop right outside the hotel so this wasn't a
Manager Response: Dear Meaganinez,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  We truly enjoyed the opportunity to be of service to you and your friend and hope for another opportunity to be of service again in the near future.  We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced during your stay.  It was noted in our system and we will do our best to improve our system to preempt such issues.  Thank you for your business and hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Pros:  Room was clean and quiet.  Great value!  It was nice to grab something to eat before going to Disneyland.  Cons:  Bathtub didn't drain well.  Was not offered a 3 day ART transportation pass until the last day (didn't know that was an option).  Didn't matter because they ran out of ART passes anyway.    Overall, a nice place to stay after a long day in the park for the value
Manager Response: Dear Zoolyfe,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  We apologize our front desk staff failed to offer 3 day ART passes on your check-in.  We will review our front desk procedures to make sure we properly explain all options on Disneyland tickets and ART passes on your check-in.  We are still in the process of remodeling all of our rooms.  We will highly appreciate if you could provide us with another opportunity to be of service in the near future.  Thank you again for your business.

Summary: My family and I stayed here during the end of September for 5 nights. With the free parking and continental breakfast offered, we were able to save some money. We also got a great deal on the two bath family suite. The outside looks outdated, but I think they have done a great job of updating their rooms compared to the older pictures I've seen on here from past reviewers while under the old management. We were on the second level in the back which was fairly quiet. We had no issues during our stay. I would definitely come back the next time we are in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear JayCyNateRose,  It was simply a great honor to be of service to you and your family.  We hope your trip back home was good.  All of us here are looking forward to the next opportunity to be of service and would be honored if you could include us again on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights on August 30 and 31st. I gotta say, the room is very clean and my boyfriend and I were satisfied with the results of this hotel overall. This is our first time renting a hotel together and it was a great first experience. Disneyland is a couple blocks away but there is a bus right across the street that takes you to the resort. I got a couple bug bites here and there but... Eh. The cost per night was reasonable for the results. There was complimentary breakfast as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Kaitaya,  Thank you for staying us and taking the time to share your experience.  We truly appreciated the opportunity to be of service to you this time and look forward to another opportunity to be of service in the near future.  We have a pest control inspection and service on a regular basis, but we will review our pest control inspection procedures with our pest control servicer to see if we can better identify and prevent related issues.  We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you experienced during your stay and again hope you give us another opportunity to be of service on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great Family-Friendly Hotel, Close to Disney
Summary: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Stanford. We had a kid's suite and it was perfect! Our boys were so excited for the "Mickey" beds and they LOVED that they each had their own light! :) We were on the back side of the hotel and rarely heard anyone else. (It's possible that we just didn't have anyone next to or above us, but not likely). Breakfast was great. We loved the waffles and sausage. Yes, at times it was crowded and you had to wait to use the waffles irons, but hey, it's just good practice for Disneyland. :) The pool and hot tub were wonderful after the long day at the park! We came home early in the afternoon one day because our youngest was sick and the maid was so sweet when she came by. She gave our other boy a little game to play with quietly so his brother
Manager Response: Dear Andrews2007,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.  On behalf of all of our staff here, we would like to thank you again for staying with us and we would be honored if we could be of service again to you and your family on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: I stayed here for three nights. The first night was terrible due to the room proximity to the road. The next day I asked to be assigned a new room. The front desk personnel were Friendly and ready to help. The rooms that I stayed in were clean and comfortable. The rate at the time was also reasonable. WiFi was not that good. Breakfast area extended to the outside of the building and crowded.
Manager Response: Dear Epoch2011,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  We appreciate your valuable review very much.  This year, we have installed a new wifi system and it seems to have improved the overall wifi performance, but we will look into the issue again.  As to the breakfast room, we will also examine the seating arrangement, etc. to see if there's a better to service our guests.    Thank you for your stay and we would be honored if you could visit us again on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: We just finished a 4 night stay.  We had a kid's suite which was a huge hit with our kids.  They loved having bunk beds and their own room, and we loved having our own room after a long day at Disneyland.  The staff is extremely friendly and was constantly offering to help with bags etc. Beds were comfortable and fridge and microwave were invaluabe for taking food into the park.  The breakfast was plentiful and I was very impressed with the speed and efficiency of spill cleanups.  The only reason I didn't give a 5 rating is that even though the carpet looked very new, within a few minutes of walking on it, everyone had black feet.  Not sure what that was all about. They also could use a couple more high chairs in the breakfast area.  Overall, a positive experience.
Manager Response: Dear Doug,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  We are thrilled to hear we may have succeeded in meeting your expectations.  We changed the carpet in this past May.  We will review our housekeeping procedures with our housekeepers to make sure the proper procedures are followed to keep the carpet clean.  Thank you for your stay and we would be honored if you could visit us again on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: This place was amazing. Free wifi which was very helpful in finding our way around, a fridge/freezer. Comp safety deposit and tv. For what we paid it has alot. Reception very friendly and helpful. Beds comfy and noise kept to minimum. Safe, secure and even free breakfast. Pool was out of order for maintainence but I guess that was just bad luck on us, the beach isnt far away if you like bus rides
Manager Response: Dear Matthew,   Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.  We sincerely apologize for the pool closure during your stay and highly appreciate your understanding.  The pool remodeling was completed on September 13th and the pool reopened on 15th.    Again, we appreciated the opportunity to be of service to you this time.  We would be truly honored if you could include us on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: This is an edit to a previous review that I had to remove per Trip Advisor.  This is the edited review.  I previously rated it 3.  The rest of the party stayed an extra 2 days and it got worse.  The hotel property itself looks very promising.  It looks so good on the outside.  The good:  Free & decent breakfast, free parking, free internet, $5 per person shuttle nearby to Disneyland, free bottled water, the kids suite, microwave, frig & polite staff.  The bad:  Had daughter move to our bed from the bunk bed due to bug bites.  The various gnats flying around the bathroom and shower.  Slow bath tub drain, mold on door jam in the bathroom.  Walls are thin.  Bed sheets were damp.  There are no rails in the frig to secure drinks.  Not enough seating for a family to eat in the room.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very Decent Room and Access to Disney
Summary: We stayed 4 nights here while visiting Disneyland.  We were very happy with the two bathroom kids suite as the two bathrooms made getting the kids to bed quickly once back from a long Disney day.  The rooms did have an odd smell when warm and the housekeeping staff insisted on turning off the air conditioner while we were away at Disney.  I had to leave a note the second day to leave the AC on as we liked to return to the room in the late afternoon, cool off and go for supper before going back to Disney in the evening for a couple rides and fireworks/world of color shows.  The kids room did get very warm without the AC on so be sure to leave the door to that room open during the night once everyone retires.  We had the fan of the AC unit on all night to keep the room cooler.
Manager Response: Dear BrendaG72,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  We appreciate your comments very much and we will take every care so that your comments are reflected on our ongoing remodeling efforts.  On behalf of all of our staff, we thank you again for giving us the opportunity to be of service to you and your family at this time and sincerely hope to see you and your family in the near future.

Summary Heading: Great rooms, less than desirable service.
Summary: Great price for location. Love the adjacent kids room and comfy beds. Room had a weird smell (from the A/C but probably just needs a new filter). Overall a really great place for a budget friendly vacation.   Pool is being remodeled so we were told to go next door to the Ramada. Ran out of shuttle passes and were again told to go over to the Ramada (which ended up being a wild goose chase). The staff seemed to have a bit of attitude when asking for items (I.e. new hotel keys every night because they stopped working, extra bottles of shampoo etc)  I recommend this place if you get your shuttle tickets ahead of time and don't mind a few front desk mishaps. Otherwise just go to the Ramada ;)
Manager Response: Dear Provk3,  Thank you for your stay and taking the time to share your experience.  We sincerely apologize for all the conveniences you experienced during your stay.  Pool remodeling is expected to be completed shortly, and we will make sure our front desk carries plenty of shuttle ticket inventory.  Most importantly, we will review our front desk staff's service quality and find ways to accommodate our guests' needs better.  Again, thank you for your business and hope you provide us with another opportunity to be of service to you and your family on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: Good option for under $100 and close to Disney.  Hotel is dated but clean, beds were comfy, nice TV, and fridge/micro were good.  Enjoyable pool area, but the hot tub jets were not working the 2nd day.  Ice cold free bottled water was a plus! Free brkfst was a good way to start the day.  Staff were pleasant.  Internet was VERY slow in morning, but quick in afternoon.
Manager Response: Dear KathyPortOrchard_WA,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  We strive to provide a clean, comfortable stay to our guests and are thrilled to hear our services may have succeeded in meeting your expectations.  We also sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused by hot tub jets and slow wifi during your stay.  One of the wifi access points was down but we were able to address the problem fairly quickly.  As we will continue with our efforts to renovate our rooms and amenities, all of our staff would be truly honored if you could include us again as part of your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great value for the price; great place for families.
Summary: Great hotel for families traveling to Disneyland. Rooms are standard (nothing special) but clean and spacious nonetheless. Bathroom was recently renovated. Breakfast was again standard stuff, but again, for families it was great. There was a wide enough selection to ensure there's something for everyone. The hotel is fairly close to Disneyland; there's an ART bus nearby that takes you there quickly (no need to walk the half-mile). I'd stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear 514Mike,    I hope you and your family had a good, safe trip back home!  We truly appreciated the opportunity to be of service to you and your family at this time.  We will continue to improve and refine our facilities to better serve guests' needs.  We would be honored if you could include us again on your next trip in the area.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: Other Area Businesses Could Learn from Standford Inn and Suite's Employees!
Summary: I cannot say enough about our excellent experience at the Standford Inn and Suites Hotel and Staff.  My 14-year old son and I stayed there July 26-30, 2013.  All of the staff I encountered were very friendly and extremely helpful.  I arrived at the hotel about 6 hours before check-in.  I had planned to stop in to let them know we were in town and expected to return at 4 PM, killing time until then.  To my surprise, Jeanna and her co-worker offered to see if a room w/ 2 queen beds was available. Wow, housekeeping confirmed a room was available. We were able to check-in and rest before shopping...all 6 hours ahead of schedule!  From that point on, I had a feeling the service would be awesome here!   After our Disneyland day on Saturday, I'd planned a day trip to Hollywood on
Manager Response: Dear Traveler 8396,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  We truly appreciated the opportunity to be of service to you and your son at this time.  Jeanna remembers you well and is thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.  After the summer, we plan to embark on another program of upgrading our facilities.  We would be honored if you could choose us again on your next trip in the area.    Thank you.

Summary Heading: Good for off site Disneyland hotel.
Summary: We had the suite with the adjoining room with the bunkbeds. It had been recently remodeled & was very nice. Free breakfast was good but very crowded. Right on the route for the shuttle to Disneyland. Pool area is small but was clean
Manager Response: Dear UWcowboys,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  We appreciated the opportunity to be of service at this time and look forward to another opportunity to serve you and your family again in the near future.  We will constantly remodel and find ways to improve our overall level of service.  Thank you again for your stay.

Summary: We spent 5 nights here and it was excellent. The staff was so friendly !!  Always a smile when we passed. The housekeeping crew is top notch, the rooms well appointed with frig & micro. The grandkids loved the pool and the parents loved the laundry.       We rarely stay in hotels but this was a real treat. Itis near Disney and the Hyatt Conference Center where we went to an event.
Manager Response: Dear Veronica,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  We truly appreciated the opportunity to serve your family this time and look forward to another opportunity to be of service in the near future.  We are constantly renovating and doing what we can do to provide a clean and comfortable stay for our guests.  Thank you again for your review and choosing to stay with us.

Summary: We stayed here from July 8th through July 13th and had a kid's suite. We also booked an ajoining queen room for my in laws which was nice.Both rooms were nice and clean with what looked like new carpet in both. Bathrooms were clean and linens seemed pretty clean. Beds were very comfortable and my son loved having his own room (and we did too). We never used the pool but it seemed very busy with teenagers in the evenings which was fine, we didn't really have time to visit the pool anyway. Parking was good and we always found a spot even when returning late at night. It was nice and close to Disneyland but since we had free parking at the hotel we chose to drive and pay for parking at Disneyland rather than riding the ART bus.It is probably not walking distance for most.The
Manager Response: Dear Mcheugene,  Thank you so much for taking the time out to share your experience at our property.  It is our experience with families like yours that makes our job here so much better and enjoyable.  We understand you have many options of places to stay and thank you for your business.  We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay and we hope to see you next time you are in the area.

Summary Heading: Not bad for the price and location
Summary: Stayed here for one night and this is a no-frills place. The location is great close to Honda Center, Disneyland and the convention center.  The room itself was clean and a pretty good size. The beds are comfortable. The bathroom is a good size as well with a nice shower.  I appreciated how there was a mini fridge too.  There is a pool and ample parking.    Decent and recently priced hotel if you're looking to just sleep and shower, don't expect luxury.
Manager Response: Hello Kristine,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  We continue to make improvements on the property, but we understand there still remains many areas we can do better.    Thank you again for staying with us and hope to see you next time you are in the area.

Summary Heading: Thank you Stanford Inn&Suites Hotel and Gil Manager
Summary: I had not much time to plan and prepare our this trip because of my urgent business schedule.   I had to deal with it.   I was not looking for a 5-star-hotel but a place that would be able to provide my family with comfortable rest after an intensive schedule in the Park.   I thought reviews of Stanford Inn & Suites were pretty fair (Good ones and Bad ones. Fairly mixed).   So, I made a reservation for 5 nights from 6/13 to 6/18 with confidence of guest reviews.   Check-in was smooth. Staffs were kind and willing to help us to carry our luggage through the big parking lot to our room.   The room seemed very clean and the beds were neatly made.    The hotel could be differentiated from many of 2 or 3-star-hotels that I’ve stayed before.    I and my family had such an awesome
Manager Response: Hello Mr. Park,   We thank you for taking the time off to write your experience in regards to our hotel.  We are very glad you and family enjoyed your five night stay with us and we were able to accommodate all of your and your families needs in a timely manner.    We do apologize for the inconvenience regarding the plumping issue but we are very glad our maintenance team was able to situate the problem without any disturbance.    We will do whatever it takes to ensure excellent customer and for our guest to have a memorable stay.  Again, we thank you for your valuable comments and we take all of our guest's comments seriously.  We are looking forward for another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again in the near future!   Thank you.

Summary Heading: Reasonably priced, comfortable suites near Disneyland.
Summary: Took my grandson & my friend to Disneyland. wanted a 2 bedroom suite. found out that an old favorite hotel changed ownership & is now the Stanford Inn $ Suites. we tried it & were quite pleased. Great room, great location, well-maintained, nice breakfast, friendly staff.
Manager Response: Hello Romona,   We thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your experience at our hotel.  Yes, the ownership did change and we are at full force to ensure excellent customer service and make our guest feel like they are "home" away from home.    Again, we thank you for your valuable comments and we will do our very best to maintain our standard of excellence.  We are looking forward for another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again in the near future!   Thank you.

Summary Heading: Trying to be fair... In spite of a MAJOR problem!
Summary: The facility is nice for the price.... Rooms are of a good size, TV is ggod quality and has a "built in guide" (I HATE going to a hotel and not having a programe that tells me what's on and when).  Free parking and a decent breakfast this close to Disney... Is a "gift".    NOT walking distance unless you are a healthy 16 to 32 year old ( they have REALLY long blocks in Anaheim (like Las Vegas)... actual distance to park entrance is over 0.5 miles ( just FYI, my longest day in the park was 9 hours and per my pedometer, I walked 14.7 miles).    Great fridge and microwave.  Pool area nice.  Beds are good and they supply LOTS of pillows.    My "gripe" comes when on my second night, I have water backing up into my bathtub.  It was about 10 pm, a person came within 10 minutes of my
Manager Response: Hello,   Please accept our apology regarding your experience at our hotel.  Our maintenance crew was working around the clock to get the plumbing issue situated.  We will make sure the same mistakes does not happen twice.    Again, we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience and we are looking forward for another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Great rooms, check in staff could use some smiles!!!
Summary: I chose this hotel because we were looking for something that was inexpensive and close to Disneyland. We live in southern ca so we had a car, but were bringing 3 kids for 2 nights. When I first walked in, I was greeted at all to check-in. There was only one man there rushing around trying to get things in order. I stepped up and said I was checking in and he silently began typing on the computer. He asked me for my credit card, gave me some papers to sign and my room key. Didn't really say more than 2 words the whole 5 minutes! Awkward! He didn't give me my parking pass, but I knew to ask! It wasn't a bad check in, but if you are use to better treatment from a friendly staff you might not get it here at checkin. The room was really nice and clean. Simple, the windows are
Manager Response: Hello Danell,   We thank you for choosing our hotel and writing your experience.  We do apologize for any inconvenience during the check in process.  We are very glad you and your family enjoyed your stay with us.    Again, we thank you for your valuable comments.  We are looking forward for another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again in the near future.    Thank you.

Summary Heading: Great nights sleep and an excellent breakfast in the morning!
Summary: We stayed for 4 days and everyday the rooms were cleaned. The staff friendly and helpful. The breakfast was hearty and plentiful! The beds were super comfortable we had the suite with bunk beds and that was perfect for us! Water was always hot the beds made daily and food was great all on all it was an excellent stay. The only drawback was that they did not provide transportation to Disney for free you had to purchase passes for $12.00 per person, that gave you 2 days ride there and back as often as you needed.
Manager Response: Hello Sherry!   We thank you for posting your valuable comments in regards to our hotel.  We are very pleased you and your family/friends enjoyed your stay with us.  We did some extensive renovations with our guest rooms and facilities but we are not done.  We are coming with different ways to enhance our guest's experience.  We are glad to be of service to your and your family.    At the moment, yes, we do not provide shuttle service for our guest to and from disneyland. This can potentially be a possibility in the future. As of now we do sell the Anaheim Resort Transient (ART) tickets at the front desk.  We apologize for any inconvenience.    Again, we thank you for your valuable comments.  We are looking forward for another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again in the near future.  Thank you and have a great day.

Summary: We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel and it was a very good option for a not expensive hotel. The staff was really helpful and always smiling. The breakfast was very good, with a good variety, and the reposition was permanent. Rooms are really spacious and confortable. It has parking and heated pool. Dinseyland is about 1.8 Km from the hotel, and we went walking without any problem. Recomended hotel for the price.
Manager Response: Hello!   We are very glad you and your family enjoyed your stay with us for 5 nights we were able to accommodate all of your family and your needs.  Currently, all of our major renovations are complete but there is still a lot more to come.  We are doing everything possible to come with different methods and ideas to improve our guest room and our facilities.    Again, we thank you for your valuable comments and we are looking forward to another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again in the near future!   Thank you.

Summary: I like detailed reviews, so pardon me if I write one.  When we booked our vacation, it was the Comfort Inn, and we were a little concerned when the hotel changed hands.  We were encouraged, however, by the positive reviews of the new Stanford Inn & Suites.  Basically, all we wanted was an economy hotel with clean, comfortable rooms containing a fridge and microwave and providing a free breakfast.  Let's face it, we were going to be at the parks most of the time, and just needed a place to crash and eat a meal or two.  I was extremely impressed by what we got.  The rooms had been remodeled with new carpet and the like.  The mini fridge was actually bigger than I expected, and the microwave had plenty of power.  There was plenty of hot water, and the shower head had great output.
Manager Response: Hello Lisa!   We thank you for taking out your time to post your experience in regards to our hotel.  We are very glad you and your family enjoyed your vacation and had a memorable experience.  Our hotel, strives to ensure excellent customer and make sure our rooms exceeds our guest's expectation.    Again, we thank you for your valuable comments and we are looking forward for another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again in the near future.   Thank you!

Summary: We chose this hotel on our 3rd summer trip to Disney because we were looking for a hotel 1. Was on Harbor blvd and close to DL 2. Inexpsnsive despite location 3. Had free parking, wifi, breakfast. This hotel met every one of those needs and more! The staff is the friendliest staff i have ever encountered at a hotel, so nice helpful and pleasant! The breakfast: ok at other hotels they kinda shift around the front lobby and put food on the counters, but here there is a whole large room for BF, food is spread out nicely around the many counter space, a small back kitchen with employees making eggs, and there is a ton of seatng inside and outside on side patio area. Best Continental BF ive seen! Didnt check out the pool so have no review for it. Room was nice large very comfy
Manager Response: Hello!   We thank you for posting your experience in regards to our hotel.  We are so delighted our rooms and our service exceeded your expectations.  We are doing every thing possible to ensure excellent customer service and to provide comfortable rooms for our all of our guest.    We did upgrade our facilities and our guest rooms not too long ago and we will continue to maintain our guest rooms.  We are constantly coming up with ideas and methods of ways to improve our property.  We will continue to be the best we can be.    Again, we thank you again for your valuable comments and suggestions.  We are looking for another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again in the near future!   Thank you.

Summary: As with Palm Springs I found it very difficult to make a final decision about which hotel to stay in Anaheim.  Many of the larger hotels charge for parking which I refuse to do so I settled on this one.  It was adequate.  We were lucky that the room had brand new carpeting which was lovely.   We had paid for a king room but got upgraded to a double queen room which was appreciated.   It was unfortunately very near Harbor Blvd so traffic noise was quite loud.   We like to open windows when possible and it was impossible to do that.  The fridge, microwave, etc were very convenient.   The bathroom had been remodelled a little but the door was very old and looked awful.   The sink was separate from the bathroom which is convenient.  Plenty of free parking and we thought the location
Manager Response: Hello!   We thank you for choosing our hotel and we are glad you and your family had a pleasant stay with us! As you mentioned, our hotel is going through extensive renovations to improve our guest rooms and our facility.  Not only are we trying to improve our hotel for a better stay, but to ensure excellent customer service.    We thank you for posting your valuable comments and your experience in regards to our hotel. Again, we thank you and we are looking forward  for another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again in the near future!   Thank you

Summary: This is my second stay at what used to be the "Comfort Inn and Suites Maingate." It does have fairly spacious rooms and an unbeatable price for its location. It was pretty amusing though that the hotel changed name while I was there. I literally left the Comfort Inn one morning and returned to the Stanford Inn that afternoon. The Anaheim Convention Center is a short walk of about 7 min. and there are numerous restaurants and stores within a 5 minute walk.   The staff were wonderful, both the front desk and the new management. The clean, well-maintained rooms have refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. Breakfast is included and the buffet surprised me with eggs and sausage as well as the usual coffee, cereal, pastries, bagels, belgian waffles and juice. If management can keep
Manager Response: Hello,   We thank you for choosing our hotel and we are glad you and your family enjoyed your stay with us.  Seems like you came to our hotel right during the transition.  As renovations continues, we are so glad, our guests gets to experience our upgraded guest room and our facility. From this point, on, its only going to get better!   We thank you again for your valuable comments and looking forward to serving you, your family, and friends again the near future.

Summary Heading: Great Choice, would stay again(and again)
Summary: Great prices, spacious rooms with microwave, fridge and coffee maker(with lots of coffee). Showers were beyond awesome with great water pressure and hot water. Beds were soft and room was clean. Best part was the breakfast with hot waffles and many breakfast choices. Staff were very helpful and friendly.
Manager Response: Hello Jennifer,   We are so thrilled you and your family enjoyed your stay with us.  We thank you for your valuable comments and we take our guest's comments very seriously.  We strive to to ensure excellent customer service and to come up with different ways to upgrade our facility for a better experience  & enjoyment for our guest.  We are looking forward for another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again in the near future!

Summary Heading: Solid choice, needs a little more remodeling to be great
Summary: We asked for and received a remodeled room. It was very clean and comfortable. Beds were soft and there were lots of pillows. Microwave, coffee maker, and fridge were clean and worked great. Employees were friendly. Plenty of breakfast choices, including fresh waffles. The attendant kept tables cleaned and food full. The ART stop is 2 doors down, but not a big deal. The ride with off season crowds was about 20 minutes. The bad: Bathroom door didn't shut all the way. A lot of light came in around the room door and curtains. You might want to take some clothes pins to hold the curtains in place better. The hot tub was barely warm and very dirty. The water was so murky I didn't feel it was safe for my kids. The pool bathroom is broken. There were also several broken pool toys
Manager Response: Hello,   We thank you for choosing our hotel and we are glad you and your family enjoyed your stay with us.  We do apologize in regards the pool area.  At the moment, we are doing some extensive renovations with our pool restroom and guest laundry.    I can ensure you, our heated and pool & spa is maintained and cleaned through out the day.    Again, we greatly appreciate your comments and we are looking forward to serving you, your family, and friends again in the near future.

Summary: Stayed here with 2 small kids and it was overall a very positive experience. Our room was quite nice, staff were helpful and accommodating. There is private parking under the Inn, a relaxing outdoor salt water pool, and the rooms surround a couple of gardens that included fruits trees.   Great morning complimentary continental breakfast served at the main entrance that included waffles. I would definitely re-visit!
Manager Response: Hello,   We are so happy you and your family enjoyed your stay with us.  We thank you for choosing our hotel and we really appreciate your valuable comments.  We are striving to be the best in regards to excellent customer satisfaction and to upgrade our facility for a more comfortable experience.    Again, we greatly appreciate your valuable comments and we are looking forward to serving you, your family, and friends again in the near future.   Have a great day and thank you.

Summary: We really liked the family suite; I was able to sleep in the room with the bunk bed while my two sisters each had their own bed in the main room. The beds and pillows were very comfortable, and the waffles at breakfast were great. Yes, the walls are on the thin side like the other reviewer mentioned, but it didn't bother us too much.
Manager Response: Hello Nicky,   We thank you for choosing our hotel and we are thrilled you and your family enjoyed your stay with us.  Our hotel is going through some extensive renovations in upgrading our rooms and our facilities to ensure guest satisfaction and to ensure excellent customer service.     We are so happy you guys enjoyed your stay with us and we are looking forward to serving you, your family, and friends again the in near future.   Thank you.

Summary: This is a former Comfort Inn, and they haven't changed the phone listing as of 5/1/13 to their new name, so be sure to write their number down when you book!  I liked this place-nothing fancy, but the room was large, clean, and well-equipped with a refro, large tv, coffee maker, hair dryer, and lots of clean and fluffy towels.  The beds were very comfortable, but our sleep was interrupted every morning of our 3 day stay by a crying baby next door.  However, Anaheim is a place for kids, so it was all part of the experience.  This is a good choice for families, since you can book a room with an adjoining room for children if you wish.  i didn't need this feature, and it was nice not to have to pay for extra space we didn't need.  The breakfast had some healthier options such as
Manager Response: Hello,   We thank you for choosing our hotel and we are glad you and your family had a pleasant experience at our hotel.  We strive to ensure excellent customer service and to provide great service to our guest.    We thank you again for your valuable comments and looking for another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again the near future.

Summary: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Disneyland and its affordable price.  The hotel rooms have amenities found in much more expensive hotels:  flat screen TVs, refrigerator, safe box, swimming pool, coffee maker, free wi-fi, and very comfortable beds.  The free breakfast offered make-your-own waffles as well as a variety of other options.  There are several fast food restaurants as well as some more upscale places within walking distance. The hotel does show some wear and tear. However, during our stay, they were replacing the carpets in many of the rooms.
Manager Response: Hello Robert,   We thank you for choosing our hotel and we really appreciate your valuable comments.  We are very glad our hotel exceeded your expectations and you enjoyed the service our hotel has to offer.  We try to be very competitive with neighboring hotels in regards to amenities and to ensure excellent customer service.    At the moment, we are in the midst of replacing our carpets and upgrading the facility. Since, January, our hotel has been striving to upgrade our rooms conditions, shower, and our facility.    Again, we thank you for your valuable comments and taking the time to write a review about our hotel.  We are looking forward for another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again soon.

Summary: I searched for hotels for months before deciding on Stanford Inn. I was unsure what to expect as the reviews had mentioned a recent remodel. The hotel exceeded my expectations. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, the rooms extremely clean and all redone recently and a great [big] hot breakfast including eggs, sausage, cereal, waffles, bagels, donuts, yogurt and fruit. Definitely the best deal in the area. We especially enjoyed the kids suite (w bunk beds, tv and a little table) which allowed us some privacy at the end of the day! I will stay here every time I visit Disney!
Manager Response: Hello,   We are so thrilled you and your family enjoyed your stay with us and our staff was able to accommodate all your needs in a prompt manner.    As of now, we are still in the midst of extensive renovations regarding our rooms and to upgrade our facilities.    Again, we greatly appreciate you comments and seems like your research payed off finding the "perfect" hotel in the Anaheim area.    We are looking forward in serving you, your family, and friends again sometime in the near future.  We thank you for choosing our hotel as your second home every time your in the area.

Summary: this motel is slightly above average from other motels around the area. However, there's some areas that you need attention. This place is great if you just need a place to rest. there were just a few issues with regard to the cleanliness of the room. Upon inspection of the bed after turning down the sheets and pillows, I found one long brown hair underneath my pillow and a red stain.  Watermarks are also present on the pillow cases. The vent in the bathroom is literally coated in dust. The door jamb is broken in the restroom also.  I found the business chair.for the desk has a torn area, and if left exposed it.could carry bacteria.    On the positive, the room comes with a fridge and safe. It's spacious.  The a/c is cold as well.  I like the fact that they don't charge a
Manager Response: Hello,   We apologize for the inconvenience during your stay.  I can ensure you, our housekeepers & supervisors double checks all the rooms to make sure it is up to our standards.  If anything in the rooms needs to be fixed or repaired, our maintenance team is notified immediately for service as well as preventive maintenance.    I will make sure these incidents do not occur again.  Again, we greatly appreciate your comments.  We are looking to serve you, your family, and friends again in the near future.    Thank you.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel in the Disney area
Summary: Stayed here for a week for a vacation and this hotel was everything I was looking for. They had a great continental breakfast and the services was nothing but excellent. They also had Disney tickets for sale at the Front Desk so it was a convenience to purchase it from them versus waiting in line. There was also plenty of parking in the area so it wasn't a problem to have a car. I will definitely come back to this hotel.
Manager Response: Hello Ryan,   We greatly appreciate your comments regarding our hotel.  We are very thrilled you enjoyed our amenities and our staff was able to exceed your expectations.  We will continue to do our very best to ensure excellent customer service and to improve the overall experience for our guest.   Again, we thank you for your valuable comments and we are looking forward to serving you, your family, and friends in the near future.

Summary Heading: If your looking for a nice hotel near the Disneyland Resort, look no further.
Summary: If your looking for a nice hotel to stay at close to the Disneyland Resort, look no further. I stayed here over the weekend and the staff was great. The free breakfast was better than most of the surrounding hotels. Homemade waffles, eggs, sausage and donuts for the kiddos. The pool was sparkling clean and the overall cleanliness of the property was great, including the parking lot. Thank you again to Steve for the great recommendations to surrounding restaurants and activities outside Disney.
Manager Response: Hello,   We are very glad you and your family enjoyed your stay at our hotel.  It's only going to get better!   Thank you again for your valuable comments. We are looking forward to serving you, your family, and friends again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Not bad. Only stay here if you get a great deal.
Summary: My wife joined me on a business trip, so we visited Disneyland and were looking for a decent hotel at a good price.  Stanford Inn seemed like a fit. The price was very reasonable and the location was convenient for Disneyland. It also said it was recently remodeled.   Plus side: - affordable - relatively clean - comfortable bed - helpful staff  Down side: - not a welcoming environment (not very much landscaping...feels like you are staying in a strip mall) - not the kind of room you want to "hang out" in. It works for sleeping, not for lounging. - after the impeccably detailed and clean Disneyland, this hotel is a stark contrast. - the pool area looks old and in need of repair. And you have to walk across the parking lot to get to it.   Bottom line is if you are on a budget,
Manager Response: Hello Mike & Katie,   We appreciate your valuable comments and suggestions.  At the moment, our hotel is going through extensive renovations to improve our property and for guest satisfaction.  We are considering redoing our landscape and gathering ideas to improve our property.    Again, we thank you for your valuable comments and hopefully in the near future you will reconsider giving our hotel another chance.    Thank you.

Summary: Stayed here with my three sons in kids suite.  Boys loved the free on demand Disney movies in their room, affording me some good rest after a very long day at the Disneyland.  Room was clean with new linens.  Last year, we stayed at Residence Inn at about twice the rate.  In terms of staff service, room cleanliness and meeting our budget, Stanford inn and suites was a great value.  Lastly, wanted to drop a quick thank you note to the breakfast room staff for taking care of my sons.  Thank you.
Manager Response: Hello Tomoyoshi,   We are very thrilled you and your family enjoyed your stay with us.  We are also very happy to hear our staff was able to accommodate all your and your families need in a timely manner.    We thank you for your valuable comments.  We are looking forward in serving your and your family again in the near future.    Thank you.

Summary: So three days before I planned on staying here I cancelled my rooms. Two weeks later (yesterday) I get a charge to my credit card for $140 and they claim I never cancelled. First of all... Who charges your card well over 2 weeks later without notify you first? And second... I cancelled over the phone with a guy at the front desk WELL before 48 hours prior to when we were supposed to stay. I've called 3 different times to resolve this issue and no one cares or will help me. I finally called my bank and they are investigating it and treating it as a fraud so I should get my stolen money back soon. What hotel does this? I will write this review on every single review page. DO NOT stay here!! They are crooks!
Manager Response: Hello Laren,   We apologize for the inconvenience.   Just to make the record straight, we never charged anything on your credit card in beginning of April.  The transaction was made on the 16th of April and the very next day on April 17th  we refunded the charges.  The charges were made due to a  "no show" because the reservation was never cancelled.  Our front desk agents did verify your reservation but when asked was never given a cancellation number.  If the reservation was cancelled, you would have been given a cancellation number, and of course, no charges would have been made.    Please review your credit card transaction to verify the refund, this process will take approximately 3-5 days.  If by any chance, the refund was not given, please do not hesitate to contact me anytime.   Phone:714-703-1220  Email: Info@StanfordinnAnaheim.com   Once again, we apologize for the inconvenience and we hope sometime in the future, you will consider giving our hotel another try.

Summary Heading: Fine clean place to stay with helpful management
Summary: They oversold the 2-queen room we were supposed to stay in, so they immediately offered to bump us up to a suite - the suite was fantastic. It had a bunk bed in an adjoining room, and two comfortable queens in the main room.  The staff was super polite and helpful. The office was comfortable and well maintained. the room was clean, as was the carpet.  We stayed here to go to Disneyland. At first I had hoped to just walk, but the front desk lady said the entrance was almost exactly 1 mile away. I spent the money for the shuttle tickets, which picked us up just a few feet from the hotel entrance. Definitely recommend doing the shuttle if you're taking kids to disneyland, they'll be too tired to walk back at the end of your day.  The room was clean and comfortable. Sure, it was no
Manager Response: Hello Ryan,   Thank you for your valuable comments and suggestions.  We are very glad you and your family enjoyed the kid's suite and our staff was able to accommodate all your needs.    The next time you and your family come and visit us again, I can assure you, it is only going to get better.    Again, we really appreciate your comments and we are looking forward to serve you, your family, and friends again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay, great value
Summary: Our experience at the Stanford Inn & Suites was very positive.  The staff was friendly and attentive.  It appeared that some of the front desk staff were being trained as there was some confusion - but that wasn't a problem at all. We were there at the tail end of spring break (April 4-6) and they seemed to be pretty booked. Yes, the breakfast room was crowded - but that is the case at many hotels we've stayed in.  People enjoy having free breakfast!  On the plus side, the breakfast is better than you find at many hotels.  Scrambled eggs, sausage, yogurt, waffles (regular and blueberry), cereals, breads, donuts, fruit, juices and milk - all well stocked.  We went to breakfast late (after 9am) Saturday morning and it was crowded and the eggs were gone - but within a couple of
Manager Response: Hello Erin,   We are very happy our staff accommodated all of your and your family's needs.  We make sure all of our rooms exceeds our guest's expectation and is maintained on a daily basis.    Yes, you are absolutely correct regarding the renovation.  We are in full force of renovating our bathrooms, bedding linens, pillows, carpets, and even considering getting an elevator.    Again, we greatly appreciate your valuable comments! We look forward to serving you, your family, and friends again in the near future!
