Summary: I like staying here when I am more on a budget. It's fairly cheap compared to comparable hotels in the area. The rooms are clean and the best part is you get a warm breakfast for free. I feel safe when I stay on the property and it's usually pretty quiet. The only thing I would change is the parking lot size. It seems if you don't get a parking spot early enough in the day, you might be without one.
Manager Response: Hello Kelly,   We are very glad you and your family felt safe, comfortable, and enjoyed your stay at our hotel.  We strive to exceed our guest's expectations in any way possible.    At our hotel, we do have a very spacious parking lot that can accommodate up to 110 vehicles.  We accommodate regular sized vehicles, SUV, and over sized vehicle as well (trailers, buses,  and heavy duty trucks). Also, we do have additional parking spaces located in between the neighboring restaurant called Clancy's.    Again, we greatly appreciate your valuable comments. We look forward to serving you, your family, and friends again in the near future!

Summary: We stayed at the Stanford Inn April 1-5, 2013.  We had the kids suite with one bathroom.  Overall the room was decent. It seemed fairly clean and comfortable.  We really didn't spend much time there. Our room was cleaned daily but 2 of the 4 days they didn't replace our bath towels and I had to call to have some delivered.  My son did swim a few times while we were there and he enjoyed that. Overall everything was ok except the breakfast.  I booked our room here due to the fact that it had a complimentary breakfast. I was hoping this would save some money.  We were told it was open 630a-930a and the first morning we went to get breakfast there was a sign on the door saying they didn't open until 7a.  The breakfast space was so cramped and the employees were having a hard time
Manager Response: Hello Marsha,   We are very pleased you and your family enjoyed your stay with us and the room was to your expectation.   We do apologize for the inconvenience during your stay in regards to not replacing the bath towels for two days and for the miscommunication regarding our breakfast room hours. I can assure you, we will not make the same mistakes again.    We do understand breakfast is the most important meal of the day.  With that said, I do understand during breakfast hours it can get very busy at times but I can assure you, we do have three staff members working in the breakfast room diligently to restock items and to ensure customer service.    We greatly appreciate your valuable comments and your suggestions.  We look forward to serving you, your family, and friends again in the near future.  If you have any other concerns or questions, please feel free to  contact me anytime.  714-703-1220 (extension 828)

Summary: I stayed here from March 31 to April 5 with my husband and teenage son while we went to Disneyland.  We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds (104).  We were able to get an excellent price through Get Away Today.  The room was very clean.  The beds and pillows were very comfortable.  The breakfast was excellent.  Nothing fancy about the place but we just wanted a comfortable and clean place to stay while we visited Disneyland.  The man that helped us during check in was very pleasant and helpful.  The only major problem we had was that the faucet on the sink broke.  My husband contacted the front desk and a repairman was there within minutes and replaced it.  It still had some problems but we were able to live with it and it was no big deal.  The wifi was on the slow side but since
Manager Response: We are thrilled our hotel accommodated all of your & your families needs. We take great pride in our rooms and our staff.  We did replace the bedding linens, pillows, and upgraded our bathrooms tiles & floors.   We do apologize for the inconvenience regarding the faucet sink and the Wifi.  I am very glad our maintenance team was prompt and addressed the issue in a professional manner.  Currently, we are redoing our wifi.  Once this project is complete our wifi will be consistent, faster, and much more reliable.   Again, we greatly appreciate your valuable comments! We look forward to serving you, your family, and friends again in the near future!

Summary: We booked the "Kids Suite" here and were so pleased with it.  We traveled with two kids, one a teenager with autism.  The kid suite was a perfect place for him to set up as his "home away from home".  I liked that he had his own bathroom and that he couldn't leave his room without coming through our room.  Also, we could shut the door and not keep him up at night if we were up later watching tv or reading.  I highly recommend this room type if you are traveling with kids.  The staff there was so helpful.  One worker carried up a large suitcase for us when we checked in.  The staff in the breakfast room was always welcoming and cheerful.  The breakfast was decent but the room got a little crowded because of its set up.  Overall, we had a very enjoyable stay.
Manager Response: We are thrilled you and your family enjoyed the kids suite! We did upgrade the linens for all of our beds, upgraded all the children's bunk beds with a disney theme bedding set, and bathroom tiles and floor.  In the near future, theres much more changes to come for the better!   We are doing everything we can to exceed our guest's satisfaction and for a more enjoyable experience.  We are very satisfied our staff was able to satisfy all your and your family needs in a timely manner.    Since December 2012, we did expand our breakfast room and added additional chairs & tables.  Since breakfast is the most important meal of the day, we do acknowledge it can get crowded from time to time.  We apologize for any inconvenience.  Again, we greatly appreciate your valuable comments! We look forward to serving you, your family, and friends again in the near future!

Summary: This was the first vacation I was going to take with my wife and 18 month old son we were staying for four nights and going to disneyland for three days. I was quoted a certain price over the phone but when I got there they ran my credit card and charged me 60 more when I asked about the charge they told me it was for a deposit in case something happens to the room and etc. We ended up renting two rooms with double queen beds because we were meeting family that had to drive 14 hours to get there and we drove 5 hours. The lady at the front desk was very rude with us the whole time and acted like she didnt want to be there and when I asked questions didnt seem like she cared to help me or answer them. I had arranged to purchase eight tickets to disneyland for three days in the
Manager Response: Thank you for your valuable comments.  We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused by our staff.  With this experience, we are completely reevaluating our policies regarding debit card transactions and will make sure this will never happen again.  With regards to our front desk service, too, we will review our staff evaluation procedure and incorporate changes to improve your experience.  Again, please accept our sincere apologies.  Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: I love the night staff! I loved my bed! I loved how they accommodated me with a discounted price! They were the right place at the right time!  They saved me from a horrible hotel called Anaheim Executive Inn & Suites.   They night staff was extremely understanding of my situation and took care of me!!
Manager Response: We are very thrilled you and your family enjoyed your stay with us! We will do whatever it takes to exceed our guest's expectation and to accommodate all of our guest's needs!   We greatly appreciate your comments! We look forward to serving you, your family, and friends again in the future!

Summary Heading: March 2013 Comfort Inn Maingate now called Stanford Inn
Summary: We arrived and had a pleasant welcome from the front desk clerk. Lugged our bags up flight of stairs (no elevator) to our room. Nice room; family room with bunk bed separate. Woke up each morning to yelling kids/parents going up and down the walkway outside our room- NO INSULATION from any noises.  Street noises sound like they're in your room.  Breakfast was not up my alley but I like healthy food. Donuts, sugary cereal, waffle maker, fake (powdered) eggs, white bread, white bagels, no real cream for coffee- powdered "creamer". These things may not matter to you, but I didn't enjoy the breakfast. VERY crowded dining area.  Their site says they're "blocks from Disneyland". That's a 1/4 mile block I guess; it's one mile walking. No free shuttle from the hotel.  Basically I woke
Manager Response: Hello Nicole,   We apologize for the inconvenience during your stay.  Usually at the end of March, it is spring break and we have a lot of guest traveling all over the world to stay at our hotel to visit Disneyland & California Adventure Land.  Majority of our guest, especially children get real excited.    We take careful consideration with the choices we provide for our breakfast.  We serve hot and cold breakfast and a variety of other healthy alternatives.  We do serve yogurt, whole wheat bread, oatmeal, and fresh fruits.    Again, we apologize for the experience you had at our hotel.  We greatly appreciate your comments and suggestion.  We look forward to serving you, your family, and friends again soon!

Summary: Stayed here on a sunday and monday night while going to disney. Nice grounds beautiful flowers, nice rooms with good size and good beds. Lots of people at breakfast so get there early. Hot tub was dirty had lots of foam. All in all good experience. A long way from Disney but you can catch the art close by for 5.00.
Manager Response: We are very glad you and your family enjoyed your stay with us! We apologize for the inconvenience regarding our hot tub.  I can assure you, our maintenance team checks and clean our heated pool and spa twice a day on a daily basis.  We will make sure the same mistakes does not happen twice.  	We greatly appreciate your comments.  We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again soon.

Summary: Stayed here because it is close to Disneyland but not as close as we thought (2 miles). The condition of our room was appalling. The carpet and chairs had stains everywhere. There was a blood stain on the bedspread. We turned the tv on and it took out the electricity on that side of the room. A maintenance man came up and tried to correct the situation by flipping the breaker several times to no avail. By then it is 930pm and we have to change rooms. Our next room was cleaner but the coffee pot didn't work and the lid on the carafe was broken off. They delivered a new one the next day after breakfast. The free breakfast is good but there is very little seating subjecting you to sit outside and freeze or try to carry everything to your room. The shuttle to Disney is at a nearby
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience during your stay at our hotel.  We take our guest’s comments and suggestions very seriously.   Since the ownership changed recently, we are currently renovating our bathrooms and our guest rooms.  We are upgrading our upholstery, upgrading our bathroom tiles/floors, new carpets, and we already changed all of our bedding linens.  	 Again, we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and we greatly appreciate your comments.  We will do our best to not make the same mistake twice. We are doing whatever it takes to make our hotel a great experience for our guest.  We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again soon.

Summary: I feel really bad giving this hotel just an okay review because the staff is so incredibly nice and because they seem to have plans to improve the rooms, so maybe in the near future it will be better.  Right now (as of March 2013), the rooms are in very bad need of updating.  My room was as clean as it could get, yet it still seemed dirty.  There was a fridge (bigger size than average, which was nice), microwave and coffee maker in the room which all worked perfectly,and the bed was very comfortable.  The location is pretty good, there's a shuttle that goes up and down that road that makes frequent stops.  You can take it to Disneyland or to anywhere along that road.  If they renovate the place, it will be worth going back to.
Manager Response: We thank you for your valuable comments. We take our guest's comments and suggestions very seriously.  We are very pleased our staff was helpful, kind, and accommodated all your & your families needs.   Yes, at the moment our hotel is renovating our rooms and bathrooms for a better guest experience. We are in the midst of changing our upholstery, carpets, bathrooms, and much much more. Some of our rooms have been renovated and we expect to finish our renovation by late April.   Again, we thank you for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again

Summary: we needed a room for 2 adults and two toddlers---the room was tight. The table came with 1 chair and we had to swipe chairs from the dinning room so at least some of us could eat at the table as a family. trying to save money while on vacation at Disneyland we planned on the free breakfast the hotel provides, and the use of the in room fridge and microwave to store and heat food up. The gals at the front desk were very help and accommodating---check in was 3pm but they let us into our room t 11am!---what a saver----the weather was terrible and rainy. The upholstery was dirty and stained, but it was in good condition otherwise. The location was close enough to the park for us to use the ART system at $5.00/adult and the kids were young enough to get them on for free. Disney is
Manager Response: We thank you for your valuable comment. We are very pleased to hear our staff accommodated all your & and your families needs.  At the moment, we are in the midst of renovating our rooms and bathrooms.  Some rooms have been renovated and we expect to finish our renovation by late April.  Again, thanks for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again soon.  -Stanford Inn & Suites

Summary Heading: Two bad experiences at this hotel
Summary: I stayed in this hotel two summers ago with my little girl. I was traveling on limited funds for our vacation but wanted to take my daughter to Disneyland.  I stay in Comfort Suites a lot, and have always been happy.  The hotel charged over $400 to my credit card for someone else's room.  I brought it to their attention, and while they reversed it, the entire length of our vacation that money was not available to us.  The manager promised to make it right and give us enough points to give us a free stay the next time we came.  Every time I called, he was unavailable.  We went ahead and booked a room this past summer.  Of course never could find him, either at the hotel or by telephone.  Not only was my room not covered, I was charged more than I was quoted on the phone.  When I
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to free transportation to Disney Resort
Summary: We were a little concerned when we pulled into the parking lot because we don't usually stay at motels but we were pleasantly surprised with this place.  We had a room that included a separate room with bunkbeds, a small table and chair, and a tv--perfect for my grandson.  The rooms were very clean and smelled clean.  The entire place was kept very clean.  My son said he saw housekeeping wiping down the outside of the doors to the rooms.  They also appeared to hose all the walkways everyday.  No garbage in the parking lot either. We found the beds a little uncomfortable at first but got used to them very quickly.  My son and grandson said that it got a little loud in the parking lot at night (I sleep with earplugs) but you can't blame that on management-just inconsiderate
Manager Response: We are very thrilled you & your family enjoyed your stay with us.  Our staff will do whatever necessary to make our guest's stay more enjoyable and to ensure we accommodated all of our guest's needs.   We do apologize on your last day, you and your family did not get to enjoy breakfast at our hotel.    Thank you for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you, your family, and friends again soon.

Summary: We arrived early on Friday and were able to get into our kids suite  it smelled a little musty and i asked for another room  we were put in 126 and the room was awesome  there were issues with fridge needing to be leveled, missing shelves and Jose fixed it.  He also fixed the kids tv andbrougt another stool for kids room.  Their are ten in our party and when we went for breakfast, the manager said good morning let me find  you a table .  Good breakfast for the money.  Spa was not working and the guys worked on it and got it working.   All of these problems should be fixed before you arrive but the staff got right on anything we asked for.  Carpets are due for cleaning. Awesome mattresses with nice duvet  Overall 7, staff 12, breakfast 9, rooms 8 Kathy from Modesto
Manager Response: Hello Kathy!   We thank you for your valuable comment.  We apologize for the first room not meeting your expectation.  At the moment, our hotel is upgrading our bedding system, our bathrooms, and cleaning/maintaining our carpets on a daily basis.    We are very pleased to hear our staff accommodated all your & and your families needs in a timely manner! Our maintenance will do whatever it takes to get the job done!   Again, thanks for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family & friends again soon.

Summary: We stayed 5 nights had two rooms 14 in our party for family vacation the first night we requested no service the next 3 days we did not recieve any maid service. After long days at the park we came back to dirty rooms no towels and trash still in the rooms. after dumping our own trash taking our dirty towels to them and getting  new ones. the fourth night room was clean but not clean they took the trash and dirty towels, threw personal items on the floor did not clean the bathrooms,  did not leave toilet paper or clean towls. The front desk service was very nice. Maid service is lacking poorly and they do not care about the guests. This happend to both rooms we had. ART shuttle very convenient to going back and forth from Disneyland.
Manager Response: We apologize for the experience you & your family had to go through .  I can ensure you, our staff is doing everything possible to ensure customer satisfaction.    I will address this issue with our staff and will make sure we do not make the same mistake twice.   Again, thanks for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family & friends again soon.

Summary Heading: Great for families, awesome breakfast included.  Close to inexpensive eating
Summary: This is our second stay at the sane hotel in two years. We chose this hotel because of the kid suites with bunk beds. The location is right on that ART line and we were close to food that was budget friendly. The breakfast in the morning was even better and bigger this year than last. Staff was helpful and accommodating. Would stay again.
Manager Response: We are very glad you guys enjoyed your stay.  We are doing everything we possibly can to make our guest feel more comfortable and welcome.    Again, thanks for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family & friends again soon.

Summary: Stayed here over thanksgiving.  The rooms were clean, staff was pleasant and helpful. I saw some complaints about the breakfast on other reviews, but the make your own waffles were great, there was cereal , yogurt and fruit, muffins, coffee, pastries, juice, scrambled eggs and sausage patties,  something for everyone.  Front desk was helpful with Internet questions.   Not walking distance to Disney, but we just drove and parked.   If you have 3 or more, parking is cheaper anyway, and they do allow in and out.   Parking at hotel was free, I would recommend this property.
Manager Response: We are thrilled you and your family enjoyed your stay here.  We did expand our breakfast area and  there is something for everyone regarding breakfast selection.      Again, thanks for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family & friends again soon.

Summary: I was a little upset when I arrived at this hotel because I was told it was a 10 minute walk to the main gate of Disneyland which in fact it is a 40 minute walk. We had 2 families with included 5 children. My attitude quickly changed when the front desk person was so extremely nice and did everything in her power to make sure we were all comfortable. The ART shuttle picks up right in front of the hotel and drops off directly in front of the parks and that made our day a lot easier. We also enjoyed a great breakfast every morning and SUPER friendly staff. The entire hotel was renovated and is very clean. The last day we were there, they started to renovate the pool. The only thing I would change is the fact that they only have 1 washer and 2 dryers available.
Manager Response: We apologize for the miscommunication regarding the walking distance from our hotel to Disneyland.   We are ecstatic you & your family enjoyed your stay here. We are doing everything we possibly can to make our guest feel more comfortable & to maintain our rooms.     Again, thanks for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family & friends again soon.

Summary: We stayed here this summer so me and my boyfriend could go to disneyland and since it was so close and a fair price we thought this was a good spot, we get there and our room smelled SO BAD.. it was musky and moldy.... we sucked it up because it was still nice and close until there were ants EVERYWHERE in our room.... Our bed, the bathroom the sink... everywhere. we decided to switch hotels after that
Manager Response: We apologize for your stay.  At the moment we are renovating our bathrooms and maintaining our carpets on a daily basis.    Again, thanks for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family & friends again soon.

Summary Heading: I stayed here because of the other reviews, but....
Summary: Okay, this was an inexpensive hotel. I get that.  But when we first stepped into the room, the first word that came to mind was GRUNGY.  The bedspreads were stained (and I removed them immediately), the lampshades were dirty and broken, the wallpaper border was peeling, there was a large gap under the door (I'm guessing about 1/4"), and the bathroom lights flickered.  The hot breakfast every morning was nice, but super crowded.  The front desk attendant gave us a wheelchair accessible room (I don't know why - we didn't request it), which was right around the corner from the laundry.  Very noisy.  On the plus side, the beds were comfortable...
Manager Response: We apologize for your experience. We are currently changing our bedding system and doing everything we can to maintain our rooms.    Again, thank you for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family & friends again soon.

Summary Heading: Very clean room, but the absolute worst customer service I have ever had in my entire life! Ever
Summary: Short and to the point. Was given keys to room. Waited for cleaning person to finish. No big deal at all. She finished , moved her cart along. We move into room. Looked perfect. Got a call from front desk agent stating that we needed to pack up and get out of room because it was not done wing cleaned. I said the maid had left, Locked the door and the room was 100% made up. He then stated that he told us that he would call and that he made that clear ad that he needed us to get out of the room until it was clean. Again I stated that I felt the room was acceptable and if I needed to sign a waiver that would be fine but id like to stay because my family an I had already unpacked with our two year old in our clean room. Basically it ended this way. I was so frustrated that I didn't
Manager Response: Our front desk agents should always maintain their professionalism at all times no matter what.   We sincerely apologize for your experience.    Thank you for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family & friends again soon.

Summary Heading: I'll break down the Pro's and Con's...
Summary: There was so much to like about this hotel.  The free breakfast, the pool that stayed open late and the kid's suites....but there was so much that was...slightly off putting about the hotel, too.  First, I will totally admit that I am a bargain traveler.  I have four kids and shopped around to find a hotel near Disneyland with a free breakfast.  This was great...for the kids.  Lots of donuts and waffles, juice and hard boiled eggs.  Great kid food.  No complaints.  If you are a figure watching adult, have the fresh fruit and coffee.  I did. So. let's put that on the Pro List. Stick the free WiFi on that list too.  It was speedy.  Can't complain.   Ok, the carpets....not so great.  But the actual room was CLEAN, just aged.  So, yes, my carpet was stained, but not "filthy" the way
Manager Response: We are very glad you and your family enjoyed your stay with us.  In regards to our carpets, our maintenance crew keeps track of the carpets in the room.  They usually clean anywhere from 3-5 carpets per room on an average day.    We apologize about the washing machine during your stay.  At the moment, we can ensure the guest laundry equipment is maintained properly.    Thank you for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family & friends again soon.

Summary: We chose this hotel based on price, location near Disney, and pretty good reviews on Trip Advisor.  It is a very basic hotel. Older look and feel.  I always laugh at the comments about dirty carpet, but I have to say this one met that description.  I always kept shoes or socks on as it looked filthy.  Bed were fine. Pillows were tiny, not like anything I had ever experienced in a hotel.  It was quiet though and that made sleeping fine even with small pillows. Pool was supposed to be heated, but wasn't. Kids didn't seem to mind.    Good: Parking is free and  you can catch the ART to Disney (bus system that allows you to go back and forth to Disney, cheap and comes to hotel frequently). Breakfast was pretty decent. Hot eggs and sausage, donuts, waffle maker, some fruit, juice, and
Manager Response: We apologize for the inconveniences during your stay.  At the moment, we have upgraded our  Wifi and is free for our guest, the vending machines are working properly, and the pool & Jacuzzi is heated and is maintained by our maintenance staff.   Thank you for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family & friends again soon.

Summary: we got a 2bd/2ba family suite.  i was a little worried about staying here because of some of the other reviews but this is one of the very few places that could accomodate my large family 5 girls/2 grand kids.  our suite had 2 queen beds and a set of bunk beds and we also got a roll away bed, i didnt think we would have enough room for it but there was more than enough space to have it in the extra room.  the main room (with the 2 queen beds) was very spacious. we did not feel crowded at all.  the room was clean and the maid service did an excellent job cleaning our rooms everyday. our room faced the inside of the hotel, other reviews complained about noise.  we didnt have this problem at all, maybe we were there on an off week?  but i dont think so since the parking lot was
Manager Response: We are thrilled you guys enjoyed your stay with us.  We are currently updating our bedding system.  So in regards to our small squared pillows, we upgraded the pillows and now have regular sized pillows both firm and soft, so no need to bring your own =)  Thank you for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family & friends again soon.

Summary Heading: Not Bad, but Certainly Not the Best
Summary: It's a cute little hotel but the rooms were a little dirty. The carpets and chairs were filthy... I made sure all of us wore sandals whenever we were in the room.  The hotel  was located right next to Rodeway Inn where the ART meets. You could walk to Disneyland, but I think it would be a pretty long walk and that's not including all of the walking you are already going to do at the parks.  The free breakfast was wonderful! If anything that would be the main reason to stay there. Scrambled eggs, sausauge, cereals, donuts and other pastries, toast and english muffins, yogurt, boiled eggs, fruit, oatmeal, juices and milk, and waffles (blueberry and regular). We made breakfast sandwiches most days. Great food.  The pool was too cold to enter... even for my 5 year old daughter...
Manager Response: none

Summary: When we first walked in immediate old moldy hotel smell. There's stains everywhere, the carpet is gross the kids feet were black. I didn't dare give them a bath. I really don't know how it was rated a 4 before we went. Patched holes in the wall, paint peeling off the doors and walls. I wish it came with toilet seat covers. Black hairs found on sheets and tub. Any noise outside sounded like it was in our room. The pillows felt like they were just filled of socks.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Lodging at a Reasonable Price
Summary: We got a 2 queen size bed room for about $80/night.  It was clean and the staff were very helpful in getting us around Anaheim.  It was about 1 mile away from Disneyland straight South on Harbor Blvd - an easy walk for us.  Anything closer to Disneyland quoted $100+.  And all of the restaurants were within walking distance - we were in no hurry.  We enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   This year, we changed our name from Comfort Inn Maingate to Stanford Inn & Suites.  Along with the flag change, we have made a few noteworthy improvements since last year, and we would be honored if we could be of service to you and your family on your next trip in the area.    Thank you.

Summary: We need a place to stay for one night before going home the next day.  We picked this place for it great rate.  They offer free breakfast, free WiFi and a pool. The room was OK, except for the carpet, need a good shampoo.  I would not stay here again, unless they replace the carpet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A last minute trip to Disney resulted in us staying at this Comfort Inn.  The hotel was nasty.  The carpets was so dirty we had to wear our shoes.  The towels smelled so bad we could hardly use them and they felt like sandpaper. The beds were so uncomfortable and the linens were much like the towels.  With very little sleep, we tried the free breakfast in order to find that it was terrible as well.  The fruit was not fresh, the donuts were stale, the eggs and sausage looked so bad we would not attempt them.  The food was set up in a room so small there was no place to sit and eat. We could not wait to go to disney to get away from here.  The 20 minute shuttle was more like 40 minutes but we did make it to Disney.  We contemplated checking out of this hotel and driving the long
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect "home base" for your busy vacation
Summary: We were there for 10 nights in August.  For my family's needs (two adults, two teenagers) this place was wonderful.  Great rates, free breakfast, free wifi and a pool to cool off after a long day of activities.  The facilities older so the rooms are smaller, but if you don't spend your whole vacation at the hotel, this is the place for you.  The staff was overwhelmingly friendly and helpful.  The beds were surprisingly comfortable, the entire facility very clean, and much quieter at night than I was expecting.  For our extremely busy vacation, we couldn't have picked a better location to stay at.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  We changed our name from Comfort Inn Maingate to Stanford Inn & Suites this year.  With the flag change, we have made a few noteworthy improvements on the property.  We would be truly honored if you could make us part of your next trip in Anaheim again.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: Haven't been able to find a dirtier carpet!
Summary: I am not one to post bad reviews, especially when I have had good experiences in other Comfort Inn hotels, but this must be known by the hotel staff and future guests: although the bathroom and the bed sheets were acceptably clean, the carpet was as filthy as it can get.    The fact that we had a bottom floor room should not be an excuse to rent out such a dirty room.  After walking barefoot inside the room for a few minutes, the bottom of my feet were black (not gray, but totally black) from all the dirt on the carpet.  Needless to say, all of us had to wear shoes inside the room at all times ... even my 2 year old who couldn't understand why.  Needless to say, we will never stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for, but location is great!
Summary: Booked this for 3 nights at a great rate in August.  First thing first, you get what you pay for. We got a great deal online and got just what we expected. The front desk is very helpful and they offer free breakfast until 930am( I did not wake up in time!) but I'm sure it was good. After checking in we went to our room and noticed a wet carpet smell, almost humid. We turned on the cold a/c and for the most part, this solved our problem.  The room was clean and spacious with no major carpet stains or furniture stains like some other reviewers stated. Bathroom had clean towels and they were replaced every day.  One down side to this was that we were on the first floor and had a VERY heavy footed neighbor upstairs. There was walking all through the night which did wake us up a
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room met our needs and it was very inexpensive.  The building is older, but it is clear that the staff works hard to make the facilities look nice.  The room was clean, plenty of towels, comfortable mattress, LCD TV.  We didn't use the pool.  The free breakfast looked quite satisfactory although because there was such a large crowd of folks trying to get something to eat, we went elsewhere to get breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked this hotel via Travelocity as a Top Secret Hotel and it was well worth what we paid. My husband and I checked in on a Friday night around midnight. Unfortunately, all the King rooms were booked since it is first-come, first-serve. We were given a room with two Queen beds, bunk beds, and two bathrooms. The room was extremely clean, which is one of the most important things for me. It could have used a little updating but nothing major. The mattress was a little hard but the pillows were great. Breakfast was good though not spectacular. The breakfast room is small but the ladies keep it well stocked. We did not use the pool or the shuttle to Disneyland. Overall, definitely worth the money and I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice service, it's too bad the property isn't that nice.
Summary: It was a motel first off... not a hotel.  We got there and checked in. The guy was very nice.  The downsides was that the rooms were a bit outdated.  Also the door between the main room and 'kids room' had a thin sheet that you can COMPLETELY see through.  We used the kids room for three teenagers.  This did not work.  Also the room was EXTREMELY hot.  The main room cooled down but there was no ac in the room with the teens... Just a fan from the main room.  Last thing to mention is that the water heater could not take the two showers running at the same time and our shower had hair in it.  We left the hotel after our first night.  I think we would return if it was just my home family... as most of the problems were caused by the two room thing.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed for a quick trip to Disneyland with family from out of town.  We booked the two queen room for two nights, but our out of town family had only booked one. The day of check in, they decided to stay the second night also.  The front desk staff was very helpful, made the adjustment, and we were then set for two nights. We also needed a little more time (1 hour) in one room for check out, and they were very accomodating. Also nice to have a fridge and microwave in the room, especially for milk for our small children.   We stayed on the "back side" (by Clancy's Restaurant) and it was very quiet. The room was clean, and the beds were comfortable.  We missed breakfast the first morning (didn't realize it shut promptly at 9:30) but made up for it the next day.  The
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I stayed at this place for a week. We got to the motel at 2 pm, check-in is at 3 pm. The staff was friendly and let us check-in early since a room was available. The bed was comfortable. Bathroom, sink, and closet were clean. Nice fridge and microwave. This motel included blow dryer, iron, ironing board,  and flat screen TV. There was also a safe in the room. For breakfast there was yogurt, eggs, donuts, cereal, milk, waffles, bread, orange juice, and apple juice. Parking tends to get full at night but there is additional parking behind the hotel next to a restaurant called Clancy's. It is somewhat close to Disneyland (about 4 blocks walking). There is also a shuttle that takes you to Disneyland (it stops in front of the Ramada, right next to this Comfort Inn). We
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Helps cuts cost for vacation and provided a nice place to crash.
Summary: I have stayed at this location several times and find it to always be clean with a very helpful staff.  The beds are comfortable and the room isn't too small.  My only real complaint in regards to this location is the pool/spa area.  The hotel's trash bin is backed right up against the pool area and the stench made being pool side unbearable.  To be fair, it was a very warm day and I am not sure this is a normal situation.  Being on Harbor Avenue provided us with ample locations to eat within walking distance.  The price was great for the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms items were really worn out however they gave us many great things like a free breakfast bunk beds and a great pool and jacuzzi.overall the hotel was great
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Dad was right.. you get what you pay for.
Summary: This hotel was incredibly dirty, and felt very unsafe.  We stayed here for a few nights, and during that time observed some interesting things in regards to housekeeping.  When the housekeepers would come to work, many would bring their significant others to work with them.    These people would hang around outside by the pool, on benches by the front office, and picnic tables located outside the breakfast room.  Whats more.. they would sit around and stare at guests as they came and went.  This particularly irritated me when I noticed them ogling my wife and daughters.  And it wasn't just during the day..  These scumbags were hanging around at 1:00 in the morning just staring at everyone as they were getting out of their cars.  There is no security, and it's very evident.  If
Manager Response: none

Summary: My teenage son and I stayed over the 4th holiday and were very comfortable. Nice tv's, comfy beds and a great a/c system... The room was great, however there must have been a leak under the sink because it smelled very, very moldy by there. I knew that the hotel was full so trading rooms wasn't an option, however I reported it when I check out and the front desk clerk assured me it would get fixed.   We missed breakfast both days so I can't comment on that but we were very close to Red Robin, Coco's and Joe's Crab Shack and really close to Disney. I would definitely recommend it, for price and location.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice Clean Hotel for our Disney Get Away
Summary: Upon arrival, Staff was waiting for our prompt check-in. Our room was clean, sheets crisp, pillows awesome. Big LCD TV and fridge worked great. Breakfast next morning was fresh and ample and lots of option (eggs, snausage, toast, waffles, rolls, fruit, donuts, coffee, juice, milk, etc) Within walking distance is plenty of fast food outlets and a store only a half block away for most needs. Across and up the street a short walk is a Denny's, another favorite. Grounds (landscaping, paint, walkways) could use a bit of refreshing and cleaning, just basic stuff. Parking was easy and ample. Management even recognizes and appreciates nice sports cars and that was bonus and in no way influenced on my report.......  This Hotel is clearly Buffalobunny approved and will be our Hotel of
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You Get What You Pay For
Summary: I can see why this would be a decent choice for a small family traveling to Disneyland, but this Comfort Inn is the epitome of "motel". There is a free breakfast that was generous and consistent. The housekeeping staff does a nice job.  Overall, though, I would never go back. My room was next to a solar power generator (according to the front desk) that ran loudly almost the entire day. A good portion of the motel also backs up into a restaurant parking lot, which seemed to be a popular spot for people smoking pot in their cars. I spotted it a couple of times during my stay and I don't think it's an anomaly. I was also unpleasantly surprised to find that they give you a small bottle of shampoo and moisturizer but no conditioner, so consider yourself warned. There is no elevator
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Comfortable, on a budget, or quick stay hotel
Summary: Pros: -Reasonable rates -Comfortable, clean, spacious rooms -Free Breakfast includes scrambled eggs, sausage, make your own waffles, fruit, breads, donuts, cereal, juices, milks, coffee, lots of condiments. -No charge for parking -Free Internet wifi access -Swimming pool & jacuzzi - open till 11pm -Options for free food delivery from nearby restaurants.  Cons: -Besides your room, the property consists of a parking lot & small pool area -Too far to walk to Disneyland, especially in the heat or dark -The bus route #3 only comes about every 30 minutes and isn't very consistent.  Other hotels have multiple busses and routes. The ride takes about 10-15 to the park and about 5-10 to return. -Breakfast is free so don't expect amazing things.  The eggs are always over cooked but eatable
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A very, very nice place to stay
Summary: This was one of the most comfortable places I have ever slept. The beds are big and soft, the rooms are very clean and they don't run out of breakfast items, keeping things out until closing time. It is not as close as you might think to Disneyland.  Walking time between 20 and 30 mins.  Google maps shows about 2 blocks, not true.  After the 1st day, we bought the all day bus pass at the front desk for $4 for adults and $1.50 for kids. It stops at the hotel right next door.  The front desk folks were very kind and always helpful.  We got to the front desk 3 hrs. before check-in, 3pm, and they let us use the pool until our room was ready. We were very happy with our stay here.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Disney was great, but the hotel was disappointing
Summary: We have been to Disneyland a couple of times in 10 years.  Had 3 families with kids ranging in ages 8-18 so we chose this hotel due to reviews saying it was an easy walk to/from the park.    Positive points = That is true, the walk is probably a mile and was easily done each morning.  By the end of the day we did use the A.R.T. bus to get home and that was fine.  The rooms were clean and the queen beds are comfortable even for people with back issues.     Negative points =   We have stayed at several Comfort Inn hotels and this one was definately a disappointment.  The grounds were poorly kept.  The pool and hot tub were not clean, as a matter of fact the hot tub had green foam?  We all felt bad for the ladies running the breakfast area as people were taking way more than the
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was the second time we have visited disney in the last 3 yrs and have stayed here both times.  We are planning another trip either in December or June of next yr.We will be definately staying at Comfort Inn Maingate again.  Room was quiet and always clean.  This time we took the ART which was perfect for gettin back and forth between the park and the motel.  My kid loved the breakfast and it was always fresh and hot..We were at the back of the hotel, room faced a residential area, was a little skeptical, but it was quiet and would nt mind staying in that area again...THANKS AGAIN COMFORT INN MAINGATE, SEE YOU WITHIN THE YEAR....
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pretty Decent, Walking Distance to Convention Centre
Summary: My experience here was nothing but pleasant, haven't checked out as I write this but there is a lot to be said about the helpfulness of the staff, quality of breakfast, cleanliness of the rooms. All of course good!   Just a for instance.  Was due to meet friends for dinner, ordered a taxi from reception, taxi didn't turn up for 35 mins, so the Manager himself DROVE me to the venue after the frustrating experience with the cab company. I mean... I've not had that level of service anywhere, what a champion!    My room was huge, air conditioning worked very well. I'll definitely recommend and would stay here again if I was travelling on my own.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at different variations and price ranges of hotels around Disneyland on my many adventures there.  This was the first one I stayed at so far down Harbor Blvd.  I was skeptical, as a friend chose the location, and I am used to being within a short walking distance of the park.  The ART shuttle (bus # 3/ $3 for a day pass/person) proved a very convenient way of getting straight into the park from the stop nearly right outside the hotel gate, although slightly unreliable for pick up times.  The route has an approximate pick up/drop off schedule every 20 minutes, but usually it is closer to 30 minutes between wait times and you are not always guaranteed a seat, though there is usually at least standing room available. It's close enough though that if you see your bus
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the second time we have stayed here and we will definately return.  The rooms are large, its clean, the shower is great, the breakfast ok and its great value for money.
Manager Response: It is great to know that we have a customer came back from New Zealand to Anaheim and visit us again. It makes me feel exciting. I will pass your comments to them and encourage them continuously do their best and provide their best services to our guests, like you and your family.  We are planning to add a new breakfast dinning space. Please do come back and visit us again when you come to Disneyland area.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland at exceptional price
Summary: Stayed 1 night with daughters 8 and 9.  Check-in good, even with a call after we were in our room to confirm everything was OK.  Pool and hot tub were nice.  Breakfast was excellent with the scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles, and more!  Clean, nicely furnished room within close (not walking) distance to Disney.  Great value for the price!
Manager Response: It is great to learn that you and your daughters have an enjoyable experience to stay with us.  I already sent a message to you and try to find out which room you stayed, so I can go ahead to take care that A/C issue. Hope I can get your response.  Again, thanks for your business and your valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family again soon.

Summary: Stayed 2 nights as part of cross country trip. My daughter was excited about having our own room with the bunk beds. The breakfast was great, but the dining area was small and crowded. The location and price were excellent. Very helpful staff. Suggested tours and helped us with driving arrangements.
Manager Response: It is great to learn that you and your family have a great time to stay with us.  Like my response for the previous comments, we are on processing to add more breakfast room. This contraction should be completed with three months (I hope!). Come back again to check this additional breakfast room up.  Again, thanks for your business and hope we can see you and your family again soon.

Summary Heading: Great for a trip with kids
Summary: My best friend and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Maingate on May 3-5 with my 3 nieces, age 4,5 and 6. Check in was super easy, and the room was nice and clean, and the beds were comfortable. We had a one bathroom kids suite, and the kids were really excited to have their own room. The complimentary breakfast was yummy, with plenty of choices, but the breakfast area was extremely crowded. We had to take turns getting food because we couldn't maneuver around all of the people crammed in there. My suggestion would be to take some of the tables out of the room and spread the food out. The weather is nice in Anaheim, I don't see why so many people need to cram into one tiny room. My one major complaint is that the room was kind of smelly. The carpet may have been damp before we got
Manager Response: Thanks for your business and valuable comments regarding Comfort Inn Maingate – Anaheim.  We are on the process to enlarge our breakfast room. It may take several months to design, obtain the building permit, and then construct. Check us out when you visit Disneyland next time to see the development.  We must just shampoo your room’s carpet three days before you came since we usually leave the room as “out of order” status for three days when we shampoo the carpet. However, the carpet will always dry out but the padding sometimes is not completely dry out yet due to a higher humidity. The moldy smell must come from that. I will consult with some experts to find a way to take care this issue. Thanks for you bring up this issue.  Again, your business and valuable comments are greatly appreciated. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family again.

Summary Heading: "Great Value and Minutes Away From Disneyland"
Summary: The biggest selling point of this property is it's close proximity to Disneyland Park. After a busy day of fun, it's nice to be able to relax in your room in just a few minutes. I mean, you could stay at one of the Disney hotels on site, but that would cost a lot more money.  So if your looking for a reasonable rate in a clean and comfortable hotel, you should give "Comfort Inn Maingate" a try.  We had a good nights rest and a nice complimentary breakfast in the morning. The dining room is spacious with plenty of seats. The staff is very helpful and friendly.  The hotel parking lot is large, and well-maintained. While we were there, they were painting new lines on the lot.  I wouldn't walk from the hotel to Disneyland. You can drive the distance in just a couple of minutes. All
Manager Response: It is glad to learn that you and your family have an enjoyable experience staying with Comfort Inn Maingate - Anaheim.  It is very nice for you to list all positive points for staying in our property. It is a very nice compliment. Hope we can see you and your family come back to Disneyland and also visit us again in a nearly future.

Summary Heading: Very Clean, Great Breakfast, Enjoyed Our Stay
Summary: We stayed here 4 nights, May 4th - 8th, 2012 as part of our family Disneyland vacation. We booked this motel through a "Getaway Today" package, and got a steal of a deal on the rate. The reviews seemed to be very positive, so we took a chance on it. We knew going in that it was a fair distance from the park, so we were not disappointed.   Pros: 1. CLEAN & SPACIOUS ROOMS The property is well maintained. Our room was spotless clean. The carpet was slightly worn, but fairly new, and our socks stayed "white" walking on it. Everything seemed to be newly updated including TV, fridge & microwave, granite bathroom vanity, etc. The mattresses were very comfortable. The sheets were high quality, and the bedspreads were freshly washed (we passed the laundry room and noticed they wash
Manager Response: Thanks to you spending so much time to write this review and share your experience with us.  Your compliments are really encouraging us due to all our staffs’ efforts have been well recognized. It relied on everybody, from front desk agents, housekeepers, to maintenance crews, dedicated on their works to ensure our guests have an enjoyable experience to stay with us.  Since the safes in the rooms are still under lease terms, based on the lease agreement, we have to charge $1.50 plus tax per day to the guests used the safe. Once the leasing term is finished, we intend to buy off those safes and provide to our guests free for usage. I want this free safe usage becomes to be an additional selling point for our property.  I am sorry to learn your daughter loss her necklace. I have my housekeeper to check the room #148 completely, behind the nightstand and underneath the mattress, before I write this response. Unfortunately, we did not find anything. There are four different families stayed in Room #148 after you checked out. I apologize that I did not see your review sooner.  Otherwise, I can send my people go in to check it out earlier.  Again, thanks for your business and compliments. I am looking forward to seeing you and your family come back to visit us again. Please let me know when you come over next time. I would like to meet you in person.

Summary: Brandon at the front desk, is one of the friendliest, most helpful representatives of any hotel that I have ever met. He advised us of sights that were off the beaten track and places, like beaches, where locals would visit. He would even print off directions as to how to get there. His courtesy and friendly nature are an asset to The Comfort Inn and he is a real ambassador for the city of Anaheim and surrounding area. Our visit to the Los Angeles area was made very enjoyable because of Brandon! Thank you! W.C. Abbotsford, B.C., Canada
Manager Response: It is great to learn that you and your family have a very enjoyable vacation to the Los Angeles and Anaheim area.  It is our goal to try our very best to ensure our guests having a wonderful experience to stay with Comfort Inn Maingate – Anaheim. From our front desk agents, housekeepers, to our maintenance crews, every staff has this same mission to do so. I am glad that Brandon did his job in such a please way. I will encourage them continuously to do their best. Hope all the guests visiting us have a great experience as you do.  Again, thanks for your business and your valuable time to share your experience with everybody. Hope we will see you and your family again soon.

Summary: This  is a good place because its close to Disneyland and resturant the rooms are not that great is very hot in the rooms and smells we had to run the ac all night just to keep it fresh,the carpet is very very dirty stains all over the floors.. the towls where like scrubs very hard the breakfast was ok the bk room is very small you had to rub pass people tp get to one place to another .. i dnt recomended for familys with small kids that sit or like to drag on the floor ..
Manager Response: Thanks for spending your valuable time to provide your comments for Comfort Inn Maingate – Anaheim.  Due to our hotel is an exterior corridor property. All guests walk from the parking lot directly into the room. Sometimes, the guests walk back and forth from their room to swimming pool with their bare foots. It always carried dirt form outside into the rooms no matter how they do it. That’s why even we clean our carpet much more often than normally required, we still not able to maintain our carpet as clean as we intend to. The second floor’s conditions are better than the first floor.  In addition to clean carpet more often and re-surfaced our parking lot to decrease the dirt, we installed some rubber area mats in last year at all entrance locations to try to catch the dirt when the guests walk across those mats.  However, the results were not good as we expected and those rubber area mats were totally worn out already. So, we removed all those rubber area mats.  Now, we are on the process to consult with some carpet manufacture to come out some exterior carpet option to be installed at our hallway or entrances. Once we selected the carpet, we will submit it to obtain our franchiser’s approval prior to our installation. It may take us several months to complete it. Hope this exterior carpet can help to improve this situation.   We are also on the process to enlarge our breakfast room. It will also take several months to design a plan, obtain the permit from the Building Department, and construct it.   Again, thanks for your business and your comments. Hope you will visit us when you come to Disneyland next time to check out the improvement.

Summary: Being one that frequents Anaheim, this was our first time staying at the Comfort Inn Maingate, & must say I wasn't impressed. First off, using the word "Maingate" in the name of the hotel is misleading. One would assume that it would be right by the park entrance but it is over a mile away from it. There were stains of who knows what on the little sofa in our room & the tile in the shower seemed to have been a little moldy at one time because the grout was stained too. Our daughter's family stayed in one of their "kid suites" & it had a bad musty smell in it. The "full" breakfast was a let down. They had a variety of foods to eat, buffet style scrambled eggs, sausage, make you own waffles, etc., but the eating area is small & therefore the whole area was crowded all the time.
Manager Response: I am regretting to learn that my property does not meet your expectations. However, I sincerely appreciate your businesses and valuable comments.  Regarding the “Maingate” issue, this property has re-branded his flag to be Comfort Inn for more than 10 years. Within these years, it has been owned by three different ownerships. There are total nine (9) hotels named themselves as “Maingate” around Disneyland Resort. Each one is flagged as different brand and all are the closest property away from the Disneyland Resort for their brand. I only consider one of these nine hotels is located right across the Disneyland, even it is on the end of the whole block with around 8 minutes walk. Among these nine (9) “Maingate” hotels, we are the fifth closest hotel and we are exactly one mile from Disneyland.  I did have one time considered to remove the “Maingate” from our name. However, it has taken so much efforts and money to build our reputations for the past 10 years. I am afraid our repeated customers may not find us and reserve to other Comfort Inn. Please be aware that there are totally 3 Comfort Inns in Anaheim and 2 of 3 are located on Harbor Blvd, we are on the South Harbor Blvd and the other one is on the North Harbor Blvd. Even right now we have “Maingate” shown on our name to try to separate from them, we still see lots of our guests came in and want to check in and then realized that they booked to the wrong one. Since there is a one-day penalty charged for the same day cancellation, the guests have no other choice and have to stay to other place which they don’t intend to do in the first place. I can see there will be a lot more confusion happened if we really remove “Maingate” away. That’s why I decided to keep our name as is. Besides, if I really want to change the name, not only I need to spend lots money to do advertisement, change all my printed material or amenities, but I also need to change all my contracts and/or agreements with my lenders, franchisor, and all my vendors since the guarantor has been changed.  That is too much works involved and I don’t see the benefits from this action.  Regarding the moldy smell, would you please contact me directly or call to our place and leave a message for me to indicate which room you were staying. I will definitely looking into this issue.  I realize that our breakfast room is not big enough, even our franchisor requests us to have 27 seats for breakfast and we already offer 64 seats. Since we are located within Disneyland Resort zone and our guests are much more families with kids than all other Comfort Inns not in the resort area, our seat requirements should be higher. Please understand that it is a hug e task to change an existing building layout to accommodate with a large breakfast room. I am consulting with an Architect to see any way we can accomplish this task within the budget I can afford.  Again, your business and comments are greatly appreciated. Please do contact us for the room you stayed. If we have any progressive for the breakfast room, I will post it on our facebook or twitter. Please follow us on our facebook and twitter.

Summary Heading: Great combination of price, location, and spaciousness
Summary: Kids suite with second bath (and closet) was perfect for our family of six for a six-night stay.  Everyone had a bed and we had plenty of room for all of our stuff.  Three-minute drive to Toy Story parking lot, about 15 to Mickey & Friends structure, making it quick & easy to get to Disneyland.  Price is great for what you get--free breakfast, free parking, free wi-fi.  Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable.  Breakfast is the same each day but there's a decent variety of food, both hot and cold.  Seating area is small but there are overflow picnic tables just outside.  Our second-floor room (220, at the back of the parking lot) was perfectly quiet.  Though this is an older property, it's a good mix of price and convenience, especially for families with three or four children.
Manager Response: It makes me feel exciting to learn that you and your family have an enjoyable time to staying with us. In additions, it is glad to know that you also recommended us to one of your friends and they have a great time as well.  As you know, the best way to build a successful business is to earn the repeated customers. Once these customers start to recommend your business to their friends, then your business will take off in a big time. I am glad to learn that you did it all for us.  Thanks for your business and all the “Good Words” you put for us. We are looking forward to seeing you visit us again in the near future.

Summary Heading: All time favorite disney neighborhood hotel for my family!!
Summary: This is the 2nd time we stayed with them and once again they never failed us. Nes and Helen of the front desk were extremely helpful and very accomodating throughout our stay.  i really love the kid suite with 2 bathrooms that we got, the convenience of having 2 bathrooms for a big family such as ours is just really nice! rooms were clean and suroundings were quiet just perfect for the weekend. i also want to mention the free breakfast they have, they place was neat and they offer good food for breakfast! The sausage and the breads were my favorite and the space or the room also is just enough so it does not get crowded as other hotel breakfast areas are. overall, i still totally recommend staying here if you want a place of convenience and quality for a good fraction of the
Manager Response: It is glad to see a repeated customer come back to stay with us and continuously support our business and give us such wonderful review.  Kid suite room is a special feature we have to fulfill the needs for the large families. That’s why we spent money to convert 60 standard rooms into 40 kid suite rooms. Usually in our lodging industry, every hotel/motel wants to have more rooms be able to rent. But we chose the different approach to satisfy the guests like your family. Look like the efforts and money we spent are worthwhile.  Thanks for you to give us this opportunity to include us to be part of your son’s wonderful birthday memories. We are looking forward to seeing you and your family come back to visit us again.

Summary: We were in the Kids Suite with 2 bathrooms and it was just what we wanted! Room Setup: Walk in to a normal (but nice) hotel room with 2 queens, flat screen tv, microwave, fridge, and bathroom; then there is a door that goes into a smaller room with box tv, mini table and stool (very cute), bunk, and nice big sink area and bathroom. Pros: It was clean, area felt safe, beds were comfy (even the bunk beds),  price was great (2bathrm kids suite for price of regular room elsewhere) and let me tell you having 2 bathrooms was priceless! Free normal hotel Breakfast (including waffle maker), internet, and  parking. Cons: Scrambled eggs were not so good (bland to the point were it was hard to eat) but not a big deal because lots of other options (mainly gluten options but had a few
Manager Response: Thanks for your businesses and spend your valuable time to write this review to share your experience with us. I do sincerely appreciate all your comments, good or bad, since those are very valuable information for us to be able to operate this property in a good standards level.  Our breakfast attendants cook the scrambled eggs every morning freshly. We bought the liquid egg from our food supplier vendor. Those liquid eggs are already pre-whisked, vacuumed seal in a paper container like milk, and ready to cook. I am not sure what the problem for it since they are cooked right before the breakfast serving time? However, I will look into this issue more thoroughly and get more guests’ feedbacks to identify the exact problem then I can find the right way to solve this issue.  Again, thanks for your valuable comments to assist us to improve us to be better. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family in the near future.

Summary Heading: This is not a bad place, very good value.  Perfect crash pad!
Summary: About 1 mile from gate.  Not even a mid range property but not skuzy at all.  Clean sheets, ok towels, well lit parking, free good start breakfast, warm pool, I would stay there again, staff friendly, cheap safe in room, on the #6 bus to Disneyland 4.00 per person all day both ways.  If your looking for family value, this is a good choice in the area.  If your wanting a little more up scale, not for you.  We would stay there again.  Value hint, call the property and quote the Internet rate, then ask if they can beat it with with a Senior, AAA, or any other club you belong to rate, save another 5-7 bucks, this works at most hotels.  We will stay here the next time to Disneyland.  The 5 stars is for value,location, cleanliness,  I rate stars on value for dollar paid this is a good
Manager Response: It is glad to know that there is another happy customer like you enjoy staying with us.  I know our property is not an up-scale one, but we do provide a clean, safe, and good value place for all the guests to fulfill their lodging needs. Since the overall economy is still under a tough condition and most of guests are staying in Disneyland Resort for whole day, at least for my personal point of view, most of the guests should be more care about the price value of what they pay for than how fancy or luxury the hotel they are going to stay.  Again, Thanks for your business and you spent your valuable time to share your experiences and opinions with us. We are looking forward to seeing you and your family back soon.

Summary: My family of four stayed here for 9 nights. For the money, it was very good. We stayed in a room on the ground floor with two queen beds near the breakfast room. The room itself was clean, the carpet did have a couple of stains and looked as if it needed to be replaced, but my socks remained white after walking on it. The beds were comfortable. My kids enjoyed the heated pool and hot tub. The staff came in every morning to clean our room. The breakfast was fine. It had good choices, great coffee and creamer, and friendly staff. Gloria was particularly nice. One suggestion I  have is to purchase some salsa or walk across the street to Taco Bell for some because it helps to spice up the eggs. Really, it is no Ritz Carlton, does show wear, but it is a great value for your money
Manager Response: It is a great pleasure to have your family stay with us and thanks for you to spend your valuable time to share your enjoyable experience with us.  I know our building does show tear and wear conditions during these years, however, our housekeeping crews work really hard to make our rooms clean and neat; and our maintenance team do their best to keep up this building and ensure everything works properly.  Your suggestion for purchasing some salsa is a great one.  I will go ahead to do so.  Comfort Inn has tried to promote their brands into a higher standard and getting a better marketing share, we have expended our breakfast from a regular Continental Breakfast into a Deluxe Hot Breakfast since the last June. I believe you and your family already found these changes are most welcomed. It does cost us more money to provide these FREE breakfast, your enjoyments and pleases are the greatest rewards for us.   Besides, our room rate is very reasonable and comparable. That is why most of our guests found our rate has a very good value.  Again, Thanks for your businesses. We are looking forward to seeing you and your family again.

Summary Heading: Great value - close enough to Disneyland
Summary: As with other reviews, everything I say here revolves around "value".  This isn't a resort hotel.  But at the same time, this isn't a bare bones place to stay either (like most options right across the street).  With the age of our kids, we have reached the point where we spend long days at the park.  So this hotel is a great fit for us.  Simple rooms (the suite is ideal with the extra beds), simple breakfast to kick start our day, nice pool and spa to visit each night.  While it is on a busy road, most of the hotel is set back far enough that you don't notice much noise.  Even if the pool is occupied (I have never seen more than 5 people at at time), it is far enough away from the rooms that it shouldn't keep the kids up at night.  There are also some good restaurants that are
Manager Response: It is glad to know that you are satisfied with our property.  As mentioned on your review, we try really hard to provide more features and better services to serve our guests to have an enjoyable vacation with our reasonable rate. The following key factors do add up to a “Great Value” compliment comment.  1.	We provide Deluxe Hot Breakfast to give our guests a good kick-off starting every morning.  2.	We also work out with some surrounding restaurants to provide a restaurant discount coupon for our guests to get a special discount when dining with those restaurants. The discounted rate is ranged from 10% to 15%.  3.	Our kid suite room is a special feature comparing with the surrounding hotel/motel which is a good fit for a big family. Some suite rooms have two bathrooms inside which will be much more convenience for a family with all grew-up kids, and a large adult team since they don’t need to worry about someone may occupy the restroom a long time.  4.	We are one of Disneyland Good Neighbor properties. We sell all discounted Disneyland tickets for Disneyland. You not only can save some money when you buy tickets with us, but also save your time to wait on the line to purchase the tickets at the Disneyland ticket office.  5.	We provide free parking.  6.	We provide free Wi-Fi high speed internet access.  7.	We do not charge any resort fee.  Again, thanks for you spent your valuable time to write this review sharing your comments with everybody. Hope we can see you come back soon.

Summary: This was just a quick stop-over. Older property in old motel format. Got a passing grade in the all-important cleanliness category. Walked past the laundry on my way to our room and was pleased to see they were washing all of the bedding, not just the sheets. Room looked like it had been recently renovated. Granite vanity, flat screen tv, bathroom not bad. No WiFi issues. Overall not a bad value. Would stay at this place again.
Manager Response: It is glad to know that it seems like you also agree that our property does provide a “Good Value” package to our guests. The goal for all our staffs’ hard-working is making our guests satisfied and having great memories for this vacation.  Thanks you wrote this review to share your comments. We will continuously work hard to keep up this property. Hope we can see you and your family come back soon.

Summary: Granted, when we go to Disneyland, we spend very little time in our hotel, so my reviews for this area are very limited.  The checkin went really smoothly.  I reserved the room over the www.choicehotels.com website and was able to get a good discount for prepaying for the room.  I had with me my husband, 3 children and a family friend. I loved one aspect of this room in that there is a cute little room with its own bathroom and tv that I put my oldest daughter and our friend in so that they could have some privacy and their own shower!  Yay!  The bunkbeds were very cute, very convienient and each had it's own reading light, to the delight of our bookworms.  One bad note, we arrived late (about 10pm) and after having driven all day long, we threw suits on the kids and headed for
Manager Response: Thanks for you spent your valuable time to write this review. I am glad to learn that you are really like our suite room layout plus the second bathroom does provide lots of convenience and privacy.  Regarding your experience with the hot tub, I have to apologize that the temperature and the cleanness are far below the expectations. Matter of fact, this exactly same issue already happened several times after we installed the emergency shut-off switch in our pool circulation pump system. By the Federal Law, all public pools and spas need to install an emergency shut-off switch in the circulation pump system to prevent people’s clothes and/or hair being sucked into the pump and causing people drown. If people try to enjoy the sucking pressure from the spa’s pumping system, they always cover the sucking drain hole as tight as they can. However, this will cause the circulation pump shut off and cause the water dirty and not hot enough. Since this circulation pump is different and separated from the injecting pump, people can still use those injecting pump and does not aware the circulation pump is off.  My maintenance crews always checks our pool/spa and pumping system every morning when they start working and every night when they close the pool. Since this circulation pump shut off is happened during the operation hour, now I have them to do additional checking around 6:00PM. Hope this addition check up can reduce this situation happening’s frequency.  Again, thanks for your comments and we hope can see you and your family visit us again soon.

Summary: Not the nicest hotel I've stayed at but not the worst.  I booked it because I was trying to save money and knew it wouldn't be like the Hyatt down the road we've stayed at in the past.  The hotel is old and shows some wear and tear but overall the room was pretty decent.  Beds were comfy. Rooms closer to the road are quite noisy, we asked to be moved further away from road and it was better.  Breakfast was OK.......the syrup for the waffles was watery and tasted awful. The staff was courteous but not friendly.  I don't think I ever saw a smile from any of them except the women in charge of the breakfast. Overall it's a decent place to stay for the low rate I booked the room for. I'd stay again if the price was right.
Manager Response: I am glad that you are willing to give us an opportunity to try-out. I understand we are not even close to be able to compare with Hyatt Hotel. As you mentioned on your review, we can save our guests’ some money and what we provided is worth what the guests paid for.  I will contact with my supplier to find out the issue about the syrup. This supplier delivers all breakfast food and accessories for almost every limited service motels in the Disneyland area. The products they delivered should be no problem at all. Anyway, I will still look into this issue.  Give us a call to check on our price when you need to visit Disneyland area again. I believe that our price will be always right for you and worth for your money.

Summary Heading: My favorite ride at Disneyland was the Comfort Inn Maingate
Summary: After staying 4 nights at a fancy hotel we decide to save some money and stay here for our 5th of 5 nights stay at Disneyland.  Could not of asked for a better hotel room. Clean and very spacious with the separate bunk bed room. We all made the comment upon entering the room that we could have stayed here all 5 nights.  We rode the shuttle to the park and decided to walk back to our room that night.  I timed it and with only a short break for traffic lights, it took 20min. to walk from the park's main gate to our room.  Slept through breakfast due to the extremely quiet room we had.  The only down fall I could comment on would be the stairs.  If you have a problem climbing stairs make sure to request a ground level room.
Manager Response: It really makes me exciting to see our guests would prefer to stay with us than staying with a fancy hotel. It is our pleasure that we become part of your enjoyable memories during this Disneyland vacation.  Since this building is old and the original builder did not consider the needs for an elevator, it becomes a down side for us. It will be a major renovation involved to add an elevator. I have to admit that it is beyond our current operation budget which I cannot consider to do so within a near future. I apologize about all the inconvenience it causes you.  Thanks for your business your positive comments. We are looking forward to seeing you and your family come back to visit us soon.

Summary: We stayed here for our 22nd wedding anniversay.  This is not a super high end motel, but if you are looking for a clean room in which to sleep then this is the place for you.  White socks stayed white on the carpet!! We stayed Friday to Sunday and everything was perfect.
