Bring pillows for more comfort as my husband and i are pillow freaks and were glad to have 2 of our own. Perfect for Disney access and the free hotel parking was appreciated.  Did not go down for the free breakfast. The room was alot bigger than we expected!  We have found our standby hotel for the next time we go- I will not even check other properties.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Im not going to review on any aspect of this hotel other than to warn you that my 11 year old daughter's wallet was stolen from the room while we were at the park.  The poor kid had been saving allowance and birthday money for a year.  She brought her wallet to buy a souvenir the last day.  However, when we returned to the room after the first day at the park her wallet was gone.  The front office seemed indifferent about the situation and said they would call if the wallet "came up".  I suggest you stay somewhere else.
Manager Response: I am sorry to learn that your daughter lost her wallets during this trip. However, this is not fair to accuse that your daughter’s wallet was STOLEN from the room only based on your assumption.  Our property has accommodated our guests more than 28,000 room-nights, said 9,000 families, each year. The guests left all kind of their valuable stuffs, such as notebooks, cameras, cellular phones, watches, ear rings, ..etc in the room all the times when they visiting the Disneyland or attend the convention events, nobody lost anything. Sometimes, the guests even left some valuable stuff behind themselves, and housekeeper brought up to us and we have to contact the guests for mailing their stuff back. I believe those stuff are worth much more than the money in your daughter’s wallet. We have a system to track which housekeeper clean which room on everyday. We can easily aware if the guest’s stuffs are always missing when a certain housekeeper cleaned them. I really don’t believe that anybody will risk their jobs just for your daughter’s wallet, not something more valuable.  Is it possible that your daughter had her wallet with her on the second day and lost in somewhere else but afraid to tell you?  Or she just ran into a pickpocket she was never aware? There are just too many possibilities to lose a wallet. How you can prove that your daughter’s wallet really been stolen from the room? Just because you “believe” it?  We did see the same type thing happened that the guests dropped their stuff in between the mattress, underneath the beds, or behind the drawers and our housekeepers found it when they clean the room. That’s why our front desk can only politely told you that we will contact you if we do find your stuff. I don’t know anything else they can “Promise” you.  Again, I am sincerely sorry that your daughter lost her wallet. But we should not be the party to be blamed.

Summary: I had an issue with a reservation that I supposedly made.  I called a numerous amount of times to speak to the manager and he did not return my phone calls.  He also was there and would not speak to me.  He had the person at the desk speak to me. They advised me that he would call me back and I knew he wouldnt and he didnt.  I advised that I would put this review on trip advisor and they did not seem to care.  From a customer service persepective that is terrible and next time I travel which is often I will not stay at a Choice property.
Manager Response: Thanks for you to choose Comfort Inn Maingate to fulfill your lodging needs.  To respond your comments, I really have no idea what type of reservation error you had made. Once a while, we have received the phone calls from the guests stated that they either forgot or did not aware that they completed the reservation processes, so they did not come over our property on the date they reserved and they expected us to refund their “No Show” charge. Or they tried to cancel their reservation after the cancellation policy allowed and expected us not charge them the cancellation charge. Our guest service agents always explained to the guests about the hotel industry’s standard “No-Show” charge policy and cancellation policy. However, some guests insisted to talk to “Manager” to seek that there is any different answer. Usually, there are a few circumstances that your change or cancel reservation requests will be honored without any penalty. Besides th0se circumstances, the penalty change will be applied. I don’t understand that why people expect the hotel takes a loss to accommodate with the guests’ own mistakes?  Please be advised that there are several types of reservation we are not able to do anything such as booked room through some online reservation channels which they clearly state their cancellation policy prior to you confirm your reservation; or after you decided to book the room with the Choice Hotels’ “Advance Purchase” promotion, which this rate is much less than all online prices, then want to cancel or change your reservation.   Book a hotel room should be treated like you booked an airline ticket, if you missed the flight or want to change to a different flight, will you call the airline company and ask to speak with their “Manager” to get a refund or waive the penalty? If the answer is “No”, why you expect the hotel industry shall treat it different?

Summary: Disney trip for my 3 kids, husband, self and my mom.  We booked the 2 bedroom kids' suite.  We were beyond impressed with the amount of space.  The two bathrooms were very clean and it was so nice not to have to fight over bathroom time!  The bunkbeds were adorable, and there was even a tv in the kids' room.  Disney comforters were a nice touch.  Everything was clean, good sized fridge, microwave worked fine, in-room coffee is always a plus for me. Free wi-fi was a nice bonus. Nice heated pool and jacuzzi.  We liked the small size as opposed to the giant hotels.  Mattress was a little soft for my taste, but my mom and my husband were both very comfortable, and the kids slept great. Pretty good free breakfast (go early, it gets crowded after 7:30). Friendly service at the front
Manager Response: It is glad to know that you and your family have a great time to stay with us.  I remember your daughter’s new Minnie T-shirt since I am the person answered your phone and went into your room to find that T-shirt. That is a cute and pretty T-shirt which every girl will love it. I can image the happiest smile on her face when she received that T-shirt.  Please come back and visit us again. The Disneyland will open their “Car Zone” in California Advantage Park in July of this year. Your daughter rand all your family will love these new attractions.

Summary: We had a large group, 12 people.  So we booked two of the 2 bedroom kids suites.  It was such a relief to have 4 full bathrooms for all of us.  The kids loved having bunk bed rooms for all of the cousins to play together in.  The rooms were comfortable and clean.  Refrigerator and microwaves came in handy for cooking and storing of food while on vacation.  When we booked our hotel through a popular vacation website, we also bought ART passes for the shuttle to Disneyland.  This was very convenient the stop was only one hotel down the road.    Breakfast time can be a little busy with all the people, but we never had a problem finding seating.  There is seating outside, and even more seating outside and around a corner.  It is true that many people are only concerned about their
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Maingate due to we found really good rates. We had never stayed here before and thought we would give it a try. We arrived and the front desk was absolutely fabulous. Very friendly and let us know where everything was. They also upgraded our room to one of the biggest in the complex. We didn't realise how big until we walked in the front door. You could have fit two families there with room to spare. The furniture was abit dated but we couldn't find any fault since everything was comfortable clean and in decent condition. The shower gave plenty of hot water and was nice and clean. The beds were extra firm but that was a plus for us since we like them that way and slept very well. Breakfast was very good, we had scrambled eggs and sausage patties, but
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The great, the good, and the not-so-good.
Summary: Stayed for Disney trip on 10/14/11. Stayed in a Kids suite with 2 bathrooms.   The Great = Size of the room and 2 bathrooms. I have 3 teens and the bunks provided for my girls to have their own beds and my son to take the 2nd queen in the main room. Both rooms had ample space to store your stuff. Shower had excellent shower heads. Lots of comfy pillows. If you drive the location is excellent... right down the street from main parking and in a good location as many restaurants and stores (like Target) are right down the street. Newer countertops in bathrooms were lovely.   The Good = Breakfast had a lot of choices and ample food. TVs were good and AC was good. Beds were comfy. Towels were adequate and water was hot.   The OK = Parking: Most of the rooms are in a main part of the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Was hoping for a bit more.
Summary: We frequent Disneyland & we're always looking for a new favorite place to stay that's more reasonable than our favorites (Best Western Park Place Inn, Embassy Suites or HoJo's)   We picked this hotel through Get Away Today based on Trip Advisor reviews, price & their hot breakfast. I was also impressed to see someone from the hotel actually reads these reviews.  Check in was smooth & the front desk was very friendly. A much welcomed change from the hotel we had just come from in Irvine. We had just come from the beach, so we checked into our room & headed to the pool. The pool & hot tub are very nice, but they're in the parking lot & this causes a HUGE downfall. Right behind the hot tub area is the garbage dumpster. Maybe it would be ok in the cooler months, but in August, the
Manager Response: I am regret that you did not have an enjoyable experience to stay with us.  Regarding the garbage dumpster locates right behind the pool and hot tub – until you mentioned on this review, there is nobody even bring up my attentions that the smell does ruin their enjoyment. Since we always schedule our garbage pick up four times per week to make sure our trashes can be cleaned up no more than two days, I never know we have such smell problem. To solve this problem, first all, I will have my crew to wash out the trash bins once a week. If it does not solve the problem, we may need to consider making that space enclosed.  Regarding the water temperature issue - I discussed with some plumbers and everyone gave me some different solutions and/or suggestions. However, they all believe that there are too many people use showers in the same time, especially there is a team staying in due to they all being waken up on the same time. I am evaluating their suggestions and seeking the right solutions now.  Regarding the room cleaning services were too late - I have to admire our housekeepers’ training can be improved to be better. During the busy seasons, I usually have them to clean the checked-out rooms to make ready for the new guests check-in. However, there are guests like you did come back during the mid-day to try to take a rest and our housekeeper did not make the room yet. From this past summer, I already revise our work strategy to start to clean the stay-over after their lunches. I think they are not completely following this new strategy yet. It is our bad.  Regarding the parking issue - we really have more parking spaces available than most of hotels/motels around the Disneyland Resort. A lot of places charge the parking fees to lower their parking demand or allow the guests to double park their cars, which always cause problem on the next morning when the other guests found their cars being blocked. We do not have such problem. We do have two parking areas available in our property. One is located within the courtyard place and the other parking area is on the other side of building. Since our guestrooms are back to back, and those parking spaces are also in front of our other side’s guestrooms. There is no different safe issue for these two parking lots. Be honestly, Anaheim is a good area to visit. We did not have any problems happen, at least up to date, in our guests’ vehicles. There is nothing you need to worry about.  Regarding the scrambled eggs - we cook our scrambled eggs every morning. We bought those liquid eggs, not powdered ones, from our breakfast vendors. This type of liquid egg has been widely used in almost every restaurant which serves the breakfast. I do not know our scrambled eggs are different from others. I also don’t even know there are powdered eggs sold in the market. Since you come to Disneyland quite often, I am sincerely inviting you to check the liquid eggs we purchased. If you want, I can even arrange our vendor to meet you to discuss this issue.  Regarding the plastic container to heat up the sausage with microwave – if you noticed, those plastic containers are brown color, not regular clear container. These brown-color plastic containers are made by the high-heat resistant material which is designed for this heating purpose. This container can resist from -40⁰F to 375⁰F. Please be noted that Orange County Health Department comes to inspect our breakfast facilities twice per year. If those containers are not safe to heat up the food, they will not allow us to use also.  To conclude my reply, I do still sincerely appreciate that you spent your valuable time to write this review and share your feelings, both good and bad, with us and everybody. I wish you can stop by next time when you visit Disneyland again. You don’t have to stay with us, but do come back to check out whether we do any improvement and verify the statement I replied above is true or not.   Thanks for your business and comments. Wish I can meet you and chart with you in person next time.

Summary: Located close to Disney Resort.  Rooms are clean and price is reasonable.  Includes free breakfast and free wi-fi.
Manager Response: I am great that you gave us a positive review regarding our room value, sleep quality and cleanliness. Thanks for your compliments. However, you only graded our guest services as a fair level. It appears that we still have rooms to improve our guest services. Would you able to send me a mail or e-mail to describe where we can improve our services? Thanks in advance.  We are looking forward to seeing you back to Disneyland soon.

Summary: I'd stay there again anytime.  Housekeeping staff did great work.  Registration desk staff friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: There is nothing more excited to learn that our services make the guests loving to stay with us and become to be our repeated customers.  Thanks for your businesses and compliments. We are looking forward to seeing you and your family again.

Summary Heading: Just ok... expected a little better
Summary: I chose this hotel because on their website they were 3 blocks away from Disneyland and it would be convenient to walk. Arriving we were told that it was not 3 blocks but a mile away. They do offer a shuttle service for $4 a person but we preferred to drive. Front desk was nice; very quick in checking in and out. Room was ok. Rust on toilet paper holder and no flat screen television as advertized. Biggest frustration was the shower with the water temperature. It would immediately change from hot to cold and never stayed one temperature. Loved having the free breakfast in the morning! Overall, good service, ok room and bad advertising.
Manager Response: First all, I appreciate for choosing our Comfort Inn Maingate to fulfill your lodging need and also spend your time to write this review to share your experience.  The shuttle is provided by Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) to take guests back and forth from every hotel/motel to Disneyland. After this ART established, City of Anaheim does not allow any more property to provide their own shuttle service unless they already have this service existed. We are just courtesy to sell the ART passes to our guests for their own convenience. We do not get any profit during these transitions.  On August 7th and 8th, we received several complains stating that the shower water temperature cannot stay in a comfortable temperature.  After we investigated, we found that somebody turn the cold water branch valve half way off, which are located on outside of building columns. Each coldwater branch valve controls eight (8) units’ coldwater in-take. You must stayed in one of these 8 units during that time. Since the coldwater was insufficient, the shower water temperature became unstable. After we turned the water valve back on, the problem is solved. We apologize this issue caused you any inconvenience.  I sincerely hope that the above explanation can earn your understanding. Wish we have another opportunity to serve you and your family again.

Summary: My son scalded his hands with the water that was set on cold, come to find out the handle was stripped.  No maintenance person on duty.  Finally a housekeeper came with the wrong tools and fixed it temporarly.  I had to fix it myself before we checked out.   Room upstairs sounded like a gymnasium all night long that my sons had to leave their room (the one with the bunkbeds) and come and sleep in our beds because it was so loud.  One day, the housekeeper didnt leave towels and cleaned only half of the room.  The toilet would self flush every half hour, which drove us nuts.   The breakfast room was another straw on the overloaded camels back.  Overpacked and the other guests were rude and would make 4-6 waffles at at time instead of allowing those waiting to get a chance. They
Manager Response: I am sincerely apologizing that you did not feel satisfactory during this stay.  On August 7th and 8th, we received several complaints, yours is one of them, stating that the shower water temperature cannot stay in a comfortable temperature.  After we investigated, we found that somebody turn the cold water branch valve half way off, which are located on outside of building columns. Each coldwater branch valve controls eight (8) units’ coldwater in-take. You must stayed in one of these 8 units during that time. Since the coldwater was insufficient, the shower water temperature became unstable. After we turned the water valve back on, the problem is solved. This problem is beyond my housekeeper’s capability. No matter which tool he carried, those are wrong tools anyway. We apologize this issue caused you any inconvenience. We did also experience that some kids are so excited during their Disneyland vacations, they just consistently running around even on the late evening. Once and wile, we need to call to remind their parents to claim down their kids. But sometime it is difficult to do so. Staying on the second floor is one option. Otherwise, if you experience this type problem, call to our front desk and let us to talk to their parents. Having our staff to serve certain items in breakfast may be a good idea. However, how to cut down the waiting time for waffle and toaster line is still a challenge. I need to discuss among my staffs to come out a better way to solve this problem.  I sincerely hope that the above explanation can earn your understanding. Wish we have another opportunity to serve you and your family again.

Summary: If not for the completely full parking lot (no parking) and the overcrowded breakfast room, I would have given this hotel another point.  We got one of the two room, two bathroom rooms, with bunk beds in one room and two doubles in the other.  The bunks were more than adequate for our two teen daughters.  For the price we paid, I can't complain. We arrived after spending the day at Disneyland, and it supposedly is only three blocks, but it took us a good 20 minutes of driving from the Mickey parking structure to the hotel.  We had a room at the back, so the noise was minimal.  When arriving at the breakfast room about half way thru the breakfast time, there was almost nothing left.  Every time the hotel worker would put out food, it disappeared instantly (there were that many
Manager Response: I am regret that your impression for our property is “Crowded, crowded, crowded!”.  Our property has 108 rooms and has 110 parking spaces, which I don’t even include the 14 parking spaces we give to Ramada Inn for their parking usage. City of Anaheim only requests every hotel/motel has number of parking spaces equal or larger than 70% of their guestroom number since there are so many tourists not driving to Anaheim. Our parking availability ratio should be one of the highest ratios among the Disneyland Resort area. I am not sure that whether you aware that there is additional parking spaces located behind the building and right next to the Sport Bar Restaurant at our next door. I may need to improve the signage to indicate this parking area to prevent any further confusion. Be honestly, so far, we have no complains that we are short of parking spaces available for our guests.  For breakfast room, I know even I already provide 64 seats total in our breakfast room, it still appear that the room is not big enough. The waiting lines for Waffle and Toaster may make it look much worse. This comment is the same as shown on the other guest’s review, some people are so selfish and do not consider other persons. I need to come out some different way to operate the breakfast services.  Thanks you for choosing our Comfort Inn Maingate to fulfill your lodging needs. I hope the above explanations can earn your understanding and forgiveness. Wish we have another opportunity to serve you and your family again.

Summary: My recent stay was a good experience. The room was big and clean, this hotel offers breakfast which is a bonus, but most of all  the two ladies at the front desk, Hazel and Helen,  who went out of their way to help me, when the lobby computer was down. Management I think you need a new computer..Anyways Hazel was kind enough to let me use her laptop to register and check in for my return flight home,  I really appreciated her concern and kindness...thankyou Jill C
Manager Response: I am glad to learn that our staff went beyond to assist our guests for their needs. Hazzel and Helen will get their rewards from the Management Team.  Since I received several comments regarding our lobby computer was always down, I already replaced that lobby computer about three weeks ago. So far this new computer is working fine.  Thanks for your business and looking forward to seeing you back to stay with us again.

Summary: We stayed here on our return trip from Louisiana to Oregon, the motel was nice.  The people at the front desk were very friendly and the room was nice.  It was very spacious and I liked that it had a refrigerator, that is very important if you plan on spending time at Disneyland.   The room was clean, it could use a little updating, and the carpet was a little on the dirty side.  The beds were comfortable and clean.  The chairs at the desk, and the oversized chair by the front door were very dirty, they had some stains and one of the towels had a red stain in the corner of it ,but other than that it was great.  I think the layout of the room could be adjusted some, there was a lot of room between the air conditioner and the bed and then where the TV stand/dresser was it was very
Manager Response: It is our pleasure to have this opportunity to serve you and your family and glad to learn that you have a enjoyable experience to stay with our Comfort Inn Maingate.  I order to provide more convenience to our guests; we furnish refrigerator and microwave oven in every guestroom.  We have submitted and tried to get an approval for using seat covers over the in-room chairs for the past two months. We did not get the response for yes or no yet. We have always cleaned those chairs during the time we shampoo the carpet. It is getting tough to remove the stains off when it is caused by juice and/or coffee split. However, it is much easier to wash the seat covers.  “Breakfast room is too small” is the problems I have no way to fix it. The franchise requests us having a breakfast room with 27 seats. Now we furnish 65 seats already, but it is still not enough. Due to most of our guests are the families with children to visit Disneyland, they can really easily make our breakfast room crowded. Matter of fact, my breakfast vendor told me that he sell the breakfast products to every Comfort Inn in Orange County, we are the one ordered most. In the other words, we have more guests than other general area.  Again, thanks you to choose our Comfort Inn Maingate to fulfill your lodging needs. Wish we could see you coming back soon.

Summary: when we got there the we checked into the 2bd/2br suite but only half of it was cleaned i picked up the phone and called up to the desk and they asked if we wanted to switch rooms or wait for it to be cleaned, we chose to wait and the house keeping was there to clean it with in 5min!!! On that note my daughter had ripped one of her dolls and when we came back from disneylands that night the housekeeper had fixed the doll and placed it on her bed. I felt like that was someone who went above and beyond her/his job discription. Thank you for taking the time and always being prompt when we would call with a problem.
Manager Response: in our property. Since we just changed our reservation computer system on the May 19, 2011, our front desk staffs are still not 100% familiar with this new reservation system yet on the date your family checked in. Otherwise, there is an area does show which room is clean/ready and which room is not ready yet. Our front desk staffs should not have this problem again.  Regarding the extra mile my housekeeper did to your daughter, it impress me as well. If you don’t mind, please contact me at hotel and let me know that your name and which date your daughter’s doll being fixed, we have enough records to find out who cleaned your room. I will give her a compliment and an award.  Again, thanks for your business. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serving you and your family.

Summary Heading: Very good hotel , i will come back
Summary: I have a great surprise whit this hotel. Huge and clean room, with all that we need: silence, coffe, bathtub, lcd tv. They have breakfast, spa, pool and gym, near disney, a good staff and the room for a good price. I really recomend this hotel.
Manager Response: I am glad to learn that you have a great experience to stay with Comfort Inn Maingate. We try really hard to maintain our property to meet and/or excess the industry standards.  By the way, we just upgraded our breakfast into the “Hot” breakfast on the early June. In addition to our original continental breakfast items, our hot breakfast increases meats, scrambled eggs, a second flavor of waffle, two different flavors of yogurt, whole milk, and lots more. Come back to check out our new “Your Morning” breakfast.  Again, thanks for your business and looking forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: Very dirty and noisy - wouldn't stay here again
Summary: I was hoping against hope that Comfort Inn Maingate would be one of those places where you could say, "Oh, it's cheap, but you get more than you pay for." Unfortunately, that's not the case. You definitely get what you pay for. The hotel is relatively close to Disneyland (about 20 minutes walking distance), and a shuttle (albeit a very unreliable one via the Anaheim transit system) runs from the hotel next door to Dinsneyland. We stayed in the kids' suite with two kids. The setup was nice because we could put the kids to bed earlier and stay up.   My biggest complaint is that the hotel was so dirty. It was surface clean, but the carpet looked like it had NEVER been cleaned. Our toddler ran around for a few  minutes in his footie pajamas one day, and the soles were literally
Manager Response: I am regret that our room conditions do not meet your expectations.  We do lots of works to maintain our carpets in a reasonable clean condition. As you may aware that our building is constructed as an exterior corridor structure, it is always more difficult to maintain the carpet cleanness. In order to do so, we already did the followings:  ·	We re-sealed our parking lots on the October 2010 to prevent the parking lots has too much dusts to allow the guests to carry into the rooms. ·	We bought several heavy-duty commercial floor mats and laid on each entryways to try to catch the dirt before the guests go into the rooms. ·	We bought a new cleaning solution to clean the carpets dirty spots. With this solution, we can make a rough clean much easier and it can assist us to maintain the carpet at a reasonable cleanness between we do the deep cleaning.  However, the efforts we put into still can not guarantee we can make every guest satisfied. It does make our guests complain much less than before. In accordance with your description, our housekeeping crews must overlook it. We sincerely apologize for that. We regret that we didnt be informed when you feel uncomfortable, otherwise we should be able to do a quick clean for you.  Regarding the high-speed internet access services, we have contracted with Inn Flux, which is providing a 24/7 internet technical support for our guests. If any guest have difficult to get on our internet network, they can always assist our guests within a phone call. The only thing the guest needs to do is to call our front desk, so we can transfer to them for their assistant.  Regarding the noisy from the upper level, I have apologized for this manner. We have experienced that some kids are so excited during their vacations and running around on the upper stair. It really makes noisy to other guests. Usually, once we got the phone call to complain the noisy, the front desk will call to the room makes noisy to talk to the parents to calm down their kids. However, my front desk should call you back later to confirm the upper stair has quiet down. Look like he did not do so.  Thanks you to spend times to share your experiences and sincerely comments with us. We will continuously improve ourselves. If possible, please stop by again to check us up. Again, thanks for your business and hope we can earn your understanding and forgiveness.

Summary: We stayed at one of the Kids Suites with 2 bathrooms over Spring Break with my husband, 3 year old son, and Mother-In-Law for 4 nights.  We were so impressed with the location (only a 15 min walk to Disney!) and the price for all that you get - delicious breakfast and yummy coffee & a place for my son to 'claim'.  We will definately be staying there again!
Manager Response: We are glad to know you have a wonderful and enjoyable vacation you deserved. We also appreciate that you spend your valuable time to write this review to share your experiences with everybody.  We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family in the near future.

Summary: My daughter and I spent the week following Easter at the Comfort Inn Maingate.  The front desk staff was very friendly.  Helen was especially helpful whenever we had questions of any sort.    The rooms were very clean. We did find the lighting very dim in the room,  making application of makeup difficult for someone who has poorer eyesight.  We had trouble connecting to Wifi in our room which wasn't a huge problem for us.  There is a fridge, microwave, and safe (which we didn't use) in the room.  We stayed on the second floor so there was virtually no noise that we noticed, other than other doors closing but that's not an issue for us.  We don't mind climbing the stairs, but it was hard to carry our heavy suitcases up and down at the beginning and end of our stay, but not a huge
Manager Response: We are glad to know you have a wonderful and enjoyable vacation  To provide more convenience for our guests, every guestroom has a microwave oven and refrigerator. We also upgrade our regular continental breakfast to hot breakfast. There are lots of items being added, such as sausage patty, scrambled eggs, yogurt, …and etc. Come back to check it out.   We contracted with an internet technical consultant to provide a 24/7 technical supports when our guests have problems to access our internet network. It is too bad that you did not utilize this service.  Stay on which floor is really depends on the guests themselves. Some people sleep really light and can not sleep with any noisy. Some guests have exhausted in Disneyland and sleep in deep and won’t be wake up by anything. Regarding the noisy, sometimes it is really difficult to claim down some kids if they still feel exciting after visited Disneyland in the daytime.   Again, we appreciate your business and your honest review. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family in the near future.

Summary: Close to Honda Center.  Reasonable price, clean.  Staff was very helpful, friendly and competent.  Breakfast was okay.  On weekends, food goes fast.
Manager Response: Thanks you to share your experience to us.  I am glad that you describe our property as a “Convenience Location, Clean, Value, and Nice Service” property. This is a compliment for us. Thanks.  We have changed our breakfast from Continental Breakfast to Hot Breakfast. The new items we added in our breakfast menu are such as sausage patty, scramble eggs, yogurts, second flavor of waffle, and many more. Come back to check on our new breakfast.  Again, Thanks for your business and looking forward to seeing you back.

Summary Heading: NO FRILLS BUT VALUE FOR MONEY
Summary: Stayed here with my wife and 2 young girls first 2 weeks of April.  I work in Papua New Guinea so LA is half way for both us.  Must admit this was second on the list but as we have to book via QANTAS in Port Moresby they crucify us on their AUD USD exchange rate so our first choice was well over budget as a result.  Comfort Inn MG Anaheim does what it says on the box.  If you are visiting Disneyland then lets be honest you don't need fantastic amenities, I was grateful to crash into my bed at night.  The kids were keen to get into the pool but it was early April and to be honest found it a bit cold after 6 months at over 30 degrees!  The room has a lots in a small area, a fridge we used, a microwave we didnt and a LCD TV with lots of channels including ESPN,  Being Brits abroad
Manager Response: I am sincerely appreciating your fair comments for your experience to stay with our property.  As you may know that we are only a two-star hotel, there are no fancy and/or luxury amenities in our property. The items we have are for more practical usage. I am glad that you did enjoy our amenities, customer service, and reasonable price.  Our breakfast has been changed to Hot Breakfast.  Sometimes, we did experience that the kids on the second floor were too excite during their Disneyland vacations, they are always running around and caused lots of noisy and bothered the guests on the downstairs. For this issue, I do agree with you that if you don’t have too many or heavy luggage with you, staying at the second floor is a good idea.  I already contacted ART shuttle’s supervisor for several complains I received from my guests, yours is one of them. He promised me that they will look into this “delay” issue and work on it.  Again, Thanks for your business and spending your valuable time to share your experience with everybody. We are looking forward to seeing you and your family again.

Summary: This is your basic, no frills accommodations.  Pros: - Very clean and well maintained. - Comfortable beds. - Newer LCD TV - Breakfast was included. - Ample free parking. - Fast, free wifi. - Kids' Suite was well laid out.  Cons: - 'Heated' pool was freezing. - "Hot Tub" spa was luke warm. - Very little noise dampening--we could hear everything from our neighbours. - Rooms were not cleaned until late in the day. - Fee for using the in room safe. - Front Desk staff (all of them) were not very pleasant (a bit grumpy and they looked tired). - Not walking distance to Disneyland.
Manager Response: We are always appreciating our guests to provide their valuable comments to us for an improvement guideline.  Regarding the water temperature for pool and spa, his is not my first time to hear this type of comments. We have set up 78 degrees for pool and 103 degrees for spa. Those temperatures are recommended by the pool industry. Matter of fact, the pool water heater has been manufactured to limit the temperature not to excess 104 degrees. I really don’t know how we should do to improve this issue.  During the busy season, we intent to firstly clean the rooms which guests just checked out to make ready for the guests check in. Then our housekeepers start to clean the rooms which guests stay over. We do the opposite way during the slow season. That’s why you felt your room was not cleaned until late of the day.  Again, thanks for your business and valuable comments. We will continuously improve ourselves.

Summary Heading: Fabulous Service at the Comfort Inn!
Summary: This is a great hotel.  It's close enough to Disneyland, the rates are great, the rooms are clean, and they offer an adequate breakfast for those on the go.  If you are traveling with a large family, the two bedroom, two bath is roomy and the rate is reasonable.  Also, no fee for parking, which many of the hotels in the area charged for.  There was also a refrigerator and microwave, which came in very handy for our family.  But the best thing about the hotel is the fabulous service!  We had a coffee maker that didn't work and it was immediately replaced.  We inadvertently packed (and brought home) the tv remote, and they did not charge us for it when we contacted them and said we would mail it back.  The front desk, maintenance folks, and breakfast room people are friendly and
Manager Response: I am glad to learn that you and your family have a wonderful and enjoyable experience for staying with us.   I will share your comments with all my staffs and encourage them keep up their positive attitude to provide their best services.  Thanks for your business and valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family.

Summary: Great Stay! 2nd stay in 6 months. Check in easy and efficient. Ness was very nice and answered all our questions. Room very clean, spacious and great room amenities! Breakfast good! Waffles added bonus! Close to Disneyland and restaurants! Anaheim resort transit stop right next door and ticket sold right at the front desk! I plan on making this my Disney vacation home every time!
Manager Response: I am glad to learn that you and your family have a wonderful and enjoyable experience for staying with us.   I always encourage my staffs to do the best they can to make the one time guest having a great time and becoming our repeated guest. Look like they did it. Besides, our package deal does provide a great value for our guests. I believe you will agree my statement, right?    Thanks for your business and valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family.

Summary: This is a nice hotel near Disneyland. Don't try to walk there but found the ART system to very nice and convenient. The room was nice, although I found the bed a bit firm. If you've stayed at a Comfort Inn before it lives up to its standards. The only thing I can say is that they need to redefine the word "heated" when it comes to the pool, it was not heated. Having a refrigerator is nice, we kept our snacks for Disneyland in there. Overall a good place to stay.
Manager Response: I am glad to learn that you and your family have an enjoyable experience for staying with our Comfort Inn.   I am absolutely agreeing with you that not walk to Disneyland. Remember that after you spend a whole day or a few days walking in the Disneyland, it will become very tough to walk back to our property.  I got the comments for the pool water temperature several times already. The 78 degrees is the temperature recommended by the swimming pool industry. I may really need to consider not follow their recommendations and rise up the temperature a little bit.  We now provide refrigerator and microwave oven in every room to provide our guests a more convenience room amenity.     Thanks for your business and valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family.

Summary: We booked 2 kids suites with 2 bathrooms on each room and it was nice. the kids loved the bunkbeds and having 2 bathrooms just makes it so convenient for a big family group such us ours. The front desk was nice and helpful but the only thing i did not like is that i had to go back there over and over again because not all the card keys they gave us worked, or some of them just stopped working. But it was fine, its just a minor issue compared to the great experience we had staying here. overall i would say this is the perfect place to stay at if you want comfort, convenience and still have extra money to spend for your family.
Manager Response: I am glad to learn that you and your family have an enjoyable experience for staying with our Comfort Inn.   This type of Kid’s Suite room is specially designed for the big family like yours. I am glad you and your family like this layout. Otherwise, the big family needs to squeeze into a standard room. Some people need to share their room or sleep in the rollaway bed, which makes the room become more tight space. Or they need to stay in two rooms which it will cost them much more.  Thanks for your business and valuable comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family.

Summary: I book my room online. I researched all the other hotels in the area, and this one had the best reviews. Not to mention had a great price. From the pictures that were online the rooms looked better than  rooms at most hotels. Upon arrival I was expecting the room to look nothing like the picture, but it was actually better  I was expecting the room to smell like smoke too because most places say no smoking, but still smell. Nope not this place. It actually had a nice clean scent in the room. It was very clean. Bed was comfy. Everything was in great condition. Overall, stay was wonderful. I wish I could have stood longer. I will definitely be back.
Manager Response: It makes us feel exciting to see our guests have a wonderful and enjoyable experience in staying with us. Your fully satisfactions for the services we provided has encouraged us the most.  Thanks for sharing your comments with us.

Summary: There are a few good things, and a few bad... The bad- the coolers smell funny, the pillows are terrible, and the pool is not really as warm as would be preferred to consider "heated". We stayed in 2 different rooms, both of which had the air conditioner odor and the weird, small, square pillows. There was also some sort of incident on the last day with a hotel employee and her child's dad or something, which ended up with the police being there. It was a little scary, but I guess things like that could really happen anywhere... The good- it's decently close to Disneyland, the "kids suite" was a great thing for not having kids in your bed kicking you all night, and it was pretty quiet and comfortable. If you are looking for a higher end place, this is not it, but if you are
Manager Response: We do sincerely appreciate that you spend time to provide your valuable comments for us to improve our property.  1.)	We have our housekeepers to defrost and clean all the room refrigerators to ensure there is no left over smell in those units. 2.)	Since Comfort Inn franchiser specified and requested us only can purchase this brand and type of pillows and no other style and/or brand is allowed. We currently won’t able to do any changes about it. However, we already forward this comment regarding this type of pillow to our franchiser for their reviews. 3.)	We set up the temperature to 78 F in pool and 103 F in spa. We may need to re-evaluate the temperature setting. 4.)	Our maintenance crews are always planning to clean all A/C units during April and/or May on every year to prepare to be ready for the summer seasons. I have them to investigate whether we need to do this routine more often or this is only a single case? 5.)	We did apologize that there is an incident happened in our property. Matter of fact is one of my front desk staff’s ex-boyfriend came to our property and ran into her current boyfriend. The both ended up got into fight. This front desk staff already left and no longer works here. I believe this thing will not happen again. 6.)	The kid’s suite rooms are a good feature for our property since these rooms provide an enough space to accommodate a good size of family. This type of room definitely provides a great choice for those families looking for a decent and budget place to stay during their holidays.

Summary: Myself and 7 family members rented two rooms for two nights, it started out well, they got us into one of the rooms early. When we returned from Disneyland, we had to redo paperwork, credit card and etc. to get our second room, even though they could see we were soaking wet from a rainy walk. Then two of our parties seen a large cockraoch on the outside wall by our hotel room door. In my room the tv would not work and they said they would send someone right away and did not. Both mornings at breakfast, the eating rooms floors were sticky, and they kept running out of food. In  my room the coffe pot did not work properly either.
Manager Response: I am regretting to learn that you and your family did not have an enjoyable experience to stay with us. I went over our front desk log from December 1st to 29th. My front desk staffs are required to put in every issues happened during their shifts into this log, which even includes which room needs extra towels, which room does not require room service, … etc. However, I could not locate which room’s TV and coffee pot were not working. Could you call me directly on my direct phone 714-703-2188 to let me know which room you stayed, so I can send my maintenance engineer to fix the problems. We have a breakfast attendant during the breakfast hours to ensure we are not run out the food. I don’t know what’s happened during your stay. If you can let me know when and which room you stayed, then I am able to locate who is the attendant and I can talk to her. Again, thanks for your business and comments. I will ensure the problems you mentioned will be taken care.

Summary: The staff was knowledgeable, friendly, and accommodating.  The room was as good or better than the Anaheim Marriott down the street and it was $100 a night lees expensive with no sacrifice in quality.  Excellent place to stay!!
Manager Response: It is great to learn that you and your family have a great experience to stay with us and willing to share your experience with everybody.  We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family again.

Summary Heading: Great place and price and very accomodating!
Summary: Booked this hotel for our family with two toddlers (kid suite) and another family joined us last minute and hotel accomodated a joint room. Downside is Disneyland is too far to walk with little kids and hotel charges a safe fee regardless if you use it.
Manager Response: Our front desk staffs always review the arrival list in the early morning to see any family groups having request to stay close together. We will always try to make those requests happen. I am glad our pre-act arrangement does work for your family and your friend’s.  There must be a misunderstanding for the charges about the in-room safe. Our reservation system does automatically charge a fee for safe everyday. However, we always ask guests whether they used the safe or not during their check-out time. Since we can’t verify the fact, we always take the guests’ words without any further questions. If the guests did not use the safe, we will remove those charges away from their bill. If you did not use the safe, please contact us via e-mail or phone call, we will be more than happy to credit back those charges to you.  Matter of fact, we are currently lease these in-room safes. Once this lease term is over, I may consider to continuously providing these safes without additional change.  Again, thanks for your business and this valuable feedback.

Summary: My kids LOVED the seperate room with bunk beds and their own TV and space, My husband and I enjoyed the large living area with TV, microwave, fridge, and the housekeepers were super! It was quiet and very close to Disneyland. You can't beat it for the price! If you are super picky about exterior appearances you'll have to spend more on a different hotel - we choose to spend the extra on the kids and the fun.
Manager Response: It is really appreciated to see your comments and learn you and your family loves our room and our services. All our staffs’ hard working is worthwhile.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for families!
Summary: This is the second time our family has stayed at the Comfort Inn Maingate and again, we had a great experience!  The room was super clean, breakfast was excellent and the service was fabulous.  I don't know that we'll stay anywhere else when we travel to Anaheim.  Our children loved the bunkroom, it really made their stay special.
Manager Response: It is glad to see the returned guests come back and give us a repeated business. Like I always told to my staffs that the most difficult part to do the business is providing the best service and making the guests have an enjoyable experience and become your returned customers. It seems we earn your trust already.  Thanks for your businesses and we are looking forward to seeing your family again.

Summary Heading: Great stay! Excellent service and great value
Summary: I don't know why I see bad reviews for this hotel. We have stayed three different times and have always had great service and clean rooms. I noticed the breakfast has expanded since our last visit. Nice surprise. For those disappointed, years ago continental breakfast consisted of coffee and a donut. (at any hotel, anywhere) Be grateful for the extras offered today.  I don't sleep well in hotel beds, but was extremely comfortable and slept well this trip. The newly upgraded beds are great!  I do recommend using the ART shuttle service to get to Disneyland, or drive. It's quite a long walk when your feet are tired from walking all day in the park.  I think Comfort Inn Maingate is a great value.  I would highly recommend this hotel to a friend.
Manager Response: It is great to see the return customers to share their experiences, in some different times, to the public. For the breakfast, we are doing exact and even beyond the Choice Hotels requirements. I appreciate you understand our efforts. For your information, we are on the process to prepare adding some “hot breakfast meats” and yogurt on mid of this year even it will cost us more. I agree that ART shuttle is the best way to commute from our property to Disneyland Resort. It will be a little bit tough to walk back to our property after playing the long day in Disneyland, needless to said it is even tougher for a child to walk back. Your comments are greatly appreciated. We are looking forward to seeing you again in the near future.

Summary Heading: There is nothing to complain about! It's very excellent!
Summary: I had arrived in California exhausted and was originally reserved to stay at Eden Roc Inn & suites (which is disgusting and I don't recommend to anyone), my family and I went looking everywhere for 2 hours at 1am and finally found this wonderful, clean, convenient, and safe hotel! Anyone needing a great place for kids this is it! Their breakfast, staff, and rooms are absolutely wonderful and helpful!! I got assisted greatly by Araceli!! BIG THUMBS UP!!
Manager Response: I feel very exciting to see our guests have a wonderful and enjoyable experience in staying with us. Your fully satisfactions for the services we provided has encouraged us the most.  Our kid’s suite is specially designed for the family with kids to stay over. There are one TV in the main room and a second TV on the kid’s room. With this feature, parents don’t need to fight with kids for the different TV programs and kids can even play their own video games themselves. Kids also have their own bunk beds to sleep and not disturb to their parents. We know for fact that this type of kid’s suite rooms is really good for the family with kids.   Thanks for sharing your comments with us.

Summary: We arrived an hour prior to check in time and the lady behind the counter was very nice and checked us in with the option on being on the 2nd or 1st floor, I had booked this hotel 7 months prior to us arriving and had been following the comments on here like clockwork, and I have to say I am very impressed with the over all experiance, very friendly staff, Clean rooms and comfort, the remote to the tv in the main room didnt work and the handle to the door that connects the two rooms was loose but we told the front desk and they had it fixed by the time we came back to the hotel that night!. We spent 5 nights in a two bedroom two bath room, wich was perfect for the 5 of us (my husband,myself and our three daughters all under the age of 8). Every day after spending the day at
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: If I told you the truth, they'd delete this review
Summary: I've already written one review of this hotel from this trip, and it was removed without explanation.  The staff made several mistakes including checking us into a flooded room, not cleaning our room, and not coding our keys for our entire stay.  Each time we spoke to the front office, they either acted indifferent or implied the problems were our fault.  We ended up getting bed bug bites the final night after complaining our room hadn't been cleaned by 4:30 p.m.  I've never had more problems at a hotel.  The staff was more interested in doing their nails then checking us out our final day.  Economy aside, spend a little more on a place that's actually glad you're there.
Manager Response: First all, nobody can remove and/or delete any reviewer’s comments from Trip Advisor’s review board except Trip Advisor’s own staffs. After I reviewed your comments, I responded your review and posted it on 8/18/10. After reviewed my response by the Trip Advisor’s staffs, they decided to remove your review from their review board. They did not notify either you or myself since this is their sole decision. I did not know this fact until I saw your re-posted review again. Please understand that we are unable to remove your review away from our Trip Advisor review board.  Since your original review has been removed, I herein generally describe your comments (since I don’t have a copy for your review) and also provide my reply as following:  1.	YOUR COMMENT: When you checked-in, we gave you a room flooded with water, then re-assign you to a different room. However, our housekeeping carts were always blocking the walking path you need to walk out. –-- The first room we assigned to you is clean and vacant the night before you checked in. That’s why our system showed that room is vacant and ready for rent. However, there is a plumbing issue happened on the guestroom next to yours on the same morning you checked-in, that’s why we are fixing the problems when you checked-in and have to re-assign a new room (Room #137) to your family. I appreciate your understanding and cooperation. I understand that the route passing our laundry room is the shortest route from Room #137 to our front lobby. However, there are two more different routes you can take to come out from Room #137 to the parking lot. Our housekeeping carts do occupy partial hallway to do their job and clean the rooms. But their working hours are between 9:00AM to 6:00PM. There should be no hassle at all to go to your room.  2.	YOUR COMMENT: Your family went back to your room on the second day 2:30PM and 4:15PM on the third day to try to take a nap and your room was not cleaned yet. --- Your family checked-in on 8/7/10 and checked-out on 8/10/10. We had (52) rooms checked-out and (49) rooms needed to check-in on 8/8/10; and we have (48) rooms checked-out and (48) rooms needed to check-in on 8/9/10. Our policy is during the busy season, unless guests placed a request to clean their room at or before the certain time, I always want our housekeepers to clean those rooms checked-out already first to make those rooms ready to check-in the arrival guests before 3:00PM. Then, they can start to clean up those rooms stay-over. During the slow season, we will clean up the rooms stayed-over first since we have lots rooms still available thru the last night, which are available to check-in the arrival guests. My housekeepers’ working hour is 9:00AM to 6:00PM. Usually, we don’t have too many issues to do this way since most of guests once went to Disneyland are not coming back until late evening. Our housekeepers did not intend to clean your room late due to any other particular reason.  3.	YOUR COMMENT: Your wife came to front desk on the third day afternoon 4:15PM to complain your room has not been cleaned yet. And the staff showed a shocking face and said there is no special request has been made. You believe this should be a standard requirement and don’t know why you need to make request. –-- Actually, I am the person at the front desk having a “shocked” face to answer your wife. Since she told me that there is no housekeeping service in your room on the day before and you did not put the “Do Not Disturb” sign in front of your door, that’s why I got shock because my housekeeping team shouldn’t miss a room not being cleaned. I called my housekeeper supervisor to the front desk immediately to try to find out why your room was not clean the day before. In the meantime, your wife said that your kids need to take a nap before you all head back to Disneyland again, I offered her two options to either having my housekeeper go to clean the room right away which will take about 40 minutes, or your family go ahead to take a nap and I will ensure my housekeeper stay overtime to clean your room after your family head back to Disneyland. After she called you and discussed over the phone, you decide to stay over the pool area and want us to clean the room immediately, which we did. After my housekeeper supervisor checked her book, she confirmed with me that your room had been cleaned the day before. I thought your wife might be too angry, and then she tried to state more serious to catch our attention. Since your wife already left our front desk, I did not go after this issue any further. Your original review title states that “Incompetent staff who make excuses instead of solutions”. Those two options I offered are pretty much the only choices I can come out. I wonder whether you have a better suggestion for this situation. If you do have one, please provide to me to help me to improve ourselves.   4.	YOUR COMMENT: You believe clean it should be a standard requirement and don’t know why you need to make request. --- Clean your room is one our regular services. But have to finish to cleaning your room before 4:15PM is not. I tried to explain to your wife is our housekeepers are working from 9:00 AM to 6:00PM. Their jobs are to finish cleaning all the rooms before they go home.  If we know in advance that your family will come back on the certain period of time, our housekeeper can schedule amount their own works to make it ready for your family. Without know that, they just randomly schedule their own works which may not fit in your demand.  5.	YOUR COMMENT: After housekeeping finished cleaning your room on the third day, you start to afraid that housekeeper were too upset and suspect that they may drunk your toothbrush in the toilet or do something to your towel. --- Be honestly, your family came back and found the room is not ready at the middle of the day is not the first time happened to us. My housekeepers were used to deal with this situation already. This request will not upset them. In every morning, every housekeeper was assigned a list of rooms to clean during that day. For this case, all we did was calling them to clean your room first. We will not blame them since they basically did not do anything wrong. I don’t understand why you and your wife have that kind of ideas that the housekeeper will do something terrible to you.  6.	YOUR COMMENT: Your family got the bed bug bites. ---- Regarding the bug bites, once I read your comments, I immediately called our pest control company, Isotech Pest Management, Inc. to send a technician to check your room (Room #137) on 08/16/10. Isotech is one of the leading company in the pest control industry. I have a written report from Isotech, after they finished the inspection, states that “Inspect Room #137. Customer complain (Bitten). No bed bugs or infestation of any pests were physically found at this room”. I will mail you a copy of this inspection report. In according to that specialist’s comments, there are so many different pests existed in the outdoor areas will cause you been bitted, such as walk to Disneyland, take a ride, sit close to a landscape area, …. and etc. If he can not find anything inside my room, it most likely your family was not bitted in my room.  7.	YOUR COMMENT: You don’t believe that our mattress is recently replaced and found deep peaks and valleys. --- In our website, we clearly state that we replaced all mattresses on the end of 2007. We are no intention to try to fool anybody. I personally went to check the mattress in Room #137 and won’t able to find the “deep peaks and valleys”.  Again, your business and comments are sincerely appreciated. I hope the above reply can earn your understanding and forgiveness. We are looking forward to receiving your suggestions to help us become better and hope we have another opportunity to serve you and your family again.

Summary Heading: Dont be scared by appearance - great stay
Summary: Our stay can be summed up as follows - 92 per night for a two bedroom, two bathroom hotel room, free parking, free internet and free breakfast.  I admit, we were a little sceeved out at appearance from outside - however, check in staff was great, very helpful.  We were on the second floor, facing the back of the hotel - room was super hot when we checked in - issue in that no AC  unit in back bedroom, only one in main room, and noisy little van to vent AC into back room - kids didnt seem to mind noise, but they were shot from day and probably could have slept through a fireworks show.  the room itself was relatively clean, carpet could probably use a nice cleaning, but bathrooms were nice enough, bunkbeds were sturdy, etc.  breakfast was nice, simple and basic but free, enough
Manager Response: We do appreciate your business and comments for our property.  We are glad to learn that you and your family have a great experience to stay with us. I also have to admire that our appearance from outside is not as modern as some other hotels. Unfortunately, during this economic down turn period, to redesign and remodel our building’s exterior to make it look nice is not applicable now since everybody’s cash flow is getting tight.  However, we really try very hard to keep our interior clean and comfortable as our name states. Regarding the carpet, we are working on this issue progressively.  Again, thanks for your business and comments. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family.

Summary: ok just got back from out trip to disneyland then through san francisco now back home. i have to say we didnt have any problems with this hotel at all. we loved it. i was hesistant coz of all the bad reviews and i really didnt want my family of 10 to think oh no what did mom get us into...but it was great...check in was easy, rooms were clean,,i even made my son and husband show me their socks lol..so much space with the extra room and bathroom..food was great especially since we knew we would be eating lunch and dinner at disneyland...saved us time and $ big time..we didnt bother riding the shuttle just walked and it wasnt bad at all..we would definitely stay here again...cant wait already to come back........note: was disappointed with our second hotel in san
Manager Response: none

Summary: This trip was planned last min when me and my bf found a cheap ticket to LA.  We have struggled with finding the right hotel because we are a pair of young and budgeted traveler trying to find the best deal.  I've checked so many hotels; but either the ones that met our budget was just dirty (with nasty comments from other travellers) or the higher end hotels were too expensive.  We then finally found Comfort inn Maingate and we were so glad that we chose this hotel!  We really enjoyed our stay here and I think we should be fair to this hotel...yes..it's not brand new...but for an average of 70 dollars/night..it definitely exceeded our expectation!  The manager is very attentive..and it seems like he stays at the hotel 24/7..our aircon stopped working at 1am and he was actually
Manager Response: It is glad to learn that you and your boy friend had an enjoyable experience to stay with us.  Our mission is to provide a clean and comfortable room, a friendly and responsive service, and a reasonable rate to ensure all our guests to have a blast vacation. We are always running several different promotions to fit all different needs and those promotions are changed frequently based on each different season. Call us to get the clearly clarification for all the promotions prior to booking your room is highly recommended.  We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your boy friend in the near future again.

Summary Heading: 1 bedroom suites a real hit with the family!
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights for it's proximity to Disneyland and the fact that it offers free breakfast and one bedroom suites with bunk beds.  We enjoyed our stay here apart from a couple of smaller details:  The Pros * Separate bedroom is awesome for everyone who gets their own bed.  Bunk beds and their own TV was fab.  We loved this most of all. It's a no frills hotel but not having to share beds with the kids (or each other for that matter - 2 queens in the room also!) made a huge difference to how rested were were for the next day. * Staff here is EXCELLENT.  They are very helpful and pleasant/professional.  The lady that keeps the breakfast area stocked is amazing.  How one person can do it all is amazing.  But everyone, including the housekeeping staff was great.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Only slightly preferable to sleeping in the car.
Summary: To start off, the staff, from the people in the registration office to the manager to the maintenance people are the rudest I've ever encountered in a so-called nice hotel.  Hidden charges, nickel and dime you to death, disgusting rooms, terrible air conditioning, worst showers I've ever encountered in any hotel, all for $100 a night.  What a deal.  Had a day at Disneyland, came back to the room for some R & R for a little while before going back and the room had still not been made up at 5:00!  Went and complained and was told the housekeepers were on break.  Had called ahead of time and was told they provided a free shuttle to the parks.  Nope.  Was cheaper to drive to Disneyland and park there.  That's a sad statement.  I would NEVER EVER stay here again and couldn't sleep at
Manager Response: I think you just have too many emotionally reactions for this review.   Since you and your family booked two connecting rooms which have a connecting door in between, we did reserve a pair connecting rooms for you and your family. Our check-out time is before 11:00AM and check-in time is after 3:00PM, which you can find this information on our website and/or any internet travel agency’s website. However, you and your family came to check-in on 12:53PM and expected we should have a pair of connecting rooms ready for you.  My front desk told you that the connecting room we hold for you and your family are not ready yet. But you were not happy at all and even raised the voice to her. I personally came out and explained to you that either I can have two housekeepers start to clean those two rooms immediately which can be ready within 30 minutes, or we can arrange two rooms side-by-side but not connecting rooms. You finally decided not to wait and take two side-by-side rooms.   Then you also complained that you being told we have FREE shuttle to Disneyland Resorts and you ends up need to purchase Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) shuttle passes from us. You called it was a hidden cost for us. I explained you immediately that since you booked your room thru your own preferred travel agent, they should always sell you the deal based on our website information. There is no statement such as ”Free Shuttle” or ”Complimentary Shuttle” in our website. I don’t know how they refer you that incorrect information, so I can not speak for them and I am not able to compensate those ART passes to you.  I even told you that there is a Disneyland remote visitor parking lot located within 8 minutes walking distance from our hotel. You can walk to there and there is Disneyland’s FREE shuttle can take you to their entry main gate. However, you refuse it anyway. Matter of fact, since City of Anaheim established ART shuttle service to take all visitors from all hotels to Disneyland, City of Anaheim does not allow any more private shuttle to drive into Disneyland, unless those hotels already have their own shuttle services running or the hotels located in City of Garden Grove, not Anaheim.   Regarding your room are not ready at 5:00PM, it is an un-intentionally error caused by us. Unless the guests particularly request us to clean their rooms at a certain period of time, once our housekeepers get the room cleaning lists, each of them just randomly schedule their own order to clean the rooms. In our peak season, our housekeepers will first clean the rooms been checked-out, so we can have rooms ready for the guests check-in on 3:00PM. Then they will start to clean the rooms which guests stay over. Usually, our guests go to Disneyland will not come back until the late evening. Unfortunely we did not know you will come back. Our housekeepers usually finish their works around 6:00PM. Your room must be the last few rooms need to be cleaned on that particular date. All the inconvenience we caused to you and your family are un-intentionally. I herein sincerely apologize to you.  We are regret that you are so upset. Hope my sincerely apology can easy your madness a little bit. No matter what, I do still appreciate your business.

Summary Heading: Needs improvement, there are better places for not much more cash.
Summary: Having stayed in this property for 4 nights this July it's fair to say I won't be recommending it to friends. I personally am an experienced traveler while my family are very inexperienced, yet all of us agreed that this hotel needs considerable improvement.  Firstly, noise. The walls between rooms are painfully thin and there appears to be little if any sound deadening between the upper and lower floors. The net result is that any noise from above sounds like a heard of elephants while you can quite literally hear every sound from the neighboring room (in our case it was so loud as to waken both children during the night). Add to this the perpetual noise from the car park (have the heard of double glazing?) and this is far from the most restful of motels in which to spend the
Manager Response: First all, I have to thanks you spent your valuable time to write this comments to express your concerns. I sincerely appreciate your efforts.  This is not the first time I learn that the guests were awaken the entire night due to the other guests stayed in the upper stair and/or their next room made too much noise. We have lots of families with kids or school groups to stay with us and visit Disneyland. Most of time, everybody spent a whole day in Disneyland can exhaust themselves out pretty much, and then everybody will take a deep sleep. However, we are not lucky all the time. Sometimes, they came back to their rooms after midnight and kids/students were still hyper and continuously playing or running around. They can waken the guests stayed next to them. If this case happens, our front desk staff needs to call to their parents or teachers, sometimes up to 5~6 times, to seek their help to calm down their students or kids. Dual glazing windows may be one of the best options to resolve the noise from parking lot, but I need to consult with some experts to find out the best way to decrease the noise from the neighbor and/or upstairs.  Our maintenance department does have a Prevention Maintenance Program. I wonder why our maintenance staffs did not pick up those problems in your room. I also check our records that you did not place any complain regarding your room conditions. I regret that we missed the opportunity to fix the room for you. However, that is still no reason for us not able to find those problems prior to your arriving. I will get together with my chief engineer to inspect the room you stayed. I want to make it right.  Our breakfast outside seating areas is all covered, not a totally outdoor environmental area. For the weather we have in the Southern California, it usually works pretty well for our guests. Unfortunely, you experienced an unseasonably cold and drizzly morning. For our property’s size, our franchise requires we have total (27) seats to serve the breakfast. Even we already have 24 indoor seats plus 40 outside seats in our breakfast area, we still have not enough rooms quite often. Sometimes, I wonder myself that I should be happy or should be worry.  I sincerely apology all the inconvenience we caused you not having an enjoyable experience with us. Hope our sincerely apology can earn your understanding and forgiveness.

Summary Heading: Seemed just fine at first... until we saw the bottom of my 14 month olds feet!
Summary: The check in was quick and easy. parking was fine, room was stuffy, but wall a/c worked well.  Room appeared "clean".  However, the carpet was disgustingly filthy, not that you could tell though.  My 14 month old was on the floor barefoot for maybe five minutes, then my sister noticed his feet were BLACK.  Are you kidding me?!  Try keeping a 14 month old and a 3 yr old ON THE BEDS... sigh, made for a rough night.  I also took just a few steps and then walaaah, filthy socks.  It was gross and I aciually put the comforter on the floor.  Breakfast the next morning was quick and easy, as was check out.  5 minute drive to the Disney parking lot.
Manager Response: First all, I do appreciate your business and comments. “Dirty Carpet” is the toughest problem I am facing now. We have washed all our rooms’ carpets before the early of June and made them ready to welcome all our guests during this summer time since we know that we won’t have time to put 5 ~ 10 rooms out of order for two days and wash their carpet. However, our carpet is getting dirty pretty quick. I believe that our guests carry the dirt and grease from our parking lot into the rooms which cause the carpet getting dirty. I am planning to take two actions to try preventing this condition happens: 1.	I am currently looking for an asphalt subcontractor to re-surface and re-stripe the entire parking lot. Hope the sealed topping can help to reduce the loose dirt and grease caught by the guests’ shoes. Due to this work need to close out our parking lot in sections for a week. We plan to have this work done in our slow season, such as September. 2.	  Add some carpets at the hallway entrances. These carpets should be able to catch some loose dirt and grease from the guests’ shoes. We will see the results after these two actions done. Hope the “Dirty Carpet” issue can be resolved after that time. Again, your comments are greatly appreciated. Wish you can visit us again to check how the improvement comes out.

Summary: We spent six nights at this hotel during a Disneyland visit.  We had the 2 bedroom, 1 bath suite for three adults and two children and it was great to have the extra space.  My children (ages 6 and 3) were thrilled to have their own room and TV and that was nice for us too.  The extra room was larger than I expected.  There was adequate space for my 3-year-old to sleep in a sleeping bag on the floor since he has a hard time staying in a bed, and there was still space for the kids' suitcases.  The main room was fairly standard for a motel.  I thought that our room was clean and well maintained.  It needed a couple of minor repairs during our stay (such as a remote not working) and those were taken care of the same day I reported them to the front desk.  We could occasionally hear
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good place for families going to Disneyland
Summary: Just returned from a 6 day stay at this hotel and had a great time.  The rooms are perfect for families looking for a place to sleep during their stay at Disneyland.  We had a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom kid suite and it was the perfect size for us (2 adults and kids aged 10, 7, 7, and 4).  Our kids loved the breakfast each morning, and if you want extra snacks there is a grocery store on Katella about 1.5 miles away to the west.   There is a small in room refrigerator that we loaded with drinks and fruit which we then packed to the park.  There is also an in-room microwave which was nice to have.    Our rooms were well maintained and clean, and the staff was helpful with whatever we needed.  We take the approach that when we are going to Disneyland we want a comfortable place to crash
Manager Response: none

Summary: clean rooms respectful employes and management  very curtsey  always making sure your needs are meet  to the best of there ability .  tips: pick up ticket for the A.R.T. Bus to go to Disneyland the best way to travel back an forth pick up Disneyland tick form hotel at a discount.  Called hotel direct for better discount on hotel price then internet.
Manager Response: Thanks for your compliments. One thing you pointed out is absolutely correct. We always give a better discount when the guests call us directly to reserve the room and package.  We appreciate your businesses and looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family again.  Wayne

Summary: Our family of 6 recently stayed here and the first thing we noticed when we walked in our room was the smell of mold. We finally figured out that it was coming from the a/c unit. There was also mold in BOTH of the bathroom showers that hadn't been cleaned in quite some time. The seat was broken on our toilet, and was fixed when we told the maid about it, but how is it that the maid NEVER noticed in the first place, BEFORE a guest checked in?!?!!?? We only had maid service 3 times during our 7 day stay there, and I was wondering of the sheets had even been changed out, or if the beds had just been made.
