The refrigerator froze everything and there was no way to change the temperature. It was pointless to even have the thing.The breakfast was fine, but if you go....GO EARLY! They
Manager Response: We appreciate that you spent your time to share with us your concerns for our property.  We apologize all the inconveniences you have experienced in our place. We usually will clean all the A/C units every year after spring break over to the early June to prepare for the summer. However, no matter how our schedule is, it is not acceptable to have the smell of mold. I already address this issue with my maintenance crew and housekeepers. The housekeepers should immediately report these problems, such as mold, broken toilet seat, etc. It Is no reason for us not taking care those before the customers arrive. It is our bad. There is no record for any complain that the refrigerator froze everything before you checked out. After you complained during your checked-out, we went to check it and found no problem with that refrigerator. Unfortunately, we are not able to prove to you since you already left. Due to we are participating the environmental friendly program to be a “Green” loading property, for the guests like you stay a longer period, we change the towels and pillow cases everyday and change the bed sheets every other day UNLESS the guests hang the towels on tower rack or put environmental friendly announce card on the top of the beds.  For the breakfast area, we understand that our breakfast room is not big enough. That’s why we add those outdoor covered seats to accommodate our guests. Based on our property’s size, our franchise only requests us to have (27) seats for our breakfast, however, we overall provide (64) seats to serve our breakfast. Please understand that we do try our best to improve this situation. Regarding the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) shuttle does not run every twenty minutes as shown on their weekly published schedule, I already forward your comments to them. I believe they need to hear this from you as well. Actually, we lost around $1,600 every month to sell ART passes in our front desk. The main reason for us to still do so is we try to provide a courtesy service to our guests. I don’t think this is our fault for the ART shuttle runs late. Again, I do appreciate your comments which provide us a opportunity to improve ourselves. Thanks for your business. We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family.

Summary: This is the second time I have stayed at this location and it won't be the last.  Both times I have stayed here the customer service has been excellent.  The rooms were cleaned nicely and the breakfast was great.   I didn't care much for the bed, but my husband thought it was great.   This is an excellent place to stay and the value is amazing.  Thanks Comfort Inn Maingate... we will be seeing you again soon! :)
Manager Response: It is exciting to learn that our hard-working efforts did earn your repeat businesses. I always educate my staffs that earn a repeated customer is better than to earn 5 new customers. It does not mean that earn a new business is not important, it means to earn a repeat business is much more important since they not only have loyalty to give us more business, but they most of time will recommend us to their friends. Thanks again. Regarding your husband like our mattress, I am not surprise at all, since almost all of our mattresses are pillow-top Euro style mattresses. I wish all our guests will enjoy and have a great experience to stay with us. Wayne

Summary: our rooms were nice and clean, staff was real helpful when needed  the pool was nice and heated. we booked 5 rooms and were all next to eachother we liked that  our bed were comortable love the pillows. we all were very happy no problems what so ever we would all stay thier again. breakfast was ok. but overall everthing was nice and pleasent
Manager Response: It is glad to learn that you have a great experience to stay with our property.   “Comfortable” - Our name says it, and your comments prove it.  We are looking forward to have another opportunity to serve you when you visit Disneyland again.

Summary Heading: Great room for a family with young kids..
Summary: We have stayed at the Comfort inn maingate,  many times in 2008 and 2009. This is the hotel of our choice, everytime we visit Disneyland. We have annual passes and live in norhtern Ca. The rooms are great. the big room for the adults and the kids room with bunks and table and tv for the little ones. The kids love having their "own "room. So far, every experience we have had, has been great. The breakfast was light, however, it was enough to fill us up before leaving for the park.So far so good. We are going again and getting are annual passes this month. We are looking forward to our trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked this hotel through another website. Got the package for a reasonable price however if I could do it all again I would pay a little more and pick my hotel. We were traveling with a large group and booked two, two bedroom, two bathroom rooms. Day one the plumbing was shot... We understood this was not the hotels fault and were fine with switching rooms... However they did not have any more of those rooms so we got a down graded room with no microwave, smaller tv's and overall smaller rooms. All the hotel had to say was sorry and were relatively inconsiderate about the whole situation. Then the next day they had a screw up in their system and our key cards would not work. Apparently someone had put in the system that we were supposed to check out and now we were locked out
Manager Response: First all, I do sincerely appreciate your comments. There was an area main sewer line clogged on the New Year day. We have no other choice and have to relocate your family from a kid suite room to two connecting rooms. Thanks for your understandings and cooperation to agree to relocate your room. These connecting rooms are standard two queen size beds room. They all have refrigerators but no microwave ovens and big screen flat TV. Under our records, we did move the microwave oven from your existing room to Room #203, which is one of the rooms you move in. However, I did not see the record that we move the 32” flat TV to replace the 27” standard TV for you. This is our fault. Even you may not place any complain during that time, we should automatically change it for you, since the TV sit over the room you moved out is no use anyway. I will make this rule as our future standard practice. Again, thanks for your comments.  Regarding your room have not been cleaned, I have to do the following explanation. Under our housekeeping daily records, there are total 9 rooms posted “Do Not Disturb” sign outside their doors and requested no services on 01/02/2010. Your Room #203 & #204 are two of these nine rooms. No matter under any circumstance, our housekeepers all being trained not to go into the rooms with “Do Not Disturb” signs on. Your rooms not being cleaned is resulted from the “DND” sign on the outside doors.  Regarding the reason you supported to check out on 01/02/2010, the original reservation for all your group thru another travel agent website is for three (3) rooms total from 01/02/2010 to 01/05/2010. However, your family decided to come earlier, so you booked one room thru our franchise central reservation system from 12/30/2009 to 01/02/2010. Since these two reservations are thru two different channels and the ways we bill are different, one we need to bill you directly, and we need to bill the travel agent for the other reservation. So, in our computer system, we have to check you out and re-check you in immediately to the same room. That’s why we need to reactive your room key. However, this is not the reason we did not clean your rooms. My front desk staffs replied you the wrong information. If the guest supported to check out but forget the date or they decide to extend their stay but fail to notify our front desk, our housekeepers will still clean the room and leave all guests’ stuffs in the room and wait for them come back. Since they supported should check out, their room key will be expired and they have to come to front desk to seek assistant for either reactive their key for a late check out or complete their paperwork to extend their stay. The front desk staff replied you incorrectly apparently need more on-site training. I herein apologize that this lack-of –training manner.   Hope the above explanation can earn your understanding and forgiveness. Wish we still have an opportunity to serve you and your family again.

Summary Heading: Best Value for Your Dollar AND Your Family!
Summary: We stay at this hotel every time we visit Disneyland; usually at least two times per year.  The rooms are GREAT! They have suites with two queen beds and then a separate room with bunk beds and another TV for the kids!  Some of them even have a separate bathroom for each room!  The breakfast is always good; the staff always pleasant.  The rooms are very comfortable and are truly a great value.  And you can't beat the fact that it's only one mile from Disneyland.  I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel, anytime, any day!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in the 2 bdrm, 2 bath "suite" for 4 nights. Our room was in the back of the hotel, bordering a side street, and was very quiet. The first night, we experienced some difficulty with the toilet flushing in the master bath. The front desk sent someone right away to plunge it, it looked promising, but it still didn't flush properly. The next day, they moved us to the room next to that one, and everything was perfect. The breakfast is a bit on the light side, especially if you're really not much of a waffle person. However, our room had a microwave and a refrigerator, which we knew prior to going, and took our own meals with us. Considering a meal for a family of 4 can cost $50 in Disneyland, we found it to be more cost-effective to make our own breakfast before going.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were pleased with our room. It was very clean and had just what we were told would be in the room. Microwave,fridge, and flat screen TV. The kids room had a bunk bed and TV also. It was nice having 2 bathrooms when you travel with 6 peolple, saves time getting ready in morning. Staff very friendly  and helpful. Breakfast was a quick one. They have waffles you prepare yourself, cold cereals,toast,bagels,juices. I would stay there again, it was good for the money spent.
Manager Response: none

Summary: we stayed at this hotel for 9 nights and have had a great experience.  we live in hawaii and have stayed at a few hotels here, and haven't had as great an experience as some of the waikiki 4 star hotels.    we checked in at about 1130 pm, and were given a room on the backside of the hotel, which we LOVED!!!  still a short walk from the parking, and less foot traffic.  no headlights shining into our room as cars parked, no noise from late nighters, and safer for my kids.  it may be a layout plan thing, but our hotel room had an a/c in each of the rooms.  some people said that their room had an a/c in the main room and a fan for the smaller room.  our room was a 1 bathroom room, which worked out well for us.  we had a total of 3 adults, 3 kids, and 1 toddler.    the breakfast
Manager Response: none

Summary: We checked  into the Comfort Inn after not being happy at another hotel. The staff were very helpful and the rooms are made up every day. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms clean. Breakfast free in the morning was a bonus. The pool and spa were nice, the spa was a little over chlorinated  but probably to keep it clean with so many people using it. The parking lot can get a little busy if the hotel is fully booked and you return late to the hotel. The hotel is a 15-20 min walk from Disney but straight along Harbor Blvd so easy. We stayed in kids suite and the extra bedroom with 2nd TV was great. The walls are a little thin so if you have noisy people next you it can be a little noisy.  The ART shuttle was a little unreliable in the morning it was never there at the
Manager Response: Provide a comfortable and clean rooms and provide a good customer services are the goals we try to fulfill everyday. I am glad we had this opportunity to serving you and your family.  Regarding the parking spaces issue, our property has 95 parking spaces available which is far more than the average motels around Disneyland. Since there are so many tourists fly into Anaheim in lieu of driving, the Motel/Hotel’s parking spaces requirement in Anaheim is 75% of the number of guestrooms.  We are over 87% parking ratio. We have lots of parking spaces located on the south of our building, not inside of courtyard, which few guests park over there. That’s the reason you felt the parking lot is full.  Regarding the ART is not reliable; you are not the only guest felt that way. I already forward your comments to the ART office. Hope they can manage this shuttle services better.  Again, I am glad to learn that you came all the way from Australia and did have a wonderful experience for this trip to Disneyland.

Summary: We stayed here when we visited Disneyland.  I was looking for a hotel with breakfast that was nice and clean but not super expensive.  I think this one fit the bill just right.  The rooms seemed clean and the breakfast included waffles and fresh fruit.  The only thing I wouldn't recommend is the pool.  My skin was green after we spent an hour in the pool.  It washed off in the shower but disturbing just the same.  All in all, if the price was right, I would stay again.
Manager Response: On the behalf of all Comfort Inn Staffs, we will be more than happy to having another opportunity to serve you and your family again.  Regarding the pool issue, due to the pool inside face was painted with an epoxy coating before, after reacted with pool cleaning chemical, it always produce kind of chalky powders which will cause the filter become too dirty and it automatically shut off the recycling pump. We will not find out our pumps has shut off unless either my pool man come to do the regular services or the water turn green. Unfortunately, the second way happens much more often than the first way.  After consulted with a pool specialist, we decided to close our pool for one week and remove all the existing epoxy coating off and leave the original white plaster finishes exposed. This is a really tough job to remove those paints off. I have to give a credit to my hardworking maintenance crews. All three of them worked for the entire week and used more than 30 sanding wheels to complete this work. The pool already re-opened on the Thanksgiving day. In additions, my maintenance crew now will do the water test every morning to ensure the water is in a good condition.  Please come back to check up our pool and spa again. I believe you will like what we did.

Summary Heading: You mean the kids have their own room in a motel?
Summary: Maingate?  Don't be fooled the maingate of Disneyland is not close by.  A short 20 minute well lit walk and you will find yourself at the maingate.  Upon entering the room my first impressions are "this is going to be great."  It was.  I was surprised at how dirty my little boys feet got just waling around on the carpet.  The only other annoying thing was that the tub didn't drain well.  The second bedroom was a blessing.  Many a night have I spent laying in my bed with the lights off at 8 o'clock waiting for the little ones to doze off so I can get up and finish my evening.  Not here.  The room included bunk beds a TV and table and stools just for the kids.  The room itself was nice, including a plasma screen TV, in room refrigerator and microwave.  All in nice working order.
Manager Response: First all, I sincerely appreciate your business and comments.  Maingate: like my previous response for other guests’ comments related with the same manner – We are the third owner own this property since this place being called as “Comfort Inn Maingate”. I have no idea why and how the previous owner got this “Maingate” included in the business’ name. Fooling or misleading any our guests is not our intentions at all. However, I still apologize to you if there is any confusion caused by this “Maingate”.  Dirty Carpet: Again, this is one of my toughest challenges. I currently have my maintenance crew keeping wash the carpet as often as they can. In the meantime, I am still working on a better and long term solution for this issue.   A separate kid’s room, free wireless internet access, free continental breakfast, and a comfortable room with a reasonable price are the goal we maintain and promote our property. We are glad to learn that you like those arrangements. Hope we can earn your repeat businesses.

Summary Heading: Not too bad for the money
Summary: We booked a suite with 2 bedrooms; one with 2 queen beds and one with bunkbeds.  The suite also had two bathrooms, which was great!  Enough room for the 5 of us.  And it was convenient to drive to Disney. There is a shuttle in the city available for $4 per person, which we might use next time.  The rooms are older, but were pretty clean for the most part.  The carpet was old, worn and dirty.  Our feet were dirty after being barefoot in there.  But we were happy that the room came with plenty of towels in both bathrooms.  So many hotels skimp on this and I end up asking for more since there are 5 of us. But we had plenty to go around.  Thanks to the staff for that!   THE AIR CONDITIONING IS TERRIBLE!  My biggest problem was the cooling system. There is a unit in the main room,
Manager Response: I have to admire that keeping the carpet clean is one of my toughest challenges I have. I found that all the room carpets have been complained too dirty by the guests are located on the first floor. I believe that is resulted from the guests walking through the parking lot then brought the dirt into the room and accumulate to be such dirty.  Now we set a schedule to shampoo the first floor carpet once every two month on a regular basis. Hope doing this way can help this situation become better. Actually, this is not my first exterior corridor property; I did not have this type of problem. Since there are so many exterior corridor properties out there, I believe there must a solution for this. I am currently looking into the right solution to fix this situation.  This is the first summer since we purchased this property last year. I truly understand the air condition issue for this type of two-bath kid suite. The only way to solve this issue is adding an A/C unit into the kid’s room. However, it is not an easy fix, especially in this economic environment. I hope I can fix this problem before the next summer comes.  Regarding your late check out request, our front desk staff and housekeeper need to communicate in a better way to prevent making the same mistakes. We now have a Google document set up for our staffs internal share information. This file should document all the rooms’ defect situations and/or additional requests. It helps my staffs communicate better. I believe by doing this way, we should see the improvement.

Summary Heading: All the reviews are subject to an individual opinion
Summary: The reason I say this is that we really checked out the reviews here on trip advisor- I booked the room for price and what the room entails- I got the kid suite w/ the  2 bathrooms. I was happy w/ my room- got an upstairs room, it was clean (even the carpet- wore socks but no dirt on them at the end of the day) the beds were comfortable, 2 bathrooms really helped (3 teens-1 girl).  The front desk was really nice and friendly (even met the owner who was very nice).  The cont. breakfast was the standard - had 2 waffle irons!!- it helped us til lunch time, no complaints at all.  We did not use the pool but it was always in use and very busy at times.  There is a Taco bell accross the street, Dennys walking distance and a gas station very close (and cheapest gas around).  I went
Manager Response: This title is an absolutely fair statement for everybody’s comments. I remember when I first visited the Disneyland Marketing Department; their staffs told me that the most important thing I need to pay attentions is what the guests’ “experiences” are. If anybody gave them a bad experience, no matter is small or big, they are not coming back. That’s why I set up the first and the most important goal to my staffs is providing a properly services to earn the repeated businesses.  I will work with my housekeeper staffs to come out a plan to take care the trash issues you just mentioned.  Thanks for all your comments and compliments. We are looking forward to seeing you visit us again.

Summary Heading: We received absolutely great service at this location!
Summary: We are "picky" about where we stay. Our room was clean. The area was quiet. The entire staff was professional and friendly. Our needs were met with a wonderful attitude. It was obvious that the Management had spent time training the staff on the "finer" points of the hospitality industry. Honestly, we were very pleased. We would definately stay here again.
Manager Response: It is great to know that you and your family have a wonderful experience staying with us. Your compliment and the repeated businesses are the greatest rewards for our hard workings.  All our staffs and I are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you and your family soon.

Summary: We had nothing but a great experience at comfort inn maingate. The room was nice and clean, the breakfast was awesome, and the staff was very helpful and pleasant.  The best park was the value, $60 a night. The walk to Disney was a little too much for us, so we purchased the ART passes from the front desk. We had a great time and will definitely come back again!
Manager Response: It is great to know that you and your family have a wonderful experience staying with us. Provide an overall great value to our guests is our No. 1 goal. All our staffs and I have a warmly reward feeling to earn your compliment.   We are looking forward to having another opportunity to serve you soon.

Summary: I have mixed feelings about this place.I will start off by saying one could not find this price any where in Anaheim, 56.25 a night. That was a special internet deal. When I walked in the room I noticed a cigarrete burn in the bed spread. They can't help it if a guest destroys their property but what they can help is putting the cover back on the bed.  The breakfast was great. First day we went down at 6:10 and their was 2 others beside my family. Next day around 8:00 you could barely move. Get their early to avoid crowds. I like that they have hard boilded eggs and make your own fresh waffles. The breakfast alone saved us over $15 a day. The view from my room ,which is on the back side, was an emty graffitti staIned building. You will hear street noise from that side if you are
Manager Response: I really appreciate your honest comments for our place, either bad or good.  Put a cigarette burn bed spread is not acceptable. I already have my housekeeper supervisor pay more attentions to screen off those damaged linen and towels to avoid using those damaged ones again.  I know our breakfast room is small since most of our guests are families. Even we already have total 40 seats, which Comfort Inn only requests 27 seats for our hotel size, once people come to eat, it is crowded. This is not an easy issue we can fix it overnight. The thing we can do now is letting our guests to take food back to their room to avoid crowds. However, the line waiting to make their own waffles is still there.  I called Anaheim Graffiti Hot Line to have them to clean those graffiti off already. In additions, I really appreciate that you bring up our attention about the scum around the pool tiles. I never know this issue until you pointed out. We already cleaned those scum off. I also have our pool service guy include cleaning the tiles into their scope of work.  I promise that we will continuously improve our property to be a better place to stay. Again, thanks for your valuable comments. Hope you can visit us in the future and check us out again.

Summary: This place is a great place to stay for the price.  It is exactly 1 mile away from Disney and using the ART was quick and easy.  The staff was great in getting us our tickets to the park and the ART.  The breakfast was good....they could use some sugar cereal!  We stayed in a kids room with bunk beds.  Rooms were clean.  Pool and spa were great.    Talk to John or Wayne.  They will give you an excellent deal.  We even got some nights for free!  Thanks John and Wayne for a great trip!  Your friend from WI!
Manager Response: I am glad to know you have an enjoyable experience with this trip and like our room and services. This vacation is earned by your hard-workings. To receive the best value vacation package is what you desired, which is what we continuously try to provide to our value customers.

Summary Heading: Reccomended only if renting a vehicle
Summary: Our stay here was very decent for the price.  Clean rooms & nice breakfast.  Too long of a walk to Disneyland though.  Maybe about 3 or 4 very long blocks.  We rented a minivan with a gps system so we were set.  The hotel also had free parking right in front of our room.  I feel bad for those who chose to walk though.  After 10-12 long hours at Disneyland your feet really hurt.  We had 3 pre-teen girls and a teenage son.  The kids suite was perfect for us.  The girls had their own room with bunk beds, TV & a door.  My husband, myself and my son had the two queen size beds in the main room.  There was a safe in our room that we used daily.  There was a small daily fee for using it though.  There were not any towels in sight at the pool even though there was a sign on the counter
Manager Response: I am glad to learn that most of your comments are positive for us.  Regarding the long walk to Disneyland, I do agree with you that it is tough for kids to walk back to our place after a long day play in Disneyland, even we are only 1 mile away from Disneyland. Luckily, Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) provides shuttle services to take all visitors back and forth from hotels to Disneyland. They only change $4.00 per adult per day and $1.00 per child per day. The pass is a day pass and good for a whole day and the buses run every twenty minutes. Besides this ART shuttle service, drive and park in Disneyland is also a good option, especially with a big family. The parking fee is $12.00 per day which you can in and out as well. Walking to Disneyland is always our last suggestion. It maybe okay for adults, but definitely not for kids.

Summary: We were going to stay at the hotel, but the room smelled so bad, that we left shortly after checking in. It smelled like mold with lots of cleaning agents being used to try to cover it up. The reviews of the hotel seem to be very good or very bad, and I have to agree with the very bad reviewers. It sounds like the manager is doing his best to minimize the damage done by bad reviews, but responding to each. Don't be fooled. This is an old hotel in need of a good cleaning/remodeling.
Manager Response: First all, I don’t have the intention to fool anybody. If you don’t like our rooms, that is totally your subjective feeling and nobody can force you to change your mind. The reason I posted my response is that I just want every other Trip Advisor’s viewers hear the story from both sides.  I checked with our record, the last time we washed carpet for this room #108 is March 12, 2009 and re-opened for business on March 13, 2009. From that re-opened date till you checked in is totally 86 days. There are total 29 families have occupied this room for total 78 days. There is no single complain at all. After your husband left the front desk, I called my housekeeping manager and went together to check the room immediately and did not feel anything wrong. But, since you already complained, we still went ahead to wash the carpet again because that is the only thing can make the room’s smell different.  I herein have a statement regarding our room conditions as well. The previous owner replaced all the rooms’ carpets, mattresses, headboards, activity tables and chairs, lounge chairs, picture frames, nightstands and convenience center with drawers started from the late 2007 and finished on the early 2008 before they sold this property to us. I don’t know what else I should do to “remodel” the room in order to meet your expectations.  No matter it is good or bad, your comments are always valuable to us. I am regret that I didn’t have chance to discuss your comments with you face to face. I am eager to hear any suggestions to make this property better and more comfortable for all of our guests.

Summary Heading: Roaches and condoms found in room!!!!!
Summary: We booked a trip to Disneyland from April 29th thru May 2nd....so we had a three nights stay.  Comfort Inn seemed to of had the best rates for a family of 6. The online photo's showed very clean rooms. That was not the case!!! The floors were and the comforters were stained. And, like the other person left in the review, our feet got dirty just walking around the motel room. The first morning that we woke up, I went to make a cup of coffee, and stuck to the coffee cup was a set of false eyelashes. So I decided to skip my morning cup of coffee! I did not want to let it get to me becuase we were on our way out the door for our first trip ever to Disneyland. The last morning there, when I got out of the shower, I found a roach crawling up the wall right near my luggage! At this
Manager Response: First all, I am totally shocked when I saw your comments. Matter of the fact, we contacted with Travelocity right after you checked out and told them that we are not charging you the last day’s rent and they need to refund you. Actually, we got the phone call from Travelocity on the same day to confirm this refund has been done. I called them after I saw your comments, they told me that neither our original request them to refund your rent nor you called and requested them contact and verify with us for the refund is shown on their file. Since your customer folio did show all this refund information, any our front desk agents can open your folio and confirm this issue. I don’t understand why Travelocity has to talk me directly. I am not at hotel 24/7, that’s why I did not receive the phone call from Travelocity. Actually, I did not even receive the voice message from Travelocity on my answer machine. I have requested Travelocity to find out what the problem is and how we can prevent this thing happen again. I appreciate your understanding when I called you directly to explain this problem. Hope our sincerely apologies can earn your forgiveness. I regret that you did not call us directly to bring us attention that you did not receive the refund on a timely manner. Otherwise, we can fix this issue right away. As I mentioned to you over the phone, the Travelocity will issue a refund to you within a few day.  To prevent this type of thing happen again, I have my guest service agents to always make a follow up call to the guests like you to ensure the issue has been taken care. We can not “ASSUME” everything is okay like we expected.  We have our pest control technician, Isotech, came to check the room you stayed on May 4th. Isotech is one of the leaders in the pest control/management industry. The technician checked throughout the room and could not find the evidence that roaches hutch there. They believe that other guests stayed that room before you may bring it in. They end up did the treatment in that room and have us continuously do the way we always did to maintain the cleanness, then we will be fine.  Since our room come with mattress skirts on every beds, we usually did not find any trashes underneath the bed. That causes my housekeepers overlooked this area. During our regular monthly staff training meeting, I have emphasized them to watch the areas underneath the beds to avoid this same type of mistake.

Summary: I planned our families vacation to Disneyland for our daughters 3rd birthday. Originally I had made reservations at the Anabella but decided to go with the Comfort Inn at Maingate because it was $300.00 cheaper, had good reviews and had two rooms one with bunkbeds for my sister and our 13 yeard old son. The outside of the hotel is nice, well kept and appealing, however when we walked into our room there was an awful smell. It smelt like a combination of ammonia, pinesol and mold! We thought if we turned the air up and opened the windows it would dissapate. We went to downtown disney and were gone for about four hours to return to the same awful smell. My son and my sisters allergies were going crazy, sneezing, itchy eyes and all of us were coughing. It was 11 o'clock p.m. when I
Manager Response: I apologize that our room conditions did not meet your expectations. I have called for a meeting with Ecolab’s area manager to go over both problems you experienced in our place. Ecolab is the global leader in cleaning, sanitizing, food safety and infection prevention products and services. They supply us all types of cleaning products, including air fresher and carpet shampoo.  They state that our housekeepers may overspray some cleaning agents and/or air fresher. There are total four types cleaning agents need to be used to clean a room in different area. Any overspray can always leave the room smell stronger. If it happens that the customers have allergy in such smell, it will cause the situation your sister and your son experienced. I even held a 30 minutes training class to have Ecolab show all my housekeepers the correct procedures to properly use those different cleaning agents.  For the carpet cleanness issue, Ecolab told me that even we already did carpet deep clean more often than other hotels, since we did not neutralize the carpet, the carpet will attract the dirt much more than usual. That is the reason why my carpet can get dirty so easy. I already purchased the Non-Browning shampoo and on the process to neutralize all the room carpets now.  I am appreciate that you spend your time to write this comments to bring my attentions. Hope you can re-visit us next time and find out the improvement and difference we have made.

Summary: The hotel manager, John is commendable in making our stay wonderful.  He made certain that from our check-in to the check-out, we were pleased with the caring and kindness of his staff.  The rooms were very clean and we felt safe because the door did not open right up to the parking area.  There was a walkway that had some gilding that way if you had children they were not able to run to the parking area if they happened to step out the door.  Also, we normally do not stay on the first floor but the way the rooms were insulated, you did not hear heavy walking above or even from the room next door.  All in all it was a very restful and pleasant stay.  Bathrooms were clean and so were the towels.  Nice and fresh.  We would like to say thank you to John.
Manager Response: Look like my Manager, John, did do his job. I will encourage him to continuously do the way he is doing and also set up himself as a role model for all my staffs to pursue.  Thanks for your business and don’t forget to come back to see us next time. Your recommendation is greatly appreciated.

Summary: We have stayed at this Comfort Inn a few times when going to Disneyland.  Rooms are average, but clean.  The do have a nice, basic continental breakfast with waffles in the morning. It is within walking Distance to Disney, but a fairly long walk at the end of a long day.   Don't look for anything fancy here, but a decent place to crash at the end of the day.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was great.  2 rooms with bunk beds for the kids.  We have 3 children and a rollaway was used for the 3rd child.  Amenities superb.  Staff extremely helpful and allowed use of internet facilities in main reception area.  Being from Australia we had lots of questions about sightseeing etc and staff were very helpful.  Walking distance to Disneyland, even with a 7 year old. Walmart and Liquor store close by.   A great base to see Anaheim and LA if using hire car or own vehicle.  Plenty of free parking outside your room.  Swimming Pool and Spa.
Manager Response: It is our pleasure to having this opportunity to serving you and your family. I am glad you all have wonderful and enjoyable experiences for this trip. Hope we can see you again when you and your family re-visit the U.S.

Summary Heading: Extremely pleased with our visit to this hotel
Summary: I set my expectations low ... I thought to get a kids' two-room suite for such a low price would mean a dump ... I could not have been more wrong! Our room was on the second floor and had two queen beds, a marble vanity, fridge, microwave, TV, bathroom, and the adjoining room had bunk beds and its own TV and bathroom! My friend paid for a rollaway so she could sleep in the small room with her kids, and my kids and I enjoyed the main room. With so many of us, it was cheaper for us to pay to park at Disney ($12) than take the shuttle bus. I would never walk to Disney ... the kids were so exhausted from all the walking they did in the park that my daughter literally fell asleep on the dinner table both evenings! The first day we got to the hotel, we enjoyed swimming in the pool and
Manager Response: It is glad to learn that your family and friends have a good experience with our place.  Regarding the bagel is short in our breakfast: All the donuts, danishes, and bagels are made, deliver to us and serve those in our breakfast in fresh everyday. Our pastry vendor is close by and has no problem to make a second delivery. I will have my breakfast serving colleague to watch it closer and order the second delivery if necessary.  Regarding the breakfast room is too small: This is not an easily solved problem. In according to Comfort Inn franchise’s requirements, we have to have a seat for every four (4) guestrooms. Our place has 108 rooms total, which means we need at least 27 seats in our breakfast room. Including the tables set up at courtyard, we have total 40 seats provided in our breakfast area. However, I have to admit that the breakfast room is still too crowded. Imaging all the family and their kids try to gather into the breakfast room is already crowed, some people need to stand in a line to wait for making their own waffles just make it much worse. The only thing I can do right now is allow our guests to take food back to their rooms in lieu of dinning in the breakfast room. Most of other hotels normally do not allow guests to take out the food to save the cost. But I don’t have any other choice to take this approach to easy the crowded situation even it will cost me more.

Summary Heading: What can I say, great place to stay!
Summary: Let me start by saying that I was not sure about staying here. I thought it was too far to walk to the park and I was unsure about this hotel because of a stay at another hotel from this same chain. Boy, I could not have been more WRONG!  I went online and booked the room. I was able to use an additional discount card, and got a kid's suite for the price of a single room. I also requested extra towels, which were already there, waiting for us. The room came with a refridgerator and a microwave, something I am not used to getting from many hotels in Anaheim.   We arrived a bit late but checked in with no problems. The room was on the second floor, which is what I prefer. The room was very clean and quiet. I think we made the most noise. (My apologies to the guests next to us) The
Manager Response: It is glad to learn that our staffs did do a good job. Our goal is to ensure our guests, like you and your family, to have a wonderful memory for their Disneyland vacation trip and an enjoyable experience staying with us.  We will continuously work hard to serve our guests like we always did. We are looking forward to seeing you visit us again.

Summary Heading: We'll be back. Great staff and great cont. breakfast!
Summary: We booked our trip through a travel agent and understood this was a decent hotel without tons of amenities...we knew it wasn't 5-star.  And, we were so surprised when we got there!!! We had just received 3 foster children prior to our trip so we headed there with 6 kids and knew we wouldn't have enough room. The receptionist got us into a suite and she was so sweet, we offered to pay the difference but she said no; there wasn't anyone booked!  It was an answer to prayer! We had a great time, the cleaning staff was friendly and cleaned our room around "nap-time" and we were able to get those little extras we forgot...6 kids you're bound to forget something!!!
Manager Response: It is glad to learn that you and your family love our place and services and willing to come back staying with us when you visit Disneyland next time.  Your repeated business is the best reward for our hard working. We are looking forward to serving you and your family again.  Wayne Owner - Comfort Inn Maingate - Anaheim

Summary Heading: Never, Ever, Ever Again - They Should Close Down Immediately!!!!!!!!!!!!
Summary: Hello All, First I want to say I love tripadvisor.com.  This site has been such a great research tool for me and my family as we embark on trips around the world.  Now for the review of Comfort Inn Maingate.  We decided to meet my brother and sister-in-law and their kids at the hotel and go to Disneyland for President's Day weekend to celebrate my neices birthday.  Since we were coming from the Bay Area my son and I decided to come the night before on Friday so we could spend the night and get up and go to the parks.  Based on the reviews from this site, we selected the Comfort Inn Maingate because we were looking for a place with complimentary parking, internet, breakfast and a pool and this hotel was suppose to have it all.  Upon arrival, the lady at the front desk was nice
Manager Response: I am sincerely apologizing that you and your family had such a bad experience staying with us. In additions, my manager did not contact you in person is our fault as well since we have an internal communication problem for this issue. He though I already called you and I though he already did.  My manager reported to me right away once he learned this pest control problem happened in the room you stayed. We closed that room immediately. We called our contracted pest control technician, Isotech Pest Control Services which is one of the leading companies in the pest control industry, to check out the problem. We moved out every single furniture and carefully checked it throughout. We could not find any roaches in the first beginning. Then we started to open the electrical outlets and removed the wall-mounted lamps trying to find out where those roaches live. End up, we found the roaches actually live in the inside of alarm clock. There are warm and the space is concealed which is perfect for them to hide.  We then opened all our alarm clocks in all of our rooms and checked whether there is any roach hiding inside. We even sprayed the medicine to keep the roaches away from our alarm clocks.  I believe that the efforts we took should be able to prevent this type of problem happen again.   Wayne Jiang Owner, Comfort Inn Maingate - Anaheim

Summary: This was the worst hotel I've been to! After reading the reviews I thought that this was the perfect hotel. Our main purpose was to just find a decent place to have a good night sleep and enjoy most of our time at Disneyland. We weren't looking for anything fancy, but certainly not what we ended up in. We arrived late and we got a room in the far back of the hotel. The initial problem was the smell of urine right outside the hotel hall. As we entered the room all we were hit with was a stuffy and warm moldy odor. It was horrible! They did not have the AC on because according to the front desk, they do not run the AC while the room is empty to cut cost on energy. That is understandable if the room was vacant for a few days or so, but if your expecting  a guest atleast have the
Manager Response: First of all, I regret that you have a bad experience with our property. We are the new Owner starting on 10/10/2008. I noticed that there are several complain regarding the housekeeping and guest service during the time from July to the date we took over this property. I believed that the previous Owner realized that they were going to sell this property and decided to care no more about this property. That’s why they did not comp or give you any discount. That’s also why the qualities for the housekeeping and guest service are dropping severely.  After we took over this property, we watch the staff’s performance real close and they all know we are seriously. Their performance immediately being improved to the level we expected. Matter of fact, we just have a Franchise Quality Assurance Review inspection done by 2/27/2009. This inspection is taking place without a notice in advance. Inspector pretended as a guest and stayed in our property the night before and showed up in front desk to request an inspection in the next morning. The scores for our guestroom cleanliness is 96.5% and for guestroom condition is 91.6%. Both scores are substantially improved from the last year’s performance and much better that the Comfort Inn’s standard – 85%.  I did realize that the air condition issue for the kid suite room with two baths. This is a building design problem. I am working with an Architect now and try to find the right solution to resolve this concern. This building was built on 1980. I don’t understand why the previous Owners (I know there are at least 4 different owners owned this property before us) did not take care this. Since we are the current Owner, it leaves us no other choice and have to deal with this issue.  Thanks again your comments for our property. Your honest comments will help us to emphasis the areas we need to improve most. We are also appreciating that you pointed out the verbiage in our website does need to be modified.  Wayne Jiang Owner, Comfort Inn Maingate - Anaheim

Summary: My family and I just love this hotel.  It's the only hotel in Anaheim that offers kids rooms with 2 bathrooms which is a life saver when traveling with 3 kids. This was our second visit to this hotel and it was every bit as great as our first trip. My husband and I and 2 of our 3 kids (ages 14 and 3) planned a 2 day trip to Disneyland for my husband's birthday and instantly we knew what hotel we would be staying at because our first experience was so wonderful. The staff at this hotel is extremely nice. The comfort and spaciousness of the hotel is just to our liking and the kids love to stay in their own separate space. The love the bunkbeds and the fact that they have their own TV so that they don't have to watch what mom and dad was watching.  The kids room area is so large
Manager Response: It is glad to know that you and your family like our place and our services then come back staying with us on a second time. Be honestly, the only purpose for all of our staffs' hard working is make guests happy and willing to come back when they visit this area next time. Your repeated visit is our biggest reward.  I will pass your compliment to all the staffs and have them continuously do the way they are doing.

Summary: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, we thought that we had found the perfect solution to our search for a hotel during our recent trip to Disneyland.  Boy, were we ever mistaken!!  I have to wonder if the people who wrote positive reviews for this hotel stayed at the same hotel that we did. Here is our story: We arrived around 6:30 PM on a Sunday night.  I walked into the lobby and waited at least a half an hour before the one person who was working there finally was able to check us in.  My husband who was waiting in the car with the kids finally had to come in and check to see if I was okay because it took so long.  Once I finally got to check in, the process was reasonably smooth, but the person checking us in was most definitely not friendly or helpful like other
Manager Response: I am regret that our room conditions and services did not meet your expectation. Please remember that we do provide a 100% satisfaction guarantee program. If you are not pleased with your room or service, please contact with the front desk staff. In case that we can not correct the situation in a timely manner to your satisfaction, we will not charge your room. Unfortunely, you did not bring our attention during your stay, we lost such opportunity to correct it and make you and your family feel better.  Based on the information that you checked in on a Sunday 6:30PM, you stayed 7 days, and you are from Washington, I have checked all our guests' profiles and successfully identify that you are the family checked in our room #121 on Dec. 7. The following lists are some responses for your comments:  1. We have totally 23 guests checked in on Dec. 7. Which is normal for us since we usally have lots of guests check out before 2:00PM and don't have too many guests check in. That's why that we only have one front desk staff on duty around 6:30PM. I reviewed the security camara tape with the front desk staff who checked you in, we found that there are two customers before you waiting to checked in. It is totally unexpected for us. 3 of 23 guests showed up in the same time to check in. I can see my front desk staff tried her best to expedite the processes. it took her totally 18 minutes to check in the two guests before you and youself. On my own opinion, she did not do a bad job.  2.)  Our maintenance log shows that Room #121 was deep cleaned on Oct. 31. We have a maintenance program to clean every room's carpet on every three months. The carpet should not be a such dirty condition. after my maintainance staff and I checked the Room #121 again, we believe that the rain recently make the carpet more dirtier. We are on the process to clean the carpet on the entire first floor, since the first floor condition  is worse.  3.) We are on the process to replace all shower head with an extension.  4.) I am the new owner over this property. I am not sure how to get the "Maingate" name on our property. One thing I know for sure that this name have been with our property during several different ownerships already. There are several different franchise hotels using "Maingate" name but none is really close to Disneyland.  5.) I don't know why the hot tub is "ice cold". We did have the problem on our hot tub heater on the late November. During that time we have no choice and have to close our hot tub. However, we did replace a brand new spa heater for hot tub on December 2. After that date, the hot tub is running great and I do not aware any more problem. I wish we have an opportunity to check this problem. I can call the pool guy back to check this a few days old heater.  Anyway, I am sincerely appreciate your comments. It help me to point out some defects I did not recognize and help us to become a better place to have a better service.

Summary: My son and I go to Disney every year, and usually stay at one of the walking distance hotels (Ramada, HoJo, Park Vue) -  This year, with the economy being what it is, we went a little more budget (ie, further from Disney) and ended up with the Comfort Inn Maingate.    First off, I think it is fair to say that the "Maingate" portion of the name is a bit of a stretch.  It's about a mile walk to the main Disney entrance (20 minutes-ish), but at least it is on the same side of Harbor (no busy streets to cross)  After walking there and back the first day, we decided to pick up bus passes, conveniently available at the front desk (about 20 bucks for 5 days usage)  The ART bus was super convenient, with the stop being right next door to the hotel, and the buses run about every 20
Manager Response: First all, it is great to know that you like our place and our service. I will pass your comment to mur staffs and have them continuously perform the way they did.  Secondly, thanks for your suggestions. We already furnished and installed the second waffle machine at our breakfast room to serve our guests better.   In additions, after I tried the shower head myself, I have to agree that the shower head can be higher. I already placed a order to purchase the shower head extension and going to replace it throughout this property.  My goal is let all the guests feel that they got a great value deal to stay with us, even our property is a little farther than other hotels. We will continuously work on to earn our reputation.

Summary: although we did not book the hotel ourselves, but though an agent, we understood that this is not a 5-star hotel, so i should say, we were not expecting a 5-star  treatment!!! but lo and behold!   the front desk staff was so accommodating, she made our 5-day stay feel so at home! she gave us friendly suggestions about shopping, dining, going around.   the housekeeping staff did a good job maintaining our rooms, making sure that when we got back from touring around, we had  clean and well-kept rooms to retire to at night.  breakfast in the morning was okey.  we were glad to have a good breakfast before heading out. i would suggest, though, to add few on the list. hmm, how about adding sausages or breakfast muffins or fruit juices for breakfast? thanks :)  overall, 5-star rating!!!
Manager Response: Our service gaol is making all our guests have a wonderful and happy experience for their Disneyland trips.  I am glad to know that you all have a great time and enjoy to stay with us. I will pass thru this to the front desk and houskeeper staffs.

Summary: Arrived at the hotel and thought for $82.00 this is OK, not flash but the rooms were clean and the kidsuite rooms were ideal.   A few nights into our stay we had a problem, the toilet water had been running all night and flooded the kidsuite and I am afraid that is all I can say for now due to legal reasons as I am in the process of taking a civil action against the hotel for compensation and a personal grievance against the GM Jefferson for his less than professional behaviour.  Watch this space  Robert NZ
Manager Response: I am the new Owner for the Comfort Inn Maingate starting on 10/10/2008. Jefferson is no longer as a GM at our property.  There are manty reasons can cause the toilet plugged and then water overflowed out to the floor. No matter what is the actual reason, since nobody intentionally wants this thing happen, this is only an accident. I believe the real reason to make the customer have a bad experience is the hotel staff's attitude.  I can guarantee that this attitude problem will not happen under my new management. If there is anything problem the customer find out during his/her stay, he/she can always come to front desk to seek the resolution or ask to contact me directly.  Wayne Jiang - Owner Comfort Inn Maingate

Summary: Overall this is just an avg. hotel, which looks more like a motel.  No elevator to the 2nd floor so pack light.  Garbage sat in the hallways for quite a few days.  No smells to go with it, but still not very attractive to look at.  Rooms are clean, with linens as needed.  Shower heads are set very low, my 6' tall hubbie had to stoop.  2Bdrm, 2bath suite was the way to go with plenty of room for the amount of time we spent in it.  Do not set your watches, clocks, etc. by the ART for transportation.  Was rarely on time either way--we walked every day as a result.  I guess I have a different definition of what "Maingate" should imply re: proximity to D.L..  Apparently it is at least one mile.  It is definitely a LONNNG walk but do-able esp. for those who hike, walk alot, etc.  Our
Manager Response: I will review "trash left on the hallway" problem with the housekeepers and ensure this problem will not happen again.  I glad to know you like our staff's service and our room size. Hope our better services can easy the inconvenience causes by the distance to Disneyland.  Wayne Owner, Comfort Inn Maingate

Summary: we were incredibly disappointed with our stay here.  After reading the fabulous reviews, we had high expectations.  Our primary requirements in looking for a Disneyland hotel were 1.  A separate bedroom for our daughter.  2.  Air conditioning.  3.  Quiet.    The Comfort Inn Maingate did have the separate room.  That was the only good thing about this location.    The a/c was so loud that we couldn't have it running while we were in the unit.    We were located in the back of the complex, so we had hoped to be spared the noise from the swimming pool.  Well, the back street was so noisy that it kept us up all night.  Random people would yell and cars would peel down the street making all sorts of noise.  Also, you could also hear everything in the neighbor's rooms.  The people we
Manager Response: The hot water heater system has been replaced and already fixed the condition that the hot water temperature suddently change. We do apologize the inconvenience caused by this issue.  For the noisy A/C unit, we can either replace with our spear A/C unit or change to the other room.   If there is any problem occurs during the customer's stay, he/she can always call to the front desk staff for seeking the resolution or he/she can even request to contact me directly.

Summary: Stayed at this propert yfor 4 nights in late September based on previous trip advisor reviews.   For $62 per night I was more than impressed with the level of service and the accommodation was clean and well presented.   Check in was a breeze. Rooms cleaned to a high standard each day.   Breakfast is included, though it can get very busy at certain times and the room is somewhat small. My only negative about the breakfast area is connected to guests and not the hotel. It takes just a few seconds to place your trash in the can. However, some guests obviously decided that the hotel were responsible for cleaning their guests breakfast left overs and mess rising to the area looking a little messy at times as the staff had to busily clean up the areas vacated.  Pool area clean,
Manager Response: Thanks for select my place to fullfill your lodging needed. I am glad to know that our services and the reasonable rate did make you have an enjoyable experience for this Disneyland trip. I will sure to pass this on to my staffs.

Summary Heading: Our long search paid off, BIG TIME.
Summary: Perfect for families!  Our family just returned from a fabulous Disney vacation and one of the reasons it turned out so nice was our hotel.  We had the two room suite with two baths.  There are two queen beds, which a very comfy, in the main room, and a glass door with a sheer curtain into the kids room with bunks.  They have their own TV, vanity and bathroom/w shower and tub.  A huge plus for families.  I searched long and hard to find a facility that was more than a one bedroom with fold out couch in the living area.  This fit the bill perfectly.  The price was GREAT, too.  You can fit four in one room, two in the bunk room, and even have room for a cot, if they allow.  We were in the back, so there was no noise.  Having an upper level helps, also. Everything was clean, and
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved our stay at the Comfort Inn Maingate.  I read many reviews before booking and was impressed with the price and value.  My kids LOVED the bunkbeds and we (the parents) loved having a room to ourselves.  The continental breakfast was just what we needed each morning.  We would recommend staying here to anyone with children.  We will stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was my 2nd stay at Comfort Inn Maingate and both times I was pleased.  Both times I was with a group of  friends (6 of us) and we stayed in their 2 bedroom, 2 bath family suite. The room was clean and beds were comfortable and we felt safe there.   We were there for a yearly conference at the Pond which was just minutes away.  We plan to use the same room every time we come to this conference. The price was exactly what I was quoted several months before at booking. The check-in and out was fast and easy and the staff were extremely polite and friendly.   The complementary breakfast was fresh and delicious and the eating area was clean. They have plenty of parking too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at Comfort Inn Maingate from Thursday 21st of August for 3 nights. We chose this hotel for its proximity to Disneyland. A shuttle arrives every 20 min at the Ramada next door so it made it very easy to hop onto a shuttle and take us to disneyland. The staff were very helpful with any issues. the beds were very comfortable and after getting off a 14 hour flight from Australia this was much appreciated. We had a room facing the back road so it was quiet. unfortunately the walls were very thin, so anytime someone shut a door we heard it. we didnt' use the pool so can't comment on that. the rooms were cleaned daily, no complaints there. Our room charges were charged to our credit card with a deposit as well which we were not told about.  the only complaint i would have
Manager Response: none

Summary: I apologize for not doing this sooner and I feel terrible because i have forgotten the person at the front desk name, Kelly or Valarie?  Maybe you can check my previous survey.  I want to make sure the correct person gets recongized. On Saturday afternoon I had called down to the office to see if they could print my boarding pass for me for my flight on Sunday. They said yes they could and I told them I would be down later, but I didn't make it.  She call me on Sunday morning to double check to see if I got my boarding pass printed.  I had and thanked her for double checking back with me.  That is above and beyond the call of duty.  I too am in customer service business and appreciate the extra effort taken. I would like to thank you Kelly/Valarie (?) for double checking back
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You'll love the good nites sleep on their wonderful pillows !!
Summary: My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Confort Inn, Maingate....the grandkids loved the pool and the waffle breakfast!   The breakfast gave them a good start to our day at Disneyland.  They loved the bunkbeds in "their own room" and we appreciated the extra bathroom for them!  They felt so grown up!  Having the shuttle to Disneyland so close was a definite plus!  At nite, the hotel was quiet and we all had a great nites sleep on very comfortable beds and very comfortable pillows!  A definite return hotel for myself and my family.  Very reasonably priced as well....also, many restaurants within walking distance.  Thank you Comfort Inn Maingate for a wonderful stay full of great memories!!  See you again soon!!  The Smith Family,  Bend, Oregon
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Comfy beds, pleasant & clean. Would return w/out hesitation. Minor issues.
Summary: After looking for hours on the Net for a decent hotel for our family, I finally decided on the Comfort Inn, a 1960-ish two-story garden walk-up structure with pool and jacuzzi. We were in town to see the Angels play. They lost terribly to the Twins (9-0), but Fireworks Friday, synchronized with music, was awesome at the Big A. (Glory!)  First off, it really surprised me that there were few choices for families beyond 2 queen beds near Disneyland. But at this place, we were not only able to get 2 queen beds, but a bunkbed in another room separated by a glass-paned door AND an additional bathroom! How cool is that? Bunkbeds are typical "rack" mattresses on a sturdy wood, light green-painted frame. Our kids (one grown and one young teen) slept only so-so on them, but they liked
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just returned from a 7 day Stay.  A few minor issues but they were handled quickly by the staff.  2 bath kids suite is the way to go........................................  Certianly not the Ritz but Great Value for the price.  Would stay again.   Thx
Manager Response: none

Summary: we stayed at this hotel august 10-13 2008, we stayed in a kids suite withe 2 bathrooms, pleanty of space. the parking is plenty big. the brekfast area is small but there are tables outside and they let you take the food to your room. the only thing i didnt like was that there were only 2 waffle makers so it did seem to go slow. overall i would highly recomennd this hotel, oh by the way it is not close to the maingate so dont think about walking
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had a great stay at this hotel! My children were very excited with the kid's suite. The continental breakfast available was the best I've seen. The staff was friendly and very helpful with everything. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to any family.
Manager Response: none

Summary: After spending hours pouring over hotel websites and reviews on Trip Advisor, I selected Comfort Inn Maingate for two main reasons.  First, I was impressed with the overall positive reviews on Trip Advisor.  The overall quality of reviews combined with the very affordable rate made Comfort Inn very appealing.  The second was the responsiveness by the management to directly respond to problems listed on TripAdvisor.  I saw no other websites that took the time to address problems and was impressed with the attentiveness.  I was in Anaheim with a youth group on a mission trip and spent just one day at the end of our trip at Disneyland.  The heavenly mattresses at Comfort Inn were a welcome treat after sleeping on a church floor for a week!  The breakfast was far above the normal
Manager Response: Thank you for selecting my hotel for your stay.  Like Dwight and his beet farm from "the Office," I believe TripAdvisor to be the "lifeblood" of the hotel industry and I obsess over every TripAdvisor review.  I literally jump out of my chair and cheer when I see our TripAdvisor Popularity Index go up.  And I'm glad your stay was better than a church floor :)

Summary Heading: Comfort Inn Maingate, excellent service and comfort
Summary: Dear Sirs, I traveled from Las Vegas Nevada to Disneyland with a 13 year old and a 16 year old . They are very picky, but on entering our room, they were so excited to have bunk beds and their own space to put their phones and ipods. They loved it. The blankets and beds smelled fresh and clean. Everything was available. We used the guest laundry and the attendant let as stay extra time after closing. The continental breakfast was very good, my dad really loved your coffee.  The pool and spa were very nice also. We were able to buy our shuttle tickets at the office and pickup was easy to use.  They even helped my mom print out Google maps for our trip back to Vegas. She was very nervous and that helped her  feel better.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay and we felt at home.
Manager Response: Thank you for spending the time to respond.  I'm glad to hear that our complimentary kiosk computer, and free printing benefited you :)   I'll be sure to share your compliments with my staff.

Summary Heading: Will Not Go Back To Comfort Inn Maingate Again!
Summary: When planning on where to stay for our family vacation to Disneyland, the Comfort Inn Maingate caught my attention with its advertisement and reviews especially for families with children.  I booked the 2 bedroom/2 bath room w/bunkbeds.  When we arrived, the staff was very friendly and accomodating; the room smelled and appeared clean.  My children (10 and 5)  were very excited about the bunkbeds.  They loved running around in their own separate room - I soon became disgusted with how dirty their socks got.  In the morning, I opened the drapes/curtain and really saw how DIRTY the rug and furniture were.  I had them wear their flip flops all the time and told them NOT to sit on the floor.  I covered the furniture with towels!  Having a room on the bottom floor I realized how the
Manager Response: 100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE Please let us know if there are any issues with the room when you notice them.  We will do as much as we can to take care of any issues you may have.  More details on this policy can be found on our main website (Google "Comfort Inn Maingate")  FRIENDLY STAFF I'm glad to hear that despite the problems with the rooms, my staff was helpful and accommodating.  DIRTY RUG We have been going through each room to deep clean them.  Should you have a problem with the cleanliness of the carpet, please let us know so that we can get it taken care of.  If we can't take care of it to your satisfaction, I usually try and offer some kind of discount to accommodate for the inconvenience.  This reviewer is correct in stating that the bottom floor rooms get dirtier much quicker than the top floor due to the flower beds on the bottom floor.  PARKING We have 108 rooms at our hotel, and 107 parking spots.  Though not all of the parking spots are adjacent to all the doors, you will find that we have plenty of parking on our property.  And it's free!   Please be aware as you do your research for hotels near Disneyland that hotels, as you get closer to Disneyland, have very limited parking and/or they charge extra for parking.  VENTILATION Most of the rooms have no ventilation issue.  The 2 Bathroom Kid's Suites sometimes have problems with ventilation when the temperature is extremely hot outside.  The 1 Bathroom Kid's Suites and regular deluxe rooms have no problems with this.  We have floor fans readily available to help alleviate this problem for no charge.  BREAKFAST ROOM The breakfast room can get crowded depending on how many people are in there.  In order to help alleviate this problem, we have tables setup outside of the breakfast room and I encourage guests to take their food into their rooms to make room for guest's as they enter.  The item that gets the longest wait are the two waffle irons we have that allow guest's to make their own Belgian Waffles.  The lines can get long for those at peak times (5 people deep each), but that could be more of a testament to the tastiness of the waffles and the wait that people are willing to endure for them!  LOCAL RESTAURANT DISCOUNTS Also, should you decide to go to a local restaurant to eat, don't forget to get a local restaurant discount card from our front desk!  I've talked with local restaurant owners to give my guests discounts :)  NEWLY RENOVATED MARCH 2008 The hardwood furniture, couches, pictures, and drapes were installed March 2008.  The carpets were installed along with new pillowtop mattresses Spring 2007.  You can see the latest pictures of the rooms and hotel along with walking tours at our main website (Google "Comfort Inn Maingate").

Summary: I was really impressed with the great customer service and also the way everything was scheduled as I had directed in my reservation.  When I arrived the service was great and quick and that was excellent because we were so tired of driving that all we wanted to do was rest since we were coming from El Paso, Texas.  The rooms were cleaned daily and beds made everytime we arrived back to the hotel and that was great because all we wanted to do was to relax as soon as we got back from site seeing.  The employees were very friendly not only in the information and customer desk, but the staff itself.  I was very happy the way their breakfast was ready every morning promptly in time and the friendly atmosphere.  Overall I was really impressed and I am defenetly going to return every
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear everything went smooth for your hard earned vacation!  I'll be sure to pass this on to the staff.

Summary: Not sure if I would stay here again... My girlfriend and I attepted to stay here for 5 nights June 20-25, 2008. We arrived early and checked in around 11:30am or so. Upon walking in, we found a clean room which looked nice and smelled pleasant. No problems appeared as of yet. We were in room #205.  However, we both took showers and found DANGEROUS problems with it. The shower water was tempermental and would change from cold to BURNING HOT by itself. There was no "middle" or "warm". It would change suddenly and could have seriously injured us. We reported the problem to the front desk and they supposedly put in a "fix-it" ticket for the next business day. They offered to have us switch rooms, but we decided to hold off to see if this got fixed by the next morning.  We came back
Manager Response: 100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE If you are unsatisfied with your accommodations at my hotel, and you give the front desk a chance to solve the problem, and we can't reasonably fix it during your stay, then I am obliged to give you up to a one night refund.  I have since contacted the guest and issued a full refund for their night's stay.  More details on  the 100% Satisfaction Guarantee can be found at our main website (Google "Comfort Inn Maingate"), under "100% Satisfaction Guarantee."  WATER PROBLEMS We have two buildings, and one of the buildings had water problems with maintaining consistent water temperature.  We found out that someone had shut off the valves to the hot water expansion chamber and the recirculating pump which caused the water fluctuations.  Since discovering the closed valves, and after cleaning out the water heaters, the problem has been solved.  The other building was unaffected.  Unfortunately, I failed to communicate to all staff while we were trying to solve the issues that the other building was unaffected.  When the guest was moved rooms, he was moved into a different room, but in the same building that was having the water issues.  JANUARY 2007 I came into management September 2007, and at that time the recirculating pump was not functioning properly.  After discovering the problem my first month, I had the pump replaced and we have had no problems until recently, about the time of this guest's stay.  ATTENTIVE MANAGEMENT My personal mission is to make sure your stay is as pleasant as possible at my hotel.  You can contact me directly on my cell phone (ask the front desk to connect you) or email me (my direct email is on my hotel's main website).  If  you have issues with any of my staff or with the accommodations, please let me know so that I can address it personally.  Due to the size of the property, I'm not always aware of every problem at the hotel and your feedback on my hotel helps me to make the hotel that much better for future guests.

Summary: My stay at the Comfort Inn Maingate was great! I was in the area on business, but of course I made some time for fun too. The hotel was conviniently located only 5 minutes from Disney Land. The rooms were nice, the staff was great, it was one of the best deals in the area, and the manager even came to check on us and made sure we were having an enjoyable stay. Everything was great. I will definitely be staying there again on my next trip to Orange County and all of the theme parks in the area.
Manager Response: I'm glad you felt we were a great deal for the area.  I hope your next stay will be just as pleasant.  I'll be forwarding your comments to our staff, which I'm sure they will appreciate.

Summary: I booked my stay directly through the hotel website. We stayed for 2 nights after Memorial Day weekend.  I was with my 73 yr old father, my daughter & her cousin.  We were taking my father to Disneyland.  He had not been there in more than 30 years.  I called the day prior to our arrival and asked if the room was on the ground floor because I was concerned about my father having to walk upstairs.  Celina, at the front desk was more than accomodating and told me she would block out a bottom floor room for us.  When we arrived Celina was at the front desk and remembered my call.  She had indeed blocked out a room for us.  The main room had 2 Queen beds, which were extremely comfortable.  I was impressed with the bedding. It was in new condition.  The sheets even smelled good.  We
Manager Response: Thank you for the very detailed review.  I'm glad you felt that  we offered great value for your stay.  I would consider Celina to be one of our top Guest Service Agents.  I have forwarded your compliments to her along with the rest of the staff.

Summary: Booked online and was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The beds were very comfortable. The room  was great. My kids enjoyed the outdoor pool area along with available laundry room. The breakfast was small but plenty of places are nearby for those who want a real breakfast. For the price this was a great place to stay.
Manager Response: I'm glad you were pleasantly surprised with your stay :)  In addition to our make-your-own Belgian waffle breakfast, which includes cereals, donuts, danishes, juices, oranges, apples, milk, hard boiled eggs, orange & apple juice, and gourmet coffee, we do offer discounts to local restaurants.  More info on the local restaurant discounts and picture of our breakfast can be found at our main website (Google "Comfort Inn Maingate").

Summary: We booked through GetAwayToday When I went on line to book I could only get 1 room with the free night because when I went in to book the other 2 rooms (5 minutes later) I needed they had no more free night bookings and since my family of 13 were all going I had to pay for the full 7 nights for the other 2 rooms.  A rep from Getawaytoday even called the management and they said no they would not give me the same deal .. The carpet in the room was so dirty we had to wear shoes all the time we were in the room.  The grounds were fair but needed to be cleaned.  The Continental breakfast was so crowded and in such a small room you could barely get in and they were always out of donuts and only had rolls and bread. Would of been nice to have a bagel.  Most of the employees were nice
Manager Response: SPECIAL DEALS WITH GET AWAY TODAY  During the time of the guest's stay, we were near sold out, so we were not able to accommodate the free nights to match Get Away Today.  In addition, Get Away Today sells Disney Tickets in packages with the hotel nights, in addition to other items.  They are able to issue free nights due to the package deals they sell.  DIRTY CARPETS  I am aware of this problem and we have been aggressively cleaning the carpets.  The carpets were installed in 2007, and all our furniture has just been replaced since March 2008.  The carpets just need to be deep cleaned.  BREAKFAST ROOM  There is a breakfast attendant on duty before and during the breakfast hours.  We are always happy to refill whatever items are low.  The size of the room can be a challenge at the busiest times.  We try to accommodate this by allowing guests to bring food to their rooms and also by providing outside seating.  FRONT DESK STAFF  We are always willing to help should the request arise, but due to staffing, the front desk staff are not always able to leave the front desk due to the cash in the register.  In addition, if the agent at the front desk leaves the desk, the phones are left unattended.   AVAILABLE MANAGEMENT  I'm always available to be contacted directly.  Just ask the front desk staff to call my cell and I can be reached that way.  In addition, I'm always available via email which can be found on our main website.
