You can find our main website by Googling "Comfort Inn Maingate"

Summary: I booked this vacation through GET-AWAY-TODAY, I have stayed at other motels in the area on other vacations and this one is by far the best. great room, very clean and quiet(i stayed on the side facing the apartments). the breakfast room was a little small but not bad. I would recomend this to anybody with kids. to the staff, thanks for a great stay.
Manager Response: You're welcome.  Thanks for the compliments.  I'll be passing this onto the staff.

Summary: 6 of us stayed for 6 nights at the Comfort Inn Maingate and found it great.  The Kids Suite we stayed in had 2 rooms - a bunk bed and T.V in one room and two queen size beds in the other as well as bathroom.  We had a microwave oven to heat food if necessary as well as another T.V.  Great for us as we had three children with us.  The beds were very comfortable and there was enough room for us all to move around. The shuttle service was just out the front of the motel and only cost $3 adult and $1 child for as many trips as we liked per day.  We were only 1 mile from Disneyland if we wanted to walk.   The breakfasts were more than adequate - waffles, cereal, toast and Jam, hard boiled eggs, apples and oranges, juices and tea and coffee.  More than enough choice and as much as you
Manager Response: I'm glad you had a great stay.  Thanks for taking the time to write a review.   :)

Summary: I got this hotel through a vacation package with getawaytoday and we were pleasanly surprised at the quality of the rooms. We were 2 adults/2children and had double beds. The room was clean, the towels bright white, the beds were so comfortable, we had to buy a new mattress as soon as we got home. The room was spacious and comfortable, nicely decorated. I liked the channel list, it had a refrigerator and coffee maker. It also had a safe. For a continental breakfast they had a lot of choices and we loved the waffles! We drove to disneyland every day and it was very close. Also they offered discounts at nearby restaurants. I definitely recommend it for families!
Manager Response: I'm glad you liked the Restaurant Discounts :)  That was something new I just implemented and it's good for me to hear positive input about it.  That means I'll keep it going for sure.  Also, I appreciate your feedback about the mattresses.  In case this helps any, the specific mattress is a pillow top mattress made by Selther called the Celestial Sleeper.  If your mattress is still in relatively good condition, you may want to consider buying a foam topper, about 3" thicker.  I make my own "cheapurpedic" mattresses using this similar technique.

Summary: I always take advantage of the reviews as they are very helpful.  We planned a last minutes trip to anaheim and I was surprised as the great deal that I received online.  This hotel, I was told was a 10 minute walk.  After seeing it, I did not try to walk it.  It was 4 blocks away from the entrance.  The front desk attendant, Celina was very helpful.  We arrived early and checked in.  We were also able to buy tickets for the shuttle for $3.00 per person.  That was very helpful and convenient.  The room was very clean on the ground floor.  No to much outside noise.  The breakfast was good.  I understand that everyone has different tastes, but it suited us just fine.  The dining area was kept very clean and well stocked.  My only suggestion would be a more variety of fresh fruit,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I'll be sure to let our breakfast attendant & Celina know about your compliments.

Summary: I read so much about this hotel before our trip.  The management even went on Miceage to post for suggestions on making the hotel better.  I was pleasantly surprised at the size of our room.  It was clean and very comfortable.  The free breakfast was good, but I would eco what the previous reviewer wrote with adding some healthy choices like yogurt and peanut butter.  My 8 year old asked for bagels and cream cheese too.  To even go a step furthers you could add some fruit topping for the waffles.  All of these would still be pretty cheap for a tight budget.  If I HAD to complain it would just be a couple of very minor things.  First my son wanted to sleep on the sofa sleeper (he thought that was cool) so when we pulled the extra blanket out of the dresser it was dirty, and I do
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I appreciate your feedback as you give me extra eyes on the property.  I'm very disappointed in my staff that they didn't keep better upkeep with the property and with the rooms.  After reading your review, I talked to my head housekeeper to make sure we keep the grounds picked up!   For room standards and cleanliness, I've implemented a rigorous housekeeping inspection checklist.  This two page checklist has 70 line items and covers the cleanliness of every aspect of the room.  It also makes sure that little things, such as making sure the alarm on the clock isn't on, are also taken care of.    To see the detailed checklist yourself, you can Google our main website, "Comfort Inn Maingate" and we'll be the first option.  Select "Accommodations" in the search bar, and you'll find a link in there to the extensive Housekeeping Checklist.

Summary: For a "Newly renovated" hotel......it still needs a lot of work!!! For starters when we arrived at 4pm we were told we had to drive around to the other side of the building to find our room #152, then we walked in .......within the first 20 min. we found that the beds were soft and caved into the middle,sheets didnt stay tucked in, there was mold in the shower/tub combo and the floors needed to be cleaned. I know this from walking in my socks....within the first 20 min. my socks were FILTHY!!!! The door didnt compleately seal(you could see daylight/blaring street lamps) all night long.....didnt make for a good nites sleep.  As for the positive for this property.....THE WAFFELS ARE GREAT!!!! Both mornings we were there......I made waffels what a great set-up. All hotels should
Manager Response: NEWLY RENOVATED  Our hotel just installed new furniture in March 2008.  The beds were newly installed Spring 2007 along with the carpets.  ROOM LOCATION  I'm not sure how busy it was that night, but we take special requests as to where you want the room at the time of check in.  Our hotel is an exterior property, so the entrance to the rooms are on the outside of the building.  Guests are welcome to park on the inside of the property and walk through the hallways to the other side of the building to get into their rooms.  With exterior entrances, it's much more convenient to drive and park right in front of the door of the room.  CARPETS & BED QUALITY  We rotate through each room to do deep carpet cleaning on a regular basis.  The carpet must have been about to be cleaned and has since been cleaned.  As for the bed, I'll be personally investigating this further to check for quality.  I'll replace it as necessary.  100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE  Please let us know if there are any issues with the room.  If it's not too busy we can usually move you to a different room where the issues aren't as pronounced.

Summary: My family of five stayed in one of the kid suites with 2 bathrooms over Spring Break.  The room was nice and clean, and the service was great.  When we needed a TV remote fixed, I stopped by the front desk on my way to breakfast and asked for them to fix it, and I also asked for additional washcloths when they cleaned the room.  By the time I was finished with breakfast, it was all in my room.  The rest of the stay, they made sure we had enough washcloths every day.  The pool was nice and just the right temperature.  I found the front desk staff to be super helpful.  If I wanted to know where to get ice cream, they had a suggestion.  They gave me a great estimate on how long it would take to drive during rush hour to get to a dinner theater.  They let the kids pick a toy out of
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our party was 4 adults and 2 kids, all were very comfortable. I have stayed other places since, but I still remember this trip fondly, especially the bake-your-own waffles.  Any chace you can email me the batter recipie?
Manager Response: You can find the website of the people who provide the waffle batter by Googling the phrase "heartland food products"  I'm not sure if they sell to individual consumers or if they'll disclose their secret recipe ;-)

Summary Heading: Adjust the sprinklers timers for uninterrupted sleep!!!!
Summary: We just stayed here Feb 11th thru Feb 14th.  Room was nice and clean, and ready for us when we checked in at 1:00.   The only issue we had was the sprinklers/irrigation going off  in the middle of the night! Very loud water gushing sounds waking us up each night. We were in room 248,  back of  inn property facing the apartment complex. You will also hear cars starting up in the A.M. so be prepared for that. BUt I hope The Manager of Comfort INn reads this and adjusts the sprinkler timers so that they don't go off in the middle of the night!!!! otherwise a nice and clean place.
Manager Response: The sprinklers for the property are currently scheduled to begin at 4:00 AM and last for approximately 15 minutes.  Some of the sprinklers are spraying into the walkways, so I'll be adjusting those before setting the time of the sprinkler start to late evening as to not disturb anyone's sleep.    I figure it will generally be more appreciated that guests don't get sprayed on as they walk through the hotel walkways until we get the spray alignments fixed.  Should any guest have any problems with the hotel that we can fix, please let the front desk know right away or message me so that I can get the issues resolved as quickly as possible.  With a property the size of ours, it's nearly impossibly for us to track every problem unless we're notified by the guest.    Thank you all for your input in helping to make my hotel the best in its class.

Summary: The General Manager went the extra mile in making our stay VERY memorable. We visited with 3 out or our 4 adult children and thier children for a Disneyland vacation. The one family was not able to attend due to an upcoming birth of a new grandchild. Jefferson Kim and that family worked together, long distance, to arrange for a special announcement of the new baby to be in all of our rooms, right at the time of the event,. We returned from a fun day at Disneyland to find the sweet announcements that the General Manager and his staff had arranged for each of us. We'll never forget thier thoughtfulness. It will become a story linked to this new grandchild for her entire life. Her loving grandparents thank you.
Manager Response: I have talked with the guest regarding the issue with better Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) communication from the front desk.  The front desk personnel has been reminded to better communicate the schedule for ART by forwarding the guests the schedule located on a pedestal at our front desk.  ART picks up every 20 minutes, but they have a lunch break for about one hour from about 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM.  The lunch break became an issue when the guests were waiting outside for a bus that never showed up because of the lunch break.  The guests eventually got to Disneyland, but not until after ART came back from lunch.  I would personally prefer to have a dedicated shuttle, but the City of Anaheim restricts it through various city ordinances which essentially force our hotel to use ART.

Summary: I got a deal on Getawaytoday.com to go to this hotel.  I was a bit worried as it wasn't like RIGHT on the maingate to disneyland as I thought the name implied, but it's extremely close.  You could walk there from here easily, I'd say a mile or so but my wife and I preferred to use the shuttle system. There's a shuttle that will pick you up right outside and take you to Disneyland for $3/day unlimited.  It comes every 20-25 minutes.  Not a bad deal, considering parking in disneyland is much more moneywise and maybe even time wise.  I loved the staff and the breakfast made it great, it's nice not having to worry about breakfast.  Good price, good hotel.
Manager Response: We are a little over a mile from our hotel to the security check point to the hotel.  I apologize if the name of the hotel feels misleading.  I noticed this as well when I became the General Manager in September 2007.  Due to the nightmare it would take to do a name change in all the sources that list us, and because we need some kind of name that differentiates us from the other two Comfort Inns in Anaheim, I have chosen to keep the name which I inherited.    I try on our official website to clearly communicate our distance to Disneyland and do my best to make sure we give no impression we are directly adjacent to the Maingate of Disneyland, other than the name of the hotel itself.  ANAHEIM RESORT TRANSIT (ART): Parking at Disneyland for all day, with in and out privileges, is $11/day.  We're the second to last stop before the shuttle goes to Disneyland's security check point.  Versus driving your own car, ART can have it's advantages and disadvantages.  It can save you time getting to the park, but the return trip may take a little longer because of the fact that there are about 5 stops before you reach ours.  Also, depending on the size of your family, ART can be more expensive, and offers less flexibility should you need to return to the hotel in the middle of the day.

Summary: We just returned from a five night stay at the Comfort Inn Maingate.  I booked the hotel because I was able to get a suite with an extra bathroom and the bunkbeds.  I really didn't have too many problems with the room other than it did smell a little wierd.  And, the bathrooms could be updated.  However, overall I wasn't too disappointed.  My problem was with the manager on duty the night of New Year's Eve.  We (five adults) returned from Disneyland after the New Year's Eve festivities.   We all got back to the room by about 1:30 a.m.  We were just settling in when we got a phone call about 2:30 a.m. from the manager.  I myself was nearly asleep.  The others were quietly watching TV and getting ready to retire.  The manager called to say that a room near us was complaining that
Manager Response: The employee who claimed to be the manager was not a manager.  My employee handled the situation very poorly and will not be working at the hotel by the end of this month.  I have since contacted the guest and offered a free night's stay in the future in our two bathroom Kid's suite as compensation.

Summary: We just returned from a five-day trip to Disneyland and spent four nights at Comfort Inn Maingate.   Exterior: Very attractive for a motel with lots of greenery, flowers, pleasant colors, and decorative DL banners.  Lobby: Small but nicely decorated and furnished.  Coffee and cocoa available all day. Chocolates were available during check-out which was nice.  Check-in: Quick and efficient.  We arrived more than an hour before Check In time and expected to have to leave our luggage and find lunch while waiting for our room, but they had our room ready immediately.  We were pleased. DL tickets:  Their website lists a VERY good price on DL park tickets for sale at the hotel, but when we arrived, we found out they no longer carried the 5-day tickets we wanted.  It was a VERY bumpy
Manager Response: This is a very fair and accurate review.  Thank you for spending the time to give me a better perspective of my property as I'm fairly new to it as well.  DL TICKETS: This was my bad judgment on not having those tickets in stock for them and should not be happening in the future.  I price the Disneyland tickets cheaper than any authorized reseller and in order to minimize overhead fees, I try to maintain a minimum stock on the 5-day tickets.  I maintained to minimum of a stock which caused the shortage.  ROOM ELECTRONICS: I'm working with the reviewer to isolate what room they stayed in so that I can find the issues they're referring to and fix them.  Due to my limited time, it can be difficult for me to isolate faulty electronics without a guest complaint.  In terms of the A/C units emitting a bad smell, we're currently working through every room to clean out the A/C units.  ROOM DECOR: Beginning last week, we've begun renovations of the rooms.  New hardwood, upholstered furniture, drapes, and picture frames will be installed.  We are estimating completion by the end of February 2008.  The wall vinyl and lamps are scheduled to be replaced next year.  The pillow top mattresses and bedding are new since this Spring along with the carpet.  BREAKFAST: I'll be double checking on those eggs to find out what could cause them to taste so bad.  LOCATION: I'm working on getting agreements with the local restaurants to give our guests extra discounts.  100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE: Please let us know of any problems in the future that we can solve during your stay.  If we can't solve them to your satisfaction at the time of your stay, you're entitled to one night free stay.  You can contact me via my cell phone direct by asking the front desk clerks to connect you to me or email me at contactme at jeffersonKim.com

Summary: For the price, this was an OK choice, but the mold smell was overpowering. We stayed in room 131, a kids suite. We had extended our stay by one additional day, which they were able to accomodate. The only problem was that the room we were assigned was the last available room to take for the days we were there.  The bathroom was clean looking initially (I have stayed in MUCH worse) but you could see the water damage around the tub, causing a mold problem.  The tiles were cracking and being pushed apart by mold growth.  It had a very unpleasant odor.  We kept the bathroom door shut, which helped a little, but when we woke up in the morning we were wheezing heavily.   The other thing that was bad was the water temperature.  My husband was showering our 4yr old son, and I heard
Manager Response: Thanks for submitting your review and giving me an inside look to my property.  I'm often not able to find all problems due to my limited time and I appreciate the feedback.  WATER ISSUES: We installed two new water heaters and a new circulation pump for the building that houses room 131 last Friday.  I'll be staying in room 131 either this week or next week to make sure the issues have fixed.  The old pumps and circulation pumps were very old, so that's why I think the customer had issues with the hot & cold water.  BATHROOM CONDITION: Some bathrooms will be getting re-tiled and re-walled in the next coming months along with new toilets.  We're currently in the midst of receiving new furniture until February and once the new furniture has been installed, we'll be working on the bathrooms.  Unless our hotel is completely full, we should have no problem in getting you moved to a different room where there is less mold.  Most rooms don't have mold issues, but that particular bathroom does.  ALLERGY ISSUES:  We are a 100% smoke and pet free hotel, so it's concerning for me to see that there are allergy issues.  The typical allergic responses have been from our A/C units in each room which have been getting cleaned out one by one, but I'll be doing more research to find the exact culprits.  I'm also researching the feasibility of having air purifying machines available to guests at the front desk.  You can check our hotel website at ComfortInnMaingate.com should we implement that.  $20 MORE FOR BETTER: I don't think you should have to pay $20 more/night for better quality.  We should had been able to provide that at the price you paid, and I'll be working diligently to make that happen in the future.  100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE: Please let us know of any problems in the future that we can solve during your stay.  If we can't solve them to your satisfaction at the time of your stay, you're entitled to one night free stay.  You can contact me via my cell phone direct by asking the front desk clerks to connect you or email me at contactme at jeffersonKim.com should there be any severe problems.

Summary: This is a very fairly priced, extremely friendly, cleaner than clean hotel.  We stayed two nights, 11/30 and 12/1 and couldn't have asked for better service or a cleaner room.  We reserved one of the kids suites and our girls had a blast in their "own" room.  The housekeeping was phenomenal and after my daughter left a necklace there, they found it and sent it through fed ex right to my door in Phoenix.  The complimentary breakfast was delicious with homemade waffles and plenty of food for all.  They even had coffee and hot cocoa in the lobby in the evenings!  We will definitely be staying here again VERY SOON!  Thanks for the wonderful experience!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: A 5 day stay at the Comfort Inn Maingate is a nightmare for someone with Asthema.  We stayed in a Kids suite.  The staff was very nice and was attentive to all questions we asked. We opened our door to our room and wondered what the smell was in the room.... ick.  We left the door open (brrr) to clear out the smell.  The next morning my daughter and I woke all choked up from something.  We went to shower and the tub was gross , wall behind the toilet was moldy and the mold was pushing up the wall paper. The water was actually dangerous for the kids because we were not able to regulate it.   We had the water perfect temperature and put the kids in the shower and it would get cold and then hot then hotter then really cold during the entire shower.  Baths were our only option for
Manager Response: none

Summary: I definitely recommend this hotel: customer service, room and rate.  Customer service was outstanding!  I forgot a pair of heirloom diamond studs in the room when we checked out.  By the time I called, the room had already been cleaned and no earrings found.  I asked them to please double check the bathroom counter.  I received a wonderful message that one stud had been found and all vacuums (yes, vacuums) had been checked for the second stud!  I called to have the one stud mailed to me at home.  It arrived FedEx and would you believe the other stud was in the envelope?!  I am so appreciative of the efforts the management and staff went through for me.  I would definitely stay there again!  And, of course, the kids suite with two bathrooms is great for families!  Especially for
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were booked intot his hotel as part of a 3 city trip to US this summer. We wanted to go to Los Angeles and were given this hotel which was really too far away from where we wanted to be. We only found out how far away it was from LA when we read up about it on the internet.  We were disappointed in this place. For a start, it's not a hotel, which we thought it was, as the other two places we were staying were in the Holiday Inn in New York and the Stratosphere in Las Vegas. I did not like my room being out in the open, if you like, not enclosed like a hotel. The first night we got there, we were put in room 102 and told it was close to the breakfast area. How close became apparent the next morning when we tried to open the curtains and saw about 20 people sitting right
Manager Response: I'm new management and am currently doing a lot of improvements to the hotel.  Here are some items I plan on improving:  1)  Increasing the size of the breakfast area and quality of food  2)  The pool is currently a full makeover.  Both the inside and areas around it are being repaved.  3)  New washer and dryer machines have been installed.  4)  I'll be working with housekeeping to increase cleanliness standards.  5)  New furniture and decor are currently in the process of being purchased.  Regarding our location, we are 5-10 minute direct shuttle to Disneyland and really too far away from Hollywood if that's your prime destination.  If both are your primary destinations, it actually may be more cost effective to stay here, as parking will end up being cheaper near Hollywood than Disneyland, and you can park free here when you go to Disneyland.  I recognize that people do not like having closed hallways for their hotels.  It can sometimes be helpful in that you can often park your car right next to your door, no matter where you're staying in the hotel.  Your feedback is important to me and I appreciate the time you took to type and submit the review.

Summary Heading: Great stay for the most part...
Summary: We stayed in one of the kids suites for 4 nights. You could not beat if for the price we paid.  We paid a little bit more for the 2 bathrooms because we are a family of 6 and it was worth it!  The breakfast was great, we used the pool everyday, and I even did laundry once.  The only complaints we had were that maid service was slow!  We had to call every day and say "What's up?" We stayed there when we went to Disneyland, and after getting to the park early in the morning you want to come back to your hotel room some for down time in the afternoon before heading back to the park for the evening.  Well that is the exact same time that maid service wants to come and clean your room.  Not very convienient when you are trying to get your 2 year old to take a nap. Other than that I
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments and critique.  I'm the new General Manager, so I'll be looking into the housekeeper service quality and solving the response time issue.  Typically, each housekeeper has about 30 minutes to clean the small rooms, and 45 minutes for the larger kids' suites.  Each housekeeper is assigned a block of about 15 rooms to clean in their shift.  If you plan on coming in the middle of the day, please give us a call and we can let the housekeeper assigned to your room know so that the room can be cleaned earlier.

Summary Heading: The kids suite is awsome for families who love Disneyland
Summary: We had a family kids suite.   great price ,great location it suited our famlies needs quite good breakfast bar is ok but do check out Denny's or Baker's Square near by. Transportation to Disneyland is awsome using the ART system and it pickup location is about 100 metres away. The room is comfortable with clean bathrooms.  Staff is excellent. A great place to be when you are at Disneyland for 12 hours where you usally crash in your room from exhustion.
Manager Response: Thanks for your compliments!  I'm glad you felt we were a good value.

Summary: We have just returned from staying at the Comfort Inn, Maingate, I would like to say how impressed we were with the service and helpfulness of the staff and how comfortable and clean the rooms were.  The complementary continental breakfast was very welcome.  Before we left I had the misfortune of reading a review of the hotel by a previous guest, it was not a good review, and it filled us with apprehension as to what we were going to in Anaheim.  That report did not do the hotel or it's staff justice and with regards to the complementary continental breakfast, if it wasn't that good the breakfast room would not have been full every morning, which it was.  If we ever go back to Ananheim we would certainly stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in room 129 - a suite. It was basically two rooms knocked into one with some basic furniture. The carpet was dirty, the room smelled, and the bedspread looked like something from the early '80's. There was evidence of some upgrading - a new shower rod in the bathroom, but overall it was dingy. On the plus side, the staff were pleasant and helpful, the wi-fi was good, and the room wasn't very expensive. We were attending a trade show and so didn't spend much time there - which is the only way to do this room...
Manager Response: Thanks for your input on the suite.  We have gone through some more renovations and have new bed sheets and carpet.  Regarding the smell, I'll have to double check to see if it's still there.  I'm the new general manager, so I'll be checking and fixing the issues you've been pointing out.  I'll be updating our main site (you can google it) with pictures and a video tour of the new renovations.

Summary: Spent 8 nights at Comfort Inn, Maingate, Anaheim.  Great room, nice and tidy, and not too bad a  size.  Free breakfast everymorning was nice, and the pool was heated.  Staff where friendly, and the bus stop was outside
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pretty nice but had some problems.
Summary: We stayed here Jan 2-5 2007 on a trip to Disneyland.  It was pretty nice but we did have some problems. We paid 107.00 per night  for a  2 queen beds/bunkbeds/2 bathroom suite.  This hotel is not really walking distance to Disneyland in our opinion but it is on the ART  Red Trolley line which picks up next door.  I believe we paid 2.00 or 3.00 per person for a days use.  Otherwise I would suggest driving yourself because after walking all day at Disneyland, it's a long long walk back to the room.    The hotel was easy to find with easy in and out of the parking lot.  The parking lot was a little cramped.  Not much room between cars and all the spaces were pretty much full each morning when we left.  We didn't use the pool.  It was decent looking and located in the middle of the
Manager Response:
The water problem has since been fixed. We installed three new water heaters for the entire building.

The hotel has since gone under complete renovations: New Pillow top mattresses, new bedding, new curtains, new carpets, and new furniture. The pool has also been resurfaced in November of 2007.

Summary: As a place to stay when you go to Disneyland I think this is a good option for a less expensive hotel. Some of the bad reviews just don't make sense to me -  such as - same breakfast every day. Of course you'll get the same breakfast every day. I don't think I've ever been anywhere where they changed their free continental breakfast daily.  You have to be realistic. You're not going to a Le Meridian it's a Comfort Inn!  I just got back from a weekend at this hotel and I was very satisfied. The room is basic but clean, beds are comfortable, the staff was friendly and the breakfast is decent. There is a shuttle to Disneyland that stops at the hotel next door every 20 minutes. You can walk to Disneyland but if you have little kids or are just tired at the end of the day pay the $3
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was not satisfied at all with this motel.  I had booked the motel  and throught that I had booked a great place for a good price.  Boy, was I surprised as I had read so many good reviews on the motel. As we entered the room, the room had a old, musty odor and the place did not "look" or "feel" clean.  The rooms are terribly outdated and in need of major renovations.  We had booked the kids suite with bunkbeds.  This was the only positive I saw- room for all of us-2 adults and 3 kids.   The bathroom had a shower/tub and a toilet.  You could barely use the toilet and have room to shut the bathroom door.  The bathroom was that tiny.  Breakfast consisted of fruit, cereal, oatmeal, pastry, and make your own waffles.  The breakfast area was very small and we barely found a spot to
Manager Response: I'm the new general manager in service beginning this past Monday!  Since this review, we have done renovations that mitigate the issues disclosed here.  Also, the breakfast area has been expanded to include more seating.  It is substantially less crowded and hectic (such as the fact that we have two waffle makers instead of one!).  The improvements can be seen in more recent reviews.  I will admit that this hotel has had some major problems before the renovations, but now after the renovations the quality has improved dramatically and will continue to improve under my management.

Summary: Room looked as if it hadn't been updated in 30 years, with lime green carpet and sponge cake mattresses.  Horrible moldy smell coming out of A/C unit.  Free breakfast was a mass feeding frenzy with hungry hotel guests all fighting for the single waffle maker.  I gave Hotwire an earful for booking us this sorry excuse for a hotel.  Thank fully it was only for 2 nights.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay near disneyland
Summary: This is my 2nd stay at this hotel within the past year.  This stay was 7/24-7/26:  We had a King sized bed and liked the fact that the whole hotel is non-smoking.  We didn't take advantage of the free breakfast but did use the refrig. for picnic supplies.   I like the fact that this hotel is close to Disneyland, on the trolley loop, have in room safes and laundry facilities.    I woud highly recommend this hotel to families going to disney as well as anyone else staying in the area.    We felt safe staying there being 2 females.
Manager Response: none

Summary: spent 2 nights there. we rented junior suit that comes with an extra bedrrom with bunk bed. excellent for kids. the room was clean, continental breakfast was as usual - nothing special. there  was some kind of teenager (graduation?) gathering in the hotel and its parking lot, a bit noisy, but didn't bother us too much, can happen at any similar priced hotel I guess. sdisney huttle stop is within 100 feet from the office
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for three nights in July at this motel. We checked in at midnight (the lobby was closed so you have to speak through the side window-yuck) and then got to our room. The room itself was fine, very basic but what you need when going to Disneyland. The bed was VERY firm. The fridge was not very cold. The people on the upper level can be noisy. The pool is small. the breakfast is so-so but hey it is free. If you pay around $50 a night you got a good deal, especially in the summer. If I had a choice I would not stay there again, I would pony up the dough for a nicer place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I stayed for 1 week. The only good thing I can say about this motel is that their continental breakfast was pretty good. Fresh waffles, toast, oranges and apples, juice, coffee, 3 types of cereals, milk, pastries and hard boiled eggs. Their location is good and there are several restaurants nearby. The Disneyland Express stops in front and the Disney Resort Bus stops next door. Disneyland is only a 10-15 minute walk from the motel.   From there, it's all down hill. The beds were like lying on a wooden box. Don't take your shoes off, the floor is filthy. No microwave as advertised. Maid service was hit & miss. Coffee packets and cups were not left 3 of 7 days and we also had to hunt down the maids for clean towels. None of them seemed to speak english so trying to
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just got back from our Disneyland vacation. The rooms were very clean we upgraded to a kids suite ( which our kids loved) we were very happy with the accomidations except the last night we were there the motel had rented rooms to what I think were teenagers who had went to prom. It was really loud but upon calling to complain they were already handeling the situation. We will definately stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The Best Motel We Have Stayed In...
Summary: The rooms were very clean and huge. We stayed here 1 night at the Comfort Inn Miangate. The beds were comfortable and the room was cheap for the price. The free breakfast was very good and had a variety of choices. If your eating in the breakfast room, you can also watch on thier plasma TV screens there. If your planning to go to Disneyland, you should take the shuttle or your car. If you walk, it will take forever. It was not noisy at all, it was quiet and peaceful. There was plenty of hot water and it made our trip to Disneyland  a memorable one. Hopefully, if you stay in this hotel, your trip will be too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for 2 nights to go to Disneyland, the hotel was clean, and ok for the price.  The breakfast was crowded and didn't seem to have enough to feed everyone.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just got back from a 4 night stay here.  Things that we liked about the Comfort Inn Maingate...   The staff was very friendly and courteous. We asked for extra pillows and got them right away. Our room was cleaned everyday and fresh towels and soaps were left each time.  Priced very reasonably.  It's the first stop on the ART to and from Disneyland. A definite bonus since the buses filled up quickly and later stops often weren't able to get on because it was too full.  Free continental breakfast was nice. It was basic stuff (danishes, waffles, apples, oranges, cheerios, oatmeal, watered down juice & coffee). Not really nutritious overall, but helpful to the budget.  The standard room with 2 queen beds was quite large.. bigger than most others we've stayed at.  Plenty of hot
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Comfort Inn Maingate is a great place to stay at a great price for your Disneyland vacation.  We stayed in one of their Family Suites.  The suite was two queen beds and a bunk bed.  It was basic but everything we needed.  Clean and comfortable and a place to sleep after long days at Disneyland.  The breakfast is simple:  cereal, rolls, toast, frozen waffles (for the toaster), fruit, juices, milk and coffee.  It was enough.  The breakfast area was adequate but could be too small at really busy times.  The Comfort Inn is too far from the Disneyland entrance to walk (especially after a long Disney day).  We drove to the park everyday and paid the $10 for parking.  There are hotels directly across from the Disneyland entrance.  If you're looking for one of those check out the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A more than adequate Place for Great Price
Summary: I would say that for over 60+ a night during the peak Christmas Season is definitely a very great price indeed for this place. I would say that the amenities in the rooms are actually more than just the average chain hotels. First of all, the complimentary breakfast is a plus... although only the basic pancakes and toast and cinnamon rolls, etc. It reduces the need to go around looking for breakfast in the mornings. Second of all, the rooms were big, my fiance and I stayed in the Standard King which actually comes with a sofa bed as well. All the standard amenities and I have to say... 100 channels of free cable is impressive. All the rooms come equipped with complimentary wireless internet (another amazing plus).. the only drawback of this place is in its relative distance to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very decent and helpful for tourists!
Summary: As a young couple we stayed here in mid december. I read all the reviews on this site prior to selecting the hotel. Although i can understand how some people may have found particular aspects of the hotel negative, we really enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were clean and nicely organised. The bathroom was decent sized. The rooms were good sized. There was free wireless internet and free breakfast. the breakfast was good - orange juice, lemonade, the usual. The staff were all very friendly, and the maids very polite. As an overseas traveler, the front desk staff were very willing to help with tours and other arrangements, calling taxis etc. There were many restaurants and takeaway stores within walking distance. Also a Target and Pharmacy. The only aspect which could be improved

Summary: I tried to post the same review on Expedia because we booked through them but they would not post it. Funny, all of their "reviews" are positive. My wife and I chose the Comfort Inn Maingate for our trip to Disneyland in September. We had the kid's suite. We were not happy. They had recently cleaned the carpets but didn't let them dry before giving us the room. The a/c unit in the kid's room smelled of urine when turned on. Summary: Better than expected for under a hundred bucks, got the kids suite with bunk beds, great for 2 adults and two 5-year olds, probably could have done one more kid in there.  cable for 1 of 2 TVs didnt work well, the maint. crew tried but could only barely fix it, but not a big issue since we werent there that much.  front desk was very helpful.  breakfast was crowded and average, but adequate.  trolley transit is crowded and slightly inconvenient time-wise, but a short walk, and cheaper than parking at disney, so take your pick.  didnt try pool.

Summary Heading: Very nice and pleasant stay! Great Motel!
Summary: We recently stayed here in October '05 for 6 nights. Cant understand why anyone would give it a bad review. Everything was Clean, Kept up nicely and the hotel and housekeeping staff were VERY friendly and helpful. It's unfortunate some negative/unthankful people have to try and ruin a nice stay for everyone else. We booked a kids Suite, which was very nice, (kids didnt even want to come in parents room), they had their own TV and bathroom, sink etc, with a door seperating the rooms. Continental Breakfast was great for the Kids, while we (parents ate at Denny's). No complaints from the kids at all. Summary: Be sure you really check out this hotel before staying here. #1 the outside lights leading to the room were not working and because we were on the 2nd floor on the back of the hotel you could not see at all. Needless to say I had a very bad fall and when the hotel office was called on it they were very rude about the whole thing. I payed my total bill and double checked that I was paid through the day we left. I was then called my hotel manager and told that if we did not pay 120.00 more that we would be kicked out a day earlier than we paid for so we had to pay it. When told about my fall he said he would reimburse us for the wheelchair I had to rent for the remaining 6 days of our Disneyland trip. Summary Heading: More than expected for the money.
Summary: During our visit in May we stayed at the Comfort Inn Maingate and it was far better than we expected. We had 10 of us in our group so we needed a lot of room. We got two of the 2 bathroom kid suites. They included two bathrooms each and two queen bed. Then there was a small seperate room that had a set of bunk beds for the kids it was great. Everything was very clean and house keeping did a great job cleaning up. The only complant that I would have is the  breakfast. It was minimal (cereal, fruit, and a few dry pastries) but there is a Denny's just bit up the street. I would recomend the Anaheim resort transit Bus because the motel is farther than we like to walk from Disneyland. But the bus stop is convienent and is only like $3 a day.

Summary: The room was part of our Southwest Airlines Disney package and we could not have picked a better place to stay.  We had a newly remodeled King Room, with a safe, refrigerator and coffee maker.  The room was clean, the shower had plenty of pressure and hot water and it drained without problem.  When we returned each day our room was clean and they left us plenty of clean towels.  The shuttle picked us up and dropped us off at Disneyland each day without problem.  There are plenty of places within walking distance to eat, if you don't want to eat at the park.  They serve a free continental breakfast each morning, which is great if you have kids or want to grab something light before heading out for the day.
